text: Me and My family have family game nights on the weekend as were always going to our vacation home . We like to go there so we can spend time together away from the tv, electronics, phones and friends. We have played many board games over the last couple years and with my oldest daughter being 10 and getting more into card games such as rummy and playing war, gold fish ,solitaire and what not with her sisters I thought when I seen this nerts game that it would be perfect and fun for the whole family.When it came in the mail I was surprised at the size of the main box was. Wasn't large like i thought it would be so perfect to travel with and comes with everything you need . A small pencil, small scoring pad and 6 boxes of cards- red, black, silver, blue, green and yellow. The only thing I was disappointed in is that there wasn't instructions just visit a website to learn to play so the first weekend we took with us we weren't able to play nerts BUT we did play other card games since the website wouldn't load on my phone since we had no signal in the woods. ( When getting this I would suggest learning to play before going anywhere's so you can teach others - which once watching its very easy).The cards are regular playing cards with 52 cards, all 4 symbols and jokers- the back are a bold color back with nerts written on it. They are great though, easy to slide , solid -not paper thin and fun colors to pick from.This nerts game set was provided to me at no cost for evaluation. I did not promise to post a review, but I stated that if I did review the product, it would be an honest,unbiased review.I am very pleased with this set and would highly recommend it to others. The cards are made well- comes with everything you need and once you play nerts which is easy and easy to learn , its fast pace and fun and sure your family will have a great night of family fun. You can also find other games out there where you will need more then one set of cards and this set would be perfect.Would make the perfect gift for family's, teens or anybody . Would also be a great set for somebody who plays cards all the time to where they are always needing another set there's 6 in one for a great price.

Me and my family - husband and 3 kids play family games each night over the weekend as were normally at our family vacation home. There are times when my parents, aunts and cousins come up so playing monopoly is out of the question as there's to many people. I have been looking for a game that would be more adult based so when when I came across this 3 pack of charades I thought this would be perfect.Let me tell you I don't know who laughed more the adults who were playing or the kids who were watching the adults. On Friday night we did the adults only and played Rock and roll. On Saturday we mixed it up a little not only did we allow the kids on the teams to guess and help act out with the adults but we took all 3 packs (Hollywood, Party animal and Rock and roll ) and mixed them all together.I don't think I had so much fun with a game ever and gives you a mixture and wide range of categories.Charades is an acting game were a  player acts out a word / phrase, Sometimes acting out similar-sounding words. The goal is to use physical rather than verbal language in limited time to convey the meaning to another party .This set has some hard phrases/words to act out or guess but on each card there's 3 to choice from so either you will be able to pick one you think you and team can get or have a good laugh trying to get. Me being 32 there was some I was like WHAT THE so.I would think 10-14+ age is a little off but sure they will have just as much fun.This set is perfect for traveling and family vacations as each box comes with everything you will need.  Each box has a timer, score pad, pencil,  instructions on how to play and clues to get you started as well as 180 different charades .These charade games were provided to me at no cost for evaluation. I did not promise to post a review, but I stated that if I did review the product, it would be an honest,unbiased review.I would highly recommend this charades games to anybody to have for holidays, get togethers, work party's or anytime you are going to have more then a handful of people. Im sure there will be lots of fun and laughs- and if like me lots of pictures to laugh at. I love this and plan to get friends and family sets as gifts as its perfect to have at the house for a time when you need to live in up the party.

I have 3 daughters 10, 8 and 6 who are all in elementary school. Ever since they were born I have always looked for fun learning toys and tools. To help them learn and have fun while learning so want to learn more.Of course we have a lot of electronic toys that help but I have been looking for more hands things that would help. My oldest is in 5th grade and doing pretty good in math but having some issues so thought these would be perfect.When they came in the mail the box sounded like it was going to be a big mess as everything was shaking around inside. But to my surprise the wooden separator actually has a slide on lid which I really like so none of the pieces will get lost when taking it from room to room or while having in the closet.This set is not only helpful for the older kids with math but also younger as well my daughter & niece were separating the pieces into different sections,they were  making patterns , and teaching my niece her colors and shapes and asking what the #'s were on each wooden piece.There's so many things there's wooden pieces can be used for:*adding*subtracting*colors*patterns  ****pretty much any math problem ( use your imagination it can be done with them just flip them over to not see the  1,10,100,1000) These  can help with hands on learning in MANY different ways you can think of. The set is made from high quality finished/colored wood to not only help learn but make it fun.  The set comes with a wooden case to separate the pieces as well as  35 #1's, 30 #10's, 30 #100's and More !This colorful mathematics stamp set was provided to me at no cost for evaluation. I did not promise to post a review, but Istated that if I did review the product, it would be an honest,unbiased review.I would 100 % recommend this to anybody with children.This set is not only perfect for young kids but also middle and high school age children male or female- for when you are trying to help with with a problem you can show them as I know showing me and having me have hands on helps more then just talking. Also perfect for daycare and classrooms. Would make a perfect gift as well. Each piece and the set is well made and great price.This has helped my daughter already in the short time we have had it and that's what counts !

Having 3 daughters of my own who are no longer infants but having friends and family who do when I came across these silicone baby teething toys I thought they were very interesting. With my friend who lives next door who's always coming over with her little girl that is teething shes 8 months old. I thought it would be perfect to have something at the house here.When they came in the mail of course I couldn't wait to test them out on my friends little girl to see if they would give her relive or if she would even like them.These teethers are AWESOME.Not only does she like them as they are bright, fun , bold colors but in fun shapes as if they are also a toy. I put the little teddy in the freezer so when she got board with the elephant I grabbed the other and was like a hole new thing.There's so many positive things about these :* the teddy bear has in prints on the back that help with teething and rubbing on the gums* they are made from silicone so can be frozen and cleaned in boiling water* comes with a  pacifier clip that attaches to EACH teether so don't have to worry about it dropping on the floor or ground* the  pacifier clip has teethers all the way down it* the fact that is all made of silicone so you dont have to worry about any rough edges cutting gumsI'm jealous they didn't have something like this when my girls were little. No more boring teethers!These teethers with pacifier clip were provided to me at no cost for evaluation. I did not promise to post a review, but Istated that if I did review the product, it would be an honest,unbiased review.I would 100 % recommend these to anybody who has a little one OR would make the best baby shower gift. Well made, fun and so easy to care for and great price and most of all does an amazing job .

My oldest daughter who is 10 loves jewelry and has been taken pretty good care of the old things I have gave her that were mine that I never wear. When I came across this galaxy crescent moon necklace I thought she would love it . I went ahead and got it and thought it would be a great gift for either her birthday or Christmas.When it came in the mail I was shocked a how nice it really was for the cost of the necklace. I thought it was going to be a little big for mine or daughters liking and pretty heavy. Its actually the perfect size to where you don't have to be nose to nose to see the detail in the pendant or the pendant its self. Almost the same size as a half dollar piece. As for the weight its perfect not light to where its going to be blowing in the wind or weighing our neck down.I love all the swirls in the moon, most look like swirl hearts as well as the galaxy actually hangs from the top of the moon instead of being attached.This pendant does come on a silver 19 inch detailed chain link style necklace. The necklace has a lobster still clasp so its easy to put on by your self but not going to come loss or open itself and make you loss the necklace or pendant.This necklace  was provided to me at no cost for evaluation. I did not promise to post a review, but I stated that if I did review the product, it would be an honest,unbiased review.This is a very pretty necklace and pendant . Looks like you got it from a high end department store but not top dollar jewelry store. Very detailed and you will get many compliments on it. I gave it to my daughter the day it came in the mail as i couldn't wait and she just LOVES it and many people have stopped to talk to her about it since she wears it daily. A lot said it reminds them of the saying " I love you to the moon and back " and wanted to know where she got it.I highly recommend this to others for yourself, your girlfriend or child - great to dress up your out fit or everyday where. Well made , AMAZING price and just all around Beautiful .

My daughter is a big fan of Ensasa fashion since she got her first tank top and leggings from them a few months ago. Since the clothes are very well prices its been a lot easier to get her more of the new punk/fun fashion that she likes. When buying from Ensasa fashion I know its going to be made well and to her liking.When she came across this Babmetal halter tank top she didn't know what babmetal was but she liked the design even thought its not very colorful like most of her clothes. She liked it because of all the detail in it and reminds her of day of the dead. The design isnt printed/ironed  on the shirt so wont come off or crack when wearing or washing.The top is made from  82% Polyester and 18% LYCRA .She normally wears an adult med. and fits her perfect but with the material is made of it does stretch so think it would be perfect on a Large with no issues at all.  Its the perfect material for hot summer days.Very light and breathable very comfortable on the skin. As well as it being a halter top it shows enough skin but not to much.My daughter has worn this a couple times already since having it and people ask her all the time wear she got it. We have washed it by hand and in the washer and air dried and tumbled dry - we didn't notice any shrinking or changes in the top or print . All the threads were still in tacked as the day we got them.This shirt was provided to me at a discount for evaluation. I did not promise to post a review, but I stated that if I did review the product, it would be an honest,unbiased review.I would highly recommend this halter top to anybody looking for a fun , comfortable, well made , affordable shirt. My daughter suggest it Would make a great gift for any teen or young adult ( perfect for adults who like this type of design as well).

My daughter and her friends are really into leggings this year. Her best friends birthday was coming up and loves mermaids so when I came across these leggings I knew they would be perfect. We have got other leggings from Ensasa Fashion in the past and just loved them . These were no different.My daughter was a little jealous that she had to give them to her friend as a gift as she really liked them. As for her friend she loved them.The day after her party she came over with them on and they looked good on her. Shes a little short but these were perfect on her . Even with her being short they were just a little bunched up towards the bottom but once she put her high tops on you couldn't tell.These leggings are great. Normally my daughter & friend both wear a size medium in adult/jr's and these fit them perfect. The waist is elastic so if your thin or have a little belly they will fit. Also if you have a butt no worries as these are made from  elasticity spandex material to do stretch.The design on this pair of leggings is very bold and bright in color which is a green/blue and black scales of a dragon or mermaid tale. Its in the fabric so you don't have to worry about when washing that the design will fade or come off. The girls are talking about maybe being a mermaid for Halloween and wearing these leggings.These leggings aren't like others they have, where you can see threw them so HAVE to wear something over them. You can wear them alone , with a long shirt, under a dress or like my girls they normally wear there bootie shorts over them so they can wear their shorts to school.These leggings were provided to me at a discount for evaluation. I did not promise to post a review, but I stated that if I did review the product, it would be an honest,unbiased review.I would 100 % recommend these leggings to others as they are made well, very comfortable on and GREAT price. As well as super fun to wear !

I have been looking around for a robe for my husband. He had one when he was younger and said he really liked it and since he out grew it he trys to put mine on when he gets cold or out the shower but its more of pajama robe for warmth and its pink with clouds on it. I've been looking and haven't found one that he would really like til I came across this Men's camp True timber New Conceal Accent & Black Fleece Long Robe.I have got a couple other products from Camo Chique Boutique before and they were very well made and great all the way around. This robe was provided to me at a discount price . I did not promise to post a review, but I stated that if I did review the product, it would be an honest, unbiased reviewWhen this came in the mail my husband loved . He said it has the perfect amount of camo that isn't doesn't make you feel like your dressing to go hunting. The edges of the sleeves and pockets and opening/collar all have about an inch of true timber camouflage .The robe is made from Polyester fleece so very soft on the skin to make you nice and cozy. This robe closes with a self tie belt. One of his favorite parts is that it has 2 pockets in the front so he can put his phone in one & the remote in the other so when he walks out of the room we don't change the channel on it.The robe is true to its size and goes to about knee length which is perfect.We did wash it with like colors and tumble dried it and it looked as if it was brand new- no fading or shrinking that was noticeable.Every string since it came in the mail and even after washing was nice and tight with no loss ends .My did put it on the other day when getting out of the shower and put it on the hook and air dried and didn't take long to dry which was nice as I thought it would hold the water and need to be washed again.We have been completely happy with this product & would highly recommend to anybody. Would make a great father's day , anniversary, birthday gift for any man . Or just to replace your robe with an amazing robe to put on in the evenings when it gets chilli while laying around the house as well.

I have 3 daughters  & 3 nieces who are always trying to use my sun glasses while we are driving down the road. It was time I got them each a pair to leave in my truck for when this occurs. Yes they have other sun glasses but they always seem to forget them.When I came across these Steam punk Turbo Sunglasses sold by Style Vault I knew my niece Star would love them. They come in 3 different  colors black, silver and mirrored pink and black which I got her as they were totally her style.Luckily the day they came in it was sunny out and she was with us going away for the weekend and I had them in the truck so when she asked for my glasses I told her put these on and she screamed.They are SUPER cute. The frames are made of a very durable plastic with black and pink on the inside and outside of the frame and look really fun and bold together. As well as plastic lens. The lens are a mirrored blended lens so are also a fun punk style with different shades depending on the light your in.My niece is 12 years old and these glasses fit her face/head perfect. They didn't squeeze her temple and wore then for the 3 hour trip as well as the rest of the afternoon and said that they were very comfortable around the ears and nose and could wear all day every day. My 6 year old asked my niece to try them on to see if she liked them and they fit her pretty good as well .These sun glasses were provided to me at no cost for evaluation. I did not promise to post a review, but I stated that if I did review the product, it would be an honest, unbiased review.I would 100 % recommend these glasses to anybody with a child who likes sunglasses or wants a very nice stylish pair . They have the punk turbo style that would be great for girls or boys. They are very well made and durable and an amazing price you cant beat.The glasses do come in a cloth storage bag which I like so when not wearing the lens don't get scratched from putting in glove box. Also the customer support is prompt and very easy to work with as well as shipping is very fast.These would make a perfect gift ! They are 5 star kid approved !

One thing that runs in my family is high blood pressure and last time I went to the doctors they told me mine was high but didn't want to put me on meds and wanted me to watch it. I have come across many blood pressure monitors and cuffs but didn't think I would be able to get the exact reading on a manual one. When I came across this measupro digital upper arm monitor I thought it would be prefect.Of course as soon as it came in I wanted to test it out to see if it was accurate and I had been to the doctors earlier that day so know about what it was running. I loved the fact since I didn't know what the monitor ran off of I couldn't go get the right battery's that this came with them so can use right away. It was the exact reading that I had at the doctors office only an hour before. So right on the dot.This monitor is far behind like any other monitor and easy for any age to use. I think its perfect for elderly people who have a hard time reading as the digital numbers are large and very bold on the lCD screen. Its very simple to use you put the cuff on and push the button and it pumps the needed air into the cuff - after a few seconds it slowly lets the air out and gives you a reading. I love the fact that the screen will be blue when good, yellow when a little high and red when its to high.This monitor comes with an instruction book that tells you how to set up the monitor, which each symbol that comes across the screen means, also about blood pressure and what it should be and what is pre-hypertension and crisis need medical care pressures would be.It also saves up to 60 of your previous pressures . It allows you to save up to 2 peoples different info which is perfect that you don't have to worry about who's is who's and writing things down .This machine was provided to me at a discount for evaluation. I did not promise to post a review, but I stated that if I did review the product, it would be an honest, unbiased review.I would 100 % recommend this to any teacher, school nurse or even a doctors office and perfect from home use. Very easy to read and use. It comes with everything you need he cuff, monitor , instruction book with health info as well as battery's. Its made very well with high quality material and a GREAT price . Im so impressed with this blood pressure monitor I am going to be getting my grandfather and mother one for them as well.

I love bath fizzies. I think they make the perfect gifts for nearly any occasion. And I love getting them. The Pure Sanctum bath bomb gift set is amazing! There are six different fragrances in the box and all them smell wonderful! I think my favorite is the Coco Bombe because I have very dry skin and this leaves my legs and body feeling silky smooth. For my daughter I love the Big Easy - the french lavender really calms her down and puts her to bed. But all 6 scents are fab. I gave the bath bombs a 5 star review because they are made with natural ingredients, they are vegan and gluten free, do not contain any artificial colors or synthetic fragrances, they are sulfate free, phthalate free and contain non-GMO ingredients. I received the bath bombs at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. All thoughts and opinions expressed are 100% my own.

How cute is this! Halloween is one of my most favorite times of year. The weather is beautiful and little kids are dressed up all cute as can be. Even though I'm an adult I want to dress up too. But not the same as those little kiddos running around. The Inspired Silver Grinning Pumpkin Halloween bracelet lets me partake in the Halloween festiveness without looking tacky. I can wear this work, around town or just at home. It has a braided chain so it gives it a casual dressy feel. I just love it! The clasp is secure so no need to worry about it falling off while you are wearing it. I gave the bracelet a 5 star review because it's classy, festive, fits well, has a secure clasp and sturdy bracelet. I received the bracelet at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. All thoughts and opinions are 100% my own.

Manners and compassion are two big things we are working at instilling in my daughter this year. The Good Deeds Manager is a great way to help. So with this manager you are given some straws of hay. With each good deed you do you get a piece to put in the manager to make a bed for Baby Jesus. The object is to have a nice soft bed of hay ready for Baby Jesus's arrival on Christmas Eve. I think this is a great way to get your child thinking about their actions and thinking about those around them and how to help others. It's also a way to get your child out of the me me me commercialism that the holiday season can turn into. My daughter is excited to earn her straw this year. She's already thinking of ways to earn a little each day. I gave the Good Deeds Manager a 5 star review because it brings families together, teaches children to think of others, reminds us that the season is not all about presents and what we get but what  can we do to help others and it's incredible teaching tool. I received the Good Deeds Manager at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. All thoughts and opinions expressed are 100% my own.

Every year for Christmas Eve I make a box with a new set of PJs and a few other things for my daughter to help get her through the excitement of the night. Well this year I'm adding in a set of Pjs for her doll! Just to be sure these would work I tried them on her AG doll while she was at school. Perfect fit! I thought it was fairly easy to get the outfit on and off. The top buttons down the front, the pants slip on and so do the slippers. The stitching is done well, there were no lose strings or buttons. I gave the PJ set a 5 star review because it fits our AG doll, is easy to get on and off the doll and it made well. I received the PJ set at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. All thoughts and opinions expressed are 100% my own.

The holidays are near and I'm on the look out for some presents for a special little girl and her AG doll Grace. The Irish Step Dancing outfit is adorable! The detail in the dress is right on with how an Irish dancers costume would be. The dress is easy enough for a child to get on and off a doll and it fit well on our AG doll Grace. I love how the whole outfit is included for a fraction of the price of what I would pay for just a dress at AG. The stitching on the clothing is done well, the seems are solid. I gave the Irish Step Dancing dress a 5 star review because it's full of detail, fits our AG doll Grace, is easy enough for a child to get on and off a doll and comes with the whole complete outfit. I received this doll dress at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. All thoughts and opinions expressed are 100% my own.

I recently bought a smart tv and I was unaware that ti would work faster if it was connected directly to the internet rather than connected via wifi. Well, my internet connect is a little ways from the television. The brainstormer 10 foot Cat6 ethernet cable is perfect for this! I can run the cable from the jack all the way to the television and I even have enough cable to tack it to the baseboards to keep it from getting tripped on. Now I am able to use all the features on my smart tv and stream movies without the dreaded buffering spinning circle. I gave the Brainstormer 10 foot cable a 5 star review because I was able to connect my smarttv from a distance to my internet and now I can stream movies without delay. I received the cable at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. All thoughts and opinions expressed are 100% my own.

he holidays are right around the corner. For me, that means spending a fair amount of time in the kitchen cooking meals for the family. More time than normal. And cooking for larger groups. The KUKPO 5 quart colander will come in handy when making some of those dishes.So I bet you are wondering why the holidays will be easier with this around the house. Well, it's going to make time in the kitchen easier. Think about when I have to drain all those cans of green beans to make my famous green been casserole. I can drain all the cans into the colander without have to take a break and dump them into the dish. There's plenty of room!Once I'm done boiling those 5 pounds of taters I can dump them in the KUKPO 5 quart colander. It's a large enough colander they should all fit. Then I can dump them back into the pot and get to mashing! I can see myself using this kitchen tool time and time again with various recipes. When you are cooking for a large group it's nice to have tools that can handle large capacities.How about making a huge batch of spaghetti and meatballs for game day? All that pasta can easily be strained with this colander. No need to worry about it overflowing and going to waste.  I received the colander complimentary in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. All thoughts and opinions expressed are 100% my own.

Adorable! That is the first thought that comes to mind when I see this piece. My daughter is really into the Holidays and wanted a Halloween necklace so incredibly bad. My skin feels healthier and I can breathe a little easier. I gave the Best Organic Exfoliating Body Scrub a 5 star review because it serves several purposes for me, it makes me feel better when I use it and I love how it makes my skin feel. I received the scrub at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. All thoughts and opinions expressed are 100% my own.

I have a 14 year old Maine Coon that loves to play. But sometimes he can be a tad annoying. So I like to spray the I Love Catnip! on his favorite toys. Then he plays with his toys and leaves me alone. He really does seem to love it when I give his favorite toys a little splash. I am always looking for ways to improve my skin. And one of those ways is with regular exfoliation. Dead Sea Salt Facial Exfoliation is a wonderful way to get the dead, dry and tired skin removed from my face on a regular bases. Now this is an organic scrub so you have to use it fairly fast or it will spoil. Without the preservatives it doesn't have a long shelf life. I like using the brush for several reasons; it helps to avoid contamination of the scrub because I am not dipping my fingers into it, it helps me control how much I use and it's just fun. I like to use the dead sea salt scrub about twice a week just to keep my skin looking it's best. For me using a bottle before it spoils is not difficult. But if you are someone who doesn't need to use it very often you could also use it on your knees and elbows to keep those area's looking fab too! I gave the dead sea salt facial exfoliating scrub a 5 star review because it was gentle on my skin while removing dead skin, the shea butter offered some moisturizing benefits and it was simple to use. I received the scrub at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. All thoughts and opinions expressed are 100% my own.

My mornings are crazy so anything I can do to help make them run smoother I am going to do. And one of those things is having a blender sponge. I love the pro beauty flawless makeup sponge blender. I use the large pink one for my foundation to get a quick all over coverage. I use the orange one to blend my cream eye shadows together. And the other two are going to be backups for now. The blenders are easy to hold and do a beautiful job at smoothing and blending my makeup together to give me a flawless look. I gave the sponges a 5 star review because they are comfortable to hold, help blend my eye shadow for a feathered look, gives me full coverage with my foundation and doesn't absorb a ton of cosmetics. I received the sponges at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. All thoughts and opinions expressed are 100%.

I worked in a linen store for several years throughout college and because that I am a sheet snob. Nothing below 1000 thread count allowed in my home. I chose the white 1800 thread count sheet set in queen for my sofa sleeper. Even the guest get the best! When the sheet set arrived I took them out of the packaged and immediately I noticed how soft they were. We had company coming over so I needed to get them laundered and on the sofa as soon as possible. Even though I have a little thicker sofa sleeper than standard it is still not the equivalent of a real mattress. So I tucked the excess fitted sheet under the mattress. Even with all that excess sheet it stayed on. And my guest loved it! They were surprised at how soft the sheets were. I gave the Mellanni Bed Sheet Set a 5 star review because they fit my sofa sleeper wonderfully despite the thin nature of the mattress, didn't slip off and were incredibly soft. I received the sheet set at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. All thoughts and opinions expressed are 100% my own.

I just love this retractable kabuki brush! The pink color is adorable, it's a very soft pink. I can use this when I travel or for touch ups during the day. If I'm using it as a touch up I like to put a little foundation in the cap of the brush. Then I can apply it as needed throughout the day without having to carry a container of powder with me too. I gave the Kaith Retractable Kabuki Brush a 5 star review because it's wonderful for on the go use, can hold a little blush or foundation in the cap for when I need it, doesn't shed and leave bristles all over my face and I love the color. I received the brush at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. All thoughts and opinions expressed are 100% my own.

The holidays are coming and gift giving is going to be in full swing soon. The 12 pack elegant Christmas gift bags is a great assortment to keep on hand. I appreciate how they pointed out common allergies like ragweed and said do not use chamomile on your skin because you are likely to have a reaction. It's a very common allergy, I'm allergic to ragweed but never knew this fact.There are 8 chapters in the book that will cover what you need to know to start using essential oils. They are Aromatherapy Basics, Shopping for Aromatherapy Projects, Your First Aromatherapy Blends, Oils and Remedies for Health, Beauty & Home, 35 Oils to Know and Use, Remedies for Health & Healing, Remedies for Cosmetic Care, Remedies for the Home and Perfume Recipes. This is a great book to help you get started on incorporating essential oils into your life.I received the DIY Aromatherapy: over 130 Affordable Essential Oil Blends for Health, Beauty and Home complimentary in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. All thoughts and opinions expressed are 100% my own.

I have two German Shepherds so when I was offered a chance to receive the Bazook-9 Dog Tennis Ball Launcher at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review I agreed. When the launcher arrived I was pretty eager to take it out of the packaging and try it out. Without the dogs around I loaded a tennis ball, pulled the plunger back all the way and then shot it into the air. The ball only went about 30 feet. Not nearly enough for a German Shepherd. I can easily throw the ball farther than it went with this launcher.I gave the Bazook  -9 Dog Tennis Ball launcher a 3 star review because while it did work and launched a ball in the air with ease it did not go far. And if you are trying to exercise a dog this would only work for a small dog. Larger dogs will get bored easily and it will not give them a work out.

Wow! I've been shopping around to find the best Colombian coffees, and this is definitely one of them. I like my coffee a bit stronger than the regular blend, but not too strong, so Colombian is my favorite. A friend told me to try McDonald's McCafe Colombian, and I'm glad they recommended it. A very good, strong, rich coffee.

This is my favorite tea, with just the right amount of valerian added to help me sleep. It's a great bedtime drink for any mild insomniacs like me who don't want to use prescription or over-the-counter sleep aids. It's delicious and relaxing. Try it.

I'd never seen this 1980 series before, but a friend who's a horror fan told me about it so I took a chance. Hammer's TV venture was interesting--15 original teleplays, about 50 minutes each, with British stars of the day in stories of suspense and the supernatural. They're not all gems, but I'm so impressed with the effort that I'm giving it 5 stars anyway. Too bad we don't have anything like this on TV these days, to say nothing of Thriller, Outer Limits, and Twilight Zone. Oh, well, we can still enjoy these. It's a nice package, with clear picture and sound on all the stories. Recommended for those who like vintage thrills.

When Carl Martins father dies, Carl inherits a house in London and his fathers collection of homeopathic remedies. To make ends meet, he rents out the top floor to a stranger, a local veterinary assistant named Dermot McKinnon. He also decides to sell some of the medicine to a friend--and thereby hangs a tale. Soon, Carl is driven to the edge of madness by a mounting plot of blackmail and murder. This dark, claustrophobic story reminded me of another Rendell favorite, The Lake of Darkness, about the lottery winner and his creepy stalker. The growing tension between Carl and Dermot kept me turning the pages, wondering how it would all turn out.Ruth Rendell is my favorite author, and Im still mourning her loss. I attended her final appearance here in NYC last January, just before she died. She was 85 years old, and she left behind more than 60 novels and a couple hundred short stories of mystery and suspense. Ive read them all, many of them more than once. If you havent yet discovered this great mystery writer, you have a treat in store. Im sad that there wont be any more. DARK CORNERS is her last novel, and its among her best.Goodbye, Ms. Rendell, and thank you for giving me so many blissful hours of reading.

Wow, this collection brings back great memories! I remember watching a lot of these mini-movies on late-night TV back in the '80s. This British omnibus show ran for 6 seasons (1973-78), with a grand total of 43 suspense stories. Each 65-minute story has British and American stars of the day in (mostly) good tales of murder, madness, and the macabre. Not all 43 are gems, but a surprising number of them hold up very well, and a few of them are as good as anything I ever saw on The Twilight Zone or Alfred Hitchcock Presents. Everyone will have their fave episodes--mine are "Someone at the Top of the Stairs," "A Coffin For the Bride" (with a very young Helen Mirren!), and "I'm the Girl He Wants To Kill." Those titles alone tell you what to expect. The ITV Studios boxed set of discs is excellent, with clear picture and sound (for the period). No extras, but we can't have everything. If you're a fan of this show, or if you just love well-made TV thrillers, this package is for you. Recommended.

The 1977 film version of Sidney Sheldon's bestselling 1973 novel, The Other Side of Midnight, was not very good, but it had one element that was a complete success--the musical score by Michel Legrand. I was a budding composer in college when the film was released, and I actually sat through it twice in theaters, once for the silly, romantic plot and once just so I could hear the score again. I studied how Legrand worked his various themes into each part of the film, and I noted how the sweeping main melody, "Noelle's Theme," kept arriving in almost every scene. This melody acted much like the woman herself--sometimes grandly symphonic, sometimes a simple piano solo, but always there in the background to connect the various other characters with her overwhelming power and passion. Noelle's story--love, hatred, obsession, revenge, murder--is on the epic scale of a Greek tragedy, and Legrand's music always supports it, from the ominous opening ("Prologue") straight through to the triumphant finale ("Adieu, Noelle"). If the film itself had been as good as the music, it would have become a classic. Alas, the movie was a flop, but the score lives on.I'm glad this soundtrack album is finally available on CD because I lost my old LP years ago. Listening to it again after all these years, I'm amazed at how fresh and powerful it is. Legrand won several Oscars for scoring other films (The Thomas Crown Affair, Summer of '42, etc.), but I honestly think this is his best film work. If you're a fan of his, you must experience this wonderful score. Highly recommended.

A young British widow on holiday in coastal France stumbles on an insidious plot, turning her relaxing vacation into a nerve-jangling nightmare. This is the basic outline of a lot of mystery novels, but few writers have done it as well as the late, great Mary Stewart. MADAM, WILL YOU TALK? was her first published novel in 1955, and she followed it with a long and glorious career. In addition to her famous cycle of books about King Arthur (The Merlin Trilogy), she wrote more than a dozen novels of romantic suspense, a category she practically invented.This novel is a perfect example of Mary Stewart's distinctive style. There's a clever, charming young woman in an exotic locale (Avignon and Marseilles). There's a colorful group of friends and suspects. There's a man who may or may not be a romantic prospect. And there's a dangerous mystery--real, visceral peril for the heroine. Above all, Stewart's writing is lush and descriptive, bringing her people and places to vivid life. I reread her books frequently, and they stand the test of time. My other favorites are Nine Coaches Waiting (Rediscovered Classics), The Ivy Tree (Rediscovered Classics), and The Moon-Spinners (Rediscovered Classics). If you haven't yet discovered this magical writer, you should. Highly recommended.

A highly-regarded doctor in coastal England (Anthony Perkins) takes a great interest in an amnesiac man (Charles Bronson) who shows up at his hospital. He goes so far as to take the confused, possibly violent man home with him for "treatment." This is a set-up, of course--the surgeon has a complicated plan to avenge himself on his cheating wife (Jill Ireland) and her lover. And Bronson--who may or may not be a serial killer on the loose--is the key to Perkins' plan.I love a good suspense thriller, but this odd film from 1971 (a British movie with American stars) looks and sounds like a filmed play. I'm willing to bet that this was an unproduced theatrical play someone handed to a film producer, and the producer saw a way to make a reasonably entertaining, inexpensive movie out of it with one set and four actors. 90% of the action takes place in one room! I think it would have made a better play than a film. But the cast is very good, and there's a neat, sardonic twist at the end. It's okay--and a must for Bronson fans. You've never seen him in a part like this before!

I wasn't familiar with this little gem from 1958 until it arrived as a Warner Archive DVD. I love twisty mysteries, so I gave it a look. Michael Anderson followed his Oscar for Best Picture for AROUND THE WORLD IN 80 DAYS (1956) with this shadowy, well-made thriller. A diamond heiress living on the Costa del Sol in Spain (Anne Baxter) is suddenly confronted by a sinister stranger (Richard Todd) claiming to be her dead brother. She calls the police, and the local inspector (Herbert Lom) investigates. This obvious "con job" leads to a genuinely surprising turn of events.From one of the biggest epics ever made to a small, intimate, 5-character thriller set in a remote Spanish villa: I'm really impressed with Michael Anderson's range. Anne Baxter is excellent, the rest of the cast is solid, and the production values are above average, particularly the music (with the great Julian Bream on guitar). It's a perfect movie for anyone who likes to be surprised. Highly recommended.

The leader of an underground Irish movement (James Mason) is mortally injured during a bank robbery, and he spends the next few hours trying to get back to his hideout in the unfriendly streets of an unnamed Irish city. This seemingly simple plot brings together a large cross-section of Irish society, vivid characters who either help or hinder the antihero. There is a fascination in this story, almost hypnotic, that's hard to describe. The dark black-and-white photography, the beautiful music score, and the performances of Mason and the rest of the superb cast combine to create a film experience you won't forget. And it all builds to a surprising--and surprisingly moving--ending.The Criterion Blu-Ray has been remastered from original elements, and the package includes several extras of the high quality we've come to expect from the Criterion Collection. ODD MAN OUT stands alongside Sir Carol Reed's other great noir film, THE THIRD MAN, as one of the best British movies of all time. Highly recommended.

This is an excellent TV version of the 2007 Broadway revival of the 1970 George Furth/Stephen Soldheim musical. I saw it on stage, and I'm glad they recorded it for posterity. A sensitive bachelor in NYC (Raul Esparza) looks at the marriages of his closest friends and wonders if it's time for him to find someone and settle down. Alternately funny and dramatic, this sparkling show has one of Sondheim's best scores, including "Sorry/Grateful," "Another Hundred People," "The Ladies Who Lunch," and the stunning "Being Alive." If you've never seen COMPANY, this is a terrific introduction to a great Broadway gem. Highly Recommended.

A retired San Francisco cop (James Stewart) is hired by an old schoolmate (Tom Helmore) to spy on his mysterious wife (Kim Novak), and the ensuing case leads to murder, scandal, and a really strange new series of events. I'm a big Alfred Hitchcock fan, and this is my all-time favorite Hitchcock film. I've seen it many times, and I always enjoy rewatching it. Everyone must see this film at least once. Highly recommended.

This was a great bargain--two of my favorite classic films in one low-priced package. THE MOST DANGEROUS GAME (1932) is an exciting adventure from the makers of KING KONG with the same female lead (Fay Wray). She and Joel McCrea must escape from a madman on a remote island. AND THEN THERE WERE NONE (1945) is Rene CLair's all-star film version of the famous Agatha Christie play. Ten strangers (including Walter Huston, Barry Fitzgerald, June Duprez, Judith Anderson, and Louis Hayward) are brought to a remote island and killed off one-by-one.The prints are decent and the sound is fairly clear, considering the age of the films themselves. There are better DVDs of both titles available, but this one is perfectly good. Two must-see movies for mystery and thriller fans. Highly Recommended.

I love suspense novels that make me think, and this is one of them. I've been hearing the buzz about this book for weeks now, so I got a copy as soon as it was available. For once, the hype is true: THE GIRL ON THE TRAIN is a well crafted, beautifully written thriller.Rachel is a thirtyish Brit who has recently lost her husband to another woman. She's also lost her job in London, but that doesn't stop her from commuting there on the train from her suburban home every day. Rachel is an alcoholic who's drunk all day long, and she has a problem facing reality. She harasses her ex and his new wife and child. She makes up stories about strangers she glimpses every day from the train. And she frequently has alcohol-induced blackouts. She's not the world's most reliable narrator--which causes definite problems when one of the people she watches goes missing and is presumed dead...Paula Hawkins has written a first novel that is amazingly polished and professional. Her missing woman mystery is a good one, and we learn about it through three narrators--Rachel, her ex-husband's new wife, and the missing woman herself. Jumping back and forth in time, before and after the disappearance, Hawkins teases the reader onward toward a disturbing conclusion. Like the train at the center of the story, it just keeps moving forward to the end of the line. I'm still thinking about it, and I'm telling everyone about it. Highly recommended.

These filters are great! They're designed to fit in the regular-sized Hamilton Beach air purifying machines, and they come in several varieties (pets, smoke, etc.). These are the smoke filters, and they're very effective. I'm a smoker in a small studio apartment, and I have two of these machines going 24/7. The filters are changed every 3 months or so. Easy to set up, easy to maintain, and they do the job. Recommended.

Screenwriter Hossein Amini (Drive) always dreamed of writing a film adaptation of Patricia Highsmith's dark 1964 novel, THE TWO FACES OF JANUARY, and he finally realized that dream. He also ended up directing it, and it's an auspicious directorial dbut. The movie stars Viggo Mortensen, Kirsten Dunst, and Oscar Isaac, and it was filmed on locations in Athens, Crete, and Istanbul.Athens, 1962: A young American slacker, Rydal (Isaac), acts as a tour guide, living on the tips and spare cash he cons out of unwary foreigners. He meets Chester and Colette, an older American businessman (Mortensen) and his beautiful young wife (Dunst), and offers to show them around. He soon helps them out of a jam. Chester is really a major fraudster who's escaped the law (and his creditors) by fleeing to Europe, and a detective tracks him to his hotel. Chester accidentally kills the detective, and now he and Colette must get out of Athens fast. Rydal takes them to Crete, where he arranges for false papers to conceal their tracks. From there, the plot evolves into a modern version of a Greek drama among the splendid ancient ruins.Amini manages to capture the peculiar, oppressive Highsmith atmosphere that her fans (including me) are so wild about. The production values are first-rate, with lots of gorgeous scenery, including the Acropolis, the temple of Knossos at Iraklion in Crete (where a murder occurs), and Istanbul's sinister Grand Bazaar (for a chase and shootout in the dead of night). All in all, it ranks high on my list of Highsmith film adaptations. Highly recommended.

These candles are amazing! I didn't really have high expectations when I ordered a couple of them (Orange Lemon Splash and Clothesline Fresh). I'm a smoker in a tiny studio apartment, and I thought they'd just mask the smoke for a while, until you blew them out. These candles actually neutralize the air in a small, enclosed space. And the two scents I tried are very nice, not heavy or artificial like some of the supermarket brands. I'm going to stock up on these candles. Highly recommended (by a smoker).

These candles are amazing! I didn't really have high expectations when I ordered a couple of them (Orange Lemon Splash and Clothesline Fresh). I'm a smoker in a tiny studio apartment, and I thought they'd just mask the smoke for a while, until you blew them out. These candles actually neutralize the air in a small, enclosed space. And the two scents I tried are very nice, not heavy or artificial like some of the supermarket brands. I'm going to stock up on these candles. Highly recommended (by a smoker).

I grew up with this 1965 version of Rodgers and Hammerstein's made-for-TV musical, and I love it. I got the 2002 Columbia Tristar Home Entertainment DVD as soon as it was available, and I've loved it all these years. But when I saw that there was a remastered new version with a better picture quality, I decided to upgrade. That's when I discovered a problem.My 4-star review for this 5-star musical is for one reason only--the sound. The picture now is much better than on the earlier DVD, with clear images and brighter colors. BUT...the original 2002 disc was in Dolby Surround, using the stereo pre-recordings of the musical numbers and background music that were featured on the 1965 cast album from Columbia Records (Cinderella (1965 Television Cast)). This new "improved" 2014 DVD from Shout Factory doesn't have that stereo soundtrack--they've replaced it with the original monaural TV audio tracks from 1965, and I have to wonder why they did that.When the special was made for TV in 1965, the entire score was pre-recorded twice--once in 2-channel stereo for the inevitable original cast album that would be released to stores, and once in mono. The actual broadcast used the single, flat, monaural tracks for the monaural TVs of the time, and that's what we heard on TV in 1965 (I was 9 years old). The stereo record arrived soon after that, with a much fuller, more resonant sound quality. Not only were all the instruments of the orchestra and the voices of the chorus more clearly defined, but the principal voices were much improved by the dual amplification. Most particularly, the 2-channel Surround helped 18-year-old Lesley Ann Warren, whose lovely, light soprano voice sounded rather thin on the original monaural TV broadcast. She sounded much better on the record--and she sounded much better on the Columbia Tristar 2002 DVD. Now, this 2014 HD DVD gives us those old, flat mono tracks, and Warren sounds thin and insubstantial again. So does everyone else, for that matter. Why? Why didn't the people making the new DVD use the superior stereo tracks of the original DVD?To hear the difference yourself on the new Shout Factory DVD, listen to the overture that was added to the cast album and the discs but never officially a part of the TV broadcast. It's in 2-Channel Dolby Surround on both versions. Then the actual program begins with the main titles, and from then on what you hear is in mono. If you can't hear the dramatic difference in sound quality between the overture and the program itself, you'll probably be fine with this new DVD. If you DO hear the difference--especially if you use headphones or earbuds--then you'll know why I'm complaining. The entire 2002 Columbia Tristar Home Entertainment disc sounds like that overture!I appreciate the better picture quality, but I won't be watching this new Shout Factory DVD again. I'll stick with my 2002 Columbia Tristar DVD. The picture isn't quite as good, but that lush Dolby Surround soundtrack makes all the difference. If you can find a copy of the original DVD that isn't crazy expensive, you might also prefer it to this new version. (I'm a musician, and sound quality is more important to me than picture quality--this is a musical, after all.) Either way, it's a great show, possibly the best made-for-TV musical ever.

This terrific courtroom drama from 1957 is based on the hit play by Agatha Christie, and it's been called "the best Hitchcock movie not made by Hitchcock." That pretty much sums it up. It's a gripping, surprising story of a man on trial for his life (Tyrone Power), the eminent defense attorney trying to free him (Charles Laughton), and his mysterious wife (Marlene Dietrich) whose shady agenda is unclear. And it has a shocker of an ending that only Agatha Christie could have imagined.This new DVD version of WFTP is excellent, a big improvement on the earlier MGM DVD. It's been remastered in high definition, so it looks and sounds much better than before. (I can't speak for the new Blu-Ray version, but I'll assume it's at least as good as this DVD--why wouldn't it be?) This is a real upgrade of a classic thriller with Billy Wilder's excellent direction and career-best performances from Power, Laughton, and especially Dietrich. It really is one of the finest courtroom dramas ever filmed. Highly recommended.

A hapless NY reporter (Joel McCrea) is sent to Europe on the eve of WWII to get a scoop on conditions there from a renowned diplomat (Oscar nominee Albert Basserman). The diplomat is immediately assassinated--or is he? McCrea pursues the assassins, first in a sinister windmill in rural Holland, and later in England. Along the way, he meets a friendly Brit diplomat (Herbert Marshall) and his beautiful daughter (Laraine Day), who soon become involved in the intrigue. And everyone he meets seems to be trying to kill him. The film speeds through one adventure after another, culminating in a terrifying plane ride no viewer will ever forget.This Oscar-nominated gem from 1940 is one of my favorite Alfred Hitchcock films. It's also an important link in the Hitchcock chain, if you're a fan like me. Hitch's favorite theme throughout his career was the "man on the run," the innocent bystander who is plunged into danger against his will and must survive by his wits. The trend began with THE 39 STEPS and the original version of THE MAN WHO KNEW TOO MUCH back in the 1930s. Then came FOREIGN CORRESPONDENT and SABOTEUR. Finally, we had the wonderful 1955 remake of THE MAN WHO KNEW TOO MUCH and his crowning achievement, NORTH BY NORTHWEST. In FOREIGN CORRESPONDENT, you can see many of Hitchcock's signature ideas in an early form. It's a wonderful movie. Highly recommended.

It's an old urban legend. Or maybe it's the worst-kept secret in the world. It might be both. It is...the formula for synthetic fuel that can run all gas-based engines more efficiently and ecologically, at a fraction of the cost. If it existed, it would be the greatest advance in mass transportation since the invention of the steam engine. And it would put the big oil companies out of business. All of them. Permanently. Naturally, Big Oil will do anything--ANYTHING--to keep this formula off the market. And only one man can stop them. Or can he...?Steve Shagan's bestselling novel, THE FORMULA, was filmed in 1980 by director John G. Avildsen (ROCKY, THE KARATE KID). George C. Scott plays the burnt-out, divorced cop who stumbles on a string of dead bodies and an insidious plot to keep the world enslaved to the gas engine. Marthe Keller is the mysterious woman who may or may not be trying to help him. Marlon Brando is the ubiquitous oil tycoon who opposes him. Scott runs all over Europe and America, constantly pursued by a bunch of bad guys. Wherever he goes, things blow up and more people die. There are only two scenes between Scott and Brando, but they're the best scenes in the film. This is a fun, fast-paced thriller with a plot that doesn't bear close scrutiny (Why don't they just kill him, for Pete's sake!). The book and film arrived at the height of late-1970s paranoia, with oil shortages, high prices, and long lines at gas stations, and that explains why it was popular at the time. But it holds up very well today. I guess we're all still hoping that this synthetic fuel dream becomes a reality. Recommended.

I love these double discs! I recently went looking for DVDs of two favorite films, MARATHON MAN and THREE DAYS OF THE CONDOR, and I found both of them in double-disc packages with two other favorites, BLACK SUNDAY and ALL THE PRESIDENT'S MEN. Both sets have excellent widescreen versions of the movies with good picture and sound. And both sets have really great prices. So I ended up with 4 great films instead of two--and for less than I thought I'd have to spend. Now, that's a bargain!This package has two really intense thrillers from 1976 and 1977, with great directors, John Schlesinger (MARATHON MAN) and John Frankenheimer (BLACK SUNDAY). They also both have the same leading lady, beautiful Swiss actress Marthe Keller (THE FORMULA, FEDORA, etc.).MARATHON MAN is a creepy cat-and-mouse game that pits a vicious Nazi war criminal (Laurence Olivier) against an innocent college student (Dustin Hoffman) and his girlfriend (Keller) in 1970s New York City. When Hoffman's CIA agent brother (Roy Scheider) is murdered by the Nazi, he becomes inadvertently involved in the villain's attempt to retrieve a stolen fortune. The Nazi was a dentist in the death camps, and that fact leads to one of the most excruciating interrogation scenes you'll ever see. ("Is it safe?") Goldman wrote the screenplay based on his own bestselling novel, and Schlesinger (MIDNIGHT COWBOY) once again makes NYC seem like the most sinister place on earth.In light of recent historical events, BLACK SUNDAY is no longer the same movie I saw in a theater in 1977. I was a college student then, and the story of fanatical Islamic terrorists planning to blow up the Super Bowl (with the President of the United States in attendance) seemed like great fun. Not anymore. Now, this long, detailed film seems more like a cautionary tale than entertainment. It is practically a step-by-step "How To" instruction manual for lunatics. Based on the bestselling novel by Thomas Harris (RED DRAGON, THE SILENCE OF THE LAMBS), it is a truly chilling experience. Marthe Keller is the crazy terrorist in charge of the deadly plot, with Bruce Dern (COMING HOME, NEBRASKA) as her even crazier American accomplice. Robert Shaw (JAWS, THE STING) is the Israeli Mossad agent who tries to stop them. Frankenheimer (THE MANCHURIAN CANDIDATE) keeps the big story racing to the jaw-dropping finale. (Note: this movie was filmed long before the invention of CGI special effects, so most of what you see actually had to be staged. Amazing!)So, two great thrillers for one low price! (PS: The other double album I mentioned is All The President Men / Three Days of The Condor (DBFE). Highly Recommended.

This double DVD was a real find! I was looking for a copy of THREE DAYS OF THE CONDOR, and I found this package. I hadn't watched either film since I first saw them in theaters in 1975 and '76, and they both hold up beautifully.ATPM is just about the best film I've ever seen about working journalists--along with HIS GIRL FRIDAY, of course. But this story happens to be true. And horrifying. I lived through the actual events, and Alan J. Pakula and his screenwriter, William Goldman (who won an Oscar for this), really caught the mood of the country at that time. Redford and Hoffman are superb, and the supporting cast is wonderful.TDOTC is a terrific suspense thriller about a CIA employee who suddenly finds himself "out in the cold," with Redford once again in top form as the terrified hero. It's based on James Grady's excellent novel, Six Days of the Condor, with the nonstop action made even more immediate by the subtraction of three days from the original story. Cliff Robertson, Faye Dunaway, and especially Max Von Sydow are perfect in their parts. Sidney Pollack directed several of my favorite films, and this is one of them.This DVD set has excellent widescreen picture and clear sound. Not a lot of extras, but a great price for two great films. Highly recommended.

Good news for everyone who loved last summer's Blood of the Lamb--the second book in Sam Cabot's exciting paranormal series is here!Livia Pietro and Father Thomas Kelly have left Rome for New York City, where they're soon joined by their friend, Spencer George. If you don't know who these three detectives are, you should. I'll give you a tantalizing hint: Only one of them is, um, mortal. And that's the fun in this particular series. In the first book, an old document that involved the Roman Catholic Church led our protagonists to some shocking discoveries about a group called the Noantri-what we, in English, would call vampires. Now, in SKIN OF THE WOLF, they're on a case that involves an old American Indian ceremonial mask, a murder at Sotheby's auction house, and a group of Native Americans who are not unlike the Noantri. They're just from a different, um, strain of supernatural beings. (The book's title will give you a big hint!) Livia, Thomas, and Spencer must stop them before...well, find out for yourself.I enjoyed BLOOD OF THE LAMB, but I think I like SKIN OF THE WOLF even more. This is one of my favorite new thriller series. Highly recommended.

Her name is Mia, a 25-year-old art teacher from a well-to-do Chicago family. She's been abducted by a man she met in a bar and held captive at a remote cabin in another state. Now she's returned--but the woman who comes back is not at all like the woman who vanished. She calls herself Chloe now, and she apparently doesn't remember much of her ordeal or of her life before it. Amnesia, the doctors call it. Her socialite mother, a concerned police detective assigned to the case, and the abductor himself take turns filling in the blanks of Mia/Chloe's story. And it's quite a story...Mary Kubica's first novel is unusually constructed: several voices, all in the present tense, jumping back ("Before") and forth ("After") in time. This may sound complicated, but it isn't. For a first novel, THE GOOD GIRL is amazingly polished and professional. All the characters spring to life as they speak, and I really began to care about them--especially the young woman at the center of the plot.I've already seen early reviews comparing this to GONE GIRL by Gillian Flynn and STILL MISSING by Chevy Stevens, and I think it's every bit as good as both of them. If you like low-key psychological suspense stories about troubled families and the secrets they hide, you really should try this. Highly recommended.

This TCM/Warner Home Video set is really perfect for the fan of classic crime films. You get 4 of the finest mysteries ever made, and they're no longer on 2 double-sided discs! The copy I just bought has 4 DVDs in it--each title is its own disc. I think they must have added this improvement after earlier customers complained about the packaging. But it's now 4 discs, so no more worries about scratching or marring them.There's no point in saying much about the films themselves because they're among the most famous movies in the world. Great scripts, direction, acting, and atmosphere, from a time (the 1940s and '50s) when films were made a lot more carefully and lovingly than they are now. There's not a bad one in the bunch. And getting them this way is a big moneysaver--individually, they'd be 2 to 3 times the price. If you want to add these 4 classics to your DVD library (and who doesn't?), this is the way to get them. Enjoy!

This is the fourth Johari West Hawaiian shirt I've bought on Amazon, and I'm very happy with it. Like the others I got (Indigo Sapphire, Aqua Wave, and the tan-and-white one), this one (Island Fever) is very well made and lightweight, perfect for the hot summer weather. It fits just right and looks great, better than most other Hawaiian shirts. If you're looking for this kind of shirt, Johari West is the best brand I've found so far. Try them.

I bought two Johari West Hawaiian shirts last summer, and now I've added two more to my wardrobe, including this one (Aqua Wave). They are handsome, well-constructed, lightweight cotton shirts with great patterns in a variety of colors. They don't look at all like your usual Hawaiian shirts--loud, cheap cotton things with tacky pix of palm trees and parrots and dancing women. These are more "dressy" and a lot more comfortable, perfect for just about any summer occasion. I really recommend them. (PS: My two shirts from last year are still going strong after many washings.)

PHANTOM LADY is a perfect example of the "noir" movies from the 1940s and '50s. Director Robert Siodmak made Cornell Woolrich's novel (written as "William Irish") into a stunning black-and-white film with a tight plot and excellent performances.A businessman (Alan Curtis) is accused, tried, and convicted of murdering his wife, and he's soon on Death Row with only weeks to live. His faithful secretary (Ella Raines) races with the clock to find the only witness who can exonerate him--the mysterious lady of the title (Fay Helm), an elusive woman he spent the evening with while his wife was killed. The secretary's only allies are a kindly policeman (Thomas Gomez) and the prisoner's best friend, a mentally unstable artist (Franchot Tone). But can they be trusted? The clock is ticking...This TCM DVD (in partnership with Warner Home Video) is a very good copy, with excellent picture and sound. No extras, but at least we finally have it in this format. Until now, it was only available in a blurry VHS version. I'm glad TCM is helping to preserve so many classic films on DVD, especially these wonderful "noir" movies. Highly recommended.

Howard and Deborah Morgan are aging New Agers who once set up a karmic paradise at Stoneyridge, their freehold farm in rural England. He was a potter and she a weaver, and they raised sheep for modest profit while home-schooling their only child, Adam. More recently, they set the place up as a bed-and-breakfast for occasional tourists in the area. But now, Howard is an invalid, Deborah is his 24/7 nurse, Adam has escaped the farm for the real world, the sheep are dying of neglect, and the bed-and-breakfast is a bust. Into this volatile mix comes the mysterious Theo, a young man who changes the dynamic of this family. And he may very well be dangerous. What happens next is...a crime?I've loved the dark psychological thrillers of Morag Joss ever since I read her wonderful first novel, Half Broken Things, and I particularly admired The Night Following. Her writing style is lush and eloquent. Her main characters are always people with big emotional issues, and the suspense in her stories is always based on the fragility of human nature. OUR PICNICS IN THE SUN is a vivid, heartbreaking addition to the list. I can't wait for her next one.

This British series from the 1970s is a real treat for suspense fans. It ran for 5 seasons, and this package is Season One, the first 10 episodes. I saw most of them as a kid when they first aired in the US, and 40 years later they're as good as I remember. Each film is approx. 65-70 minutes long, with a "3-act play" set-up (2 breaks for commercials, which are NOT included--Yay!). Brian Clemens is a sort of Brit Rod Serling/Alfred Hitchcock, and he wrote most of these stories. (He also wrote several great theatrical suspense films, including AND SOON THE DARKNESS and SEE NO EVIL.)These 10 stories are well produced and directed, with strong casts headed by one or two stars in each episode (Robert Powell, Barbara Feldon, Richard Johnson, Polly Bergen, Paul Burke, Sinead Cusack, Diane Cilento, etc.). They range in quality from excellent ("Possession," "A Place To Die," "Spell of Evil") to average ("An Echo of Theresa," "Murder In Mind"), with 1 genuine classic in the batch: "Someone At the Top of the Stairs." This episode, about two college girls (Donna Mills and Judy Carne) who take a room in a creepy London boarding house, is simply "marvelous!" (You'll know the significance of that word after you've seen it.) My vivid memories of this episode prompted me to buy the whole box, and I'm glad I did.If you like TWILIGHT ZONE, ALFRED HITCHCOCK PRESENTS, OUTER LIMITS, and the American THRILLER (hosted by Boris Karloff), you'll like this show as well. I hope the other 4 seasons will be released on DVD in the US soon, because I remember several more excellent episodes from my youth. Recommended.

When I was 7 years old, I watched a scary show on TV with a babysitter. I couldn't remember much about it, only that it involved a car breaking down and 2 young men going to a creepy house where someone named Eula Lee lived. I remember being terrified, and all my life I tried to find out what it was. Now, 40 years later, I learned that it was an episode of THRILLER called "Pigeons From Hell," so I ordered this 10-episode collection of THRILLER Fan Favorites. I watched "Pigeons" and the other 9 episodes here, and I must say, they're pretty scary!I love THE TWILIGHT ZONE and THE OUTER LIMITS and especially ALFRED HITCHCOCK PRESENTS, but I'm only now discovering THRILLER. Boris Karloff is the host, and he's wonderful. The stories are definitely weird, and a couple of them ("Pigeons" and "The Incredible Dr. Markesan") are truly nightmarish--even scarier than those other scary series from the 1950s and 1960s. Based on these 10 episodes, I'm ready to invest in the whole series box set. I have a lot of catching up to do! If you like those other shows, you'll probably like THRILLER, too. Recommended.

This is one of the best films I've ever seen on the subject of crime and criminals, and the effect crime has on the people who get caught up in it. Director David Fincher took the original memoir of San Francisco Chronicle journalist Robert Graysmith (played by Jake Gyllenhaal in the movie) and fashioned it into a story that is less a whodunit than it is a character study of obsession and its consequences. We may never know the truth about the crazed killer, but this film gives us a good idea of what Graysmith and various other journalists, cops, and Feds went through in their pursuit of him. By concentrating on victims and bystanders rather than the perp himself, Fincher has managed to convey a sense of the true horror of violent crime. He's also made a suspense film that Hitchcock himself would admire. The entire cast is excellent, and the sense of time and place (1960s-70s San Francisco) is vivid. I'll never forget it. Highly recommended.

This is the third-best recording of GYPSY I've ever heard, and I was glad to add it to my library. I saw it on Broadway, and I also saw Angela Lansbury and Tyne Daly, not to mention the movie (which we won't mention) and Bette Midler on TV. I'm too young to have seen the original with Ethel Merman, but I'm from a show-biz home, and my late mom (an actress) always mentioned the original 1959 production in hushed whispers, the same way she described the original productions of MY FAIR LADY and WEST SIDE STORY. Anyway, I'd rank this recording after Merman and Lansbury, but before Daly. (I never saw or heard Bernadette Peters, but I'm sure she's great, too.) Whichever recording you prefer, it's definitely one of the Top 10 Broadway scores ever, so you really can't go wrong. Recommended.

I'm a die-hard R&H fan, so I was very interested to get this specially-recorded studio version of their rarest score. Well, the good news is that we now have a good recording of the score. The so-so news is that the score is so-so, just like the play itself. Big props to R&H for trying something so outside the box--they were reportedly inspired by Thornton Wilder's OUR TOWN, and you can see the influence. But ALLEGRO just never rises to the ranks of their great works like OKLAHOMA!, CAROUSEL, SOUTH PACIFIC, etc. The score is hard to follow, with its combinations of many different styles and sounds, but the cast of singers assembled to perform it here is impressive. It certainly is fascinating, and there are a couple of outstanding songs, if not hits. If you're as interested in the evolution of this immortal duo as I am, you'll want to hear this work at least once. Try it.

I've loved this retro-noir movie ever since I first saw it in a theater in 1981. It's a slightly altered updating of my favorite noir film of all time, DOUBLE INDEMNITY, and writer/director Lawrence Kasdan really honored the Billy Wilder original, not to mention James M. Cain's wonderful novel. William Hurt and Kathleen Turner are perfectly matched as the conniving lovers, and they're ably supported by Richard Crenna, a pre-CHEERS Ted Danson, and a very young Mickey Rourke, among others. Great atmosphere and lots of heat--in the weather, in the story, and in the bodies (I guess that's why they called it BODY HEAT). And John Barry's musical score deserves special mention. This is a terrific thriller, start to finish. Highly recommended.

I first saw JCS on Broadway in 1971 when I was a teen, and I loved it. Then I saw this film version in a theater in 1973, and it was very impressive. Norman Jewison (IN THE HEAT OF THE NIGHT, FIDDLER ON THE ROOF) took an energetic young cast of unknowns to the Israeli desert to tell the greatest story ever told in authentic surroundings. The Webber/Rice score is beautifully presented, the imaginative staging is often stunning to watch, and the cast is just about perfect. You don't have to be particularly religious (I'm not) to enjoy this fresh examination of the final week in the life of Jesus. The "rock opera" approach makes the well-known Bible story seem immediate and vital. This Special Edition DVD of JCS looks great and sounds greater. Highly recommended.

This film was a pleasantly nasty surprise--or maybe it was a nastily pleasant surprise. Whatever. I first saw it on cable after a lot of friends recommended it, and I couldn't believe an American film company would go so far out on a limb with such dark material. It seems much more like something the Europeans would do. I'm very proud that it's an American movie--it proves that we can sometimes make sophisticated black comedies like everyone else. The cast is perfect, the script is wonderfully twisty (and twisted), and everyone involved should be very proud of themselves. Thank you, John McNaughton, and please make more movies like this. Bill Murray for President! Highly recommended.

William Bellman spends his entire life haunted by one bad decision he made in childhood. That life is the subject of Diane Setterfield's second novel, seven years after her glorious dbut, The Thirteenth Tale. First at his family's fabric mill in rural England, and later in a very peculiar business of his own in London, William is constantly followed and watched by...something. His business fortunes, his wife and children, his fleeting happiness--everything he acquires in life manages to vanish, leaving him older and increasingly bitter and hermitic. Will he ever finally confront the demon that has always threatened him? That's the big question at the heart of BELLMAN & BLACK.B&B is subtitled "a ghost story," but it isn't your usual kind of ghost story. The title of my review is a quote from the book on the subject of rooks, the strange, beautiful black birds that resemble crows. If you read B&B, you'll learn a great deal about these elusive creatures, and you'll see what they have to do with the fate of William Bellman. It's definitely unusual.I bought this book from Amazon.uk last month and had it shipped to me here in NYC because I couldn't wait for the American release--that should tell you how much I loved THE THIRTEENTH TALE. The first book reminded me of Charles Dickens and Daphne du Maurier, my all-time favorite authors. This new book reminds me of the same giants, but not in the same way. B&B is a shorter, simpler story than TTT, and it made me think of A CHRISTMAS CAROL. If you consider William Bellman as a stand-in for Ebenezer Scrooge, you begin to see just what Setterfield is up to. I can't say I loved this the way I loved the first one, but it's an interesting, surprisingly fast read, and Setterfield's vivid, graceful prose is always welcome in my house. Try it.

This is the first book I've read in the new line of thriller novellas from Hammer, and also the first book I've read by Julie Myerson. She's apparently a highly-regarded British author, but you'd never know it from this anemic thriller. I love the old Hammer films from the 1960s and '70s, but THE QUICKENING doesn't really follow that tradition.A young honeymoon couple in Antigua--she's rich and pregnant, he's poor and acting suspicious. Some local natives warn her to get herself and her husband away from the island. Then she starts seeing a phantom, or zombie, or something--a young man covered in dirt (from a grave?) who tells her that her groom is responsible for his death. So far, so good, right? But then it just goes on--the groom keeps acting fishy, and everyone in their resort hotel thinks the bride is going crazy. (Try counting the number of times people ask the heroine if she's feeling okay.) It builds to a fairly shocking finale, if you have the patience to stick with it until then.Myerson's fancy writing style (she doesn't use contractions or quotation marks) isn't really suitable for the thriller genre, and that may be the main problem here. I gave it 3 stars because she's clearly a good writer, and some of the descriptions are vivid, but I suspect her other, non-horror books are probably better than this. It's not the thrill ride I was expecting. Based on this, I'm not rushing to get more books in the Hammer horror line.

I fell in love with this cool, compact keyboard when it was first introduced on iMacs in 2009. It was only available for about a year, then Apple discontinued it, replacing it with the bigger, wider, more detailed aluminum-framed keyboard that includes a number pad on the extreme right and a middle section with various buttons and arrows for gamers. (This is the model that is currently available from Apple.)I'm a writer. I use my iMac for work. I do not play games, watch movies, or do any other superfluous things on my machine. This sleek little keyboard--with just the QWERTY keys and the usual other keys above and around them--has everything I need. It is ALL I need. My original one gave up the ghost, and I found a new one from a terrific seller right here on Amazon Marketplace. These particular keyboards are getting harder and harder to find--even on eBay--but Amazon always seems to have whatever I'm looking for. This amazing little keyboard really, really should still be available from Apple, but since it isn't, Amazon is the best place to find it. Thanks again, Amazon!

I was so glad I came to Amazon to find a replacement battery for my Uniden phone.
