You CANNOT go wrong with the MIDNIGHT BREED series!This amazing novella will give you a sexy, succulent taste of what this author is truly capable of. With an exotic backdrop, vivacious storyline, and gorgeous and intriguing characters Ms. Adrian gives us another winner in her next installment of this gigantic series! From the very first page, Adrian seizes her readers attention with both an intriguing mystery element and a passionate, sizzling romance. Adrian clutches her readers hearts while captivating them with an intense and exiting plot that will keep you guessing. Emotional, rich, and adventurous, this series and this author will immediately make their way to the top of your TBR lists!I loved both Jehan and Seraphina. The sexual tension and the spark was instant, but they still fought the urge to do anything about it. They will do what is right by their family and their lineage because they are loyal to a fault, but it doesnt mean they have to enjoy it. They will fight this pull. They will battle their fate. They will dispute their feelings. They will deny, deny, deny, untilthey cant anymore.I couldnt keep the smile off my face the entire time reading this. To travel back to this splendid world Lara has created, brings me such great joy and wonder. STROKE OF MIDNIGHT was a suspenseful and mesmerizing masterpiece. Hang on tight as Adrian dives back into the scorching hot, alluring world of the Breed. Full of action and passion, Lara Adrian is sure to make tons of new fans with this great installment of the series.*Gifted copy provided by the publisher in exchange for an honest review*

Superb! Captivating! Sexy! Chilling! I LOVED every second of it! As Jenna Jacob enters the genre of Contemporary Erotic Romance for the first time, she brings to her readers, a sense of passion, emotion, and intrigue that will captivate minds and warm hearts. Fans of this author will jump for joy as she brings us a hero that will break and mend hearts all over the romance world. She also brings to life a heroine with such strength and such boldness that you cant help but cheer her on every step of the way.Two shattered souls reunite once again to fight for one anothers love and forgiveness. Separated, they are brokentogether, they have a chance to be whole once again.SKY OF DREAMS was extremely well written, with beautiful characters and a storyline you can completely immerse yourself in. You will feel the pain, suffering, passion, and love deep within your soul. Im IN LOVE with everything about this book! Im very excited to see what Ms. Jacob does with this series. The secondary characters have a story of their own, and I cant wait for that to be unraveled.*Gifted copy provided by the author in exchange for an honest review*

I wanted to approach this book like it was a high-priced antique. I wanted to look at the beauty of the cover and the intrigue of the synopsis. I didnt want to rush it. I wanted to savor it. With this being the conclusion of Tyler and Mackenzies story, I knew once I started, I would NOT be able to put it down. I would devour it whole, and I would look up and it would be over and I would be sad. My plan was to take it slow, but after staring at the cover and re-reading bits and pieces of Chasing The Dragon, Book 1 in the series, where it all began, I shot my plan all to HELL! There was no going back, and suddenly I didnt care anymore. I wanted, NO, I NEEDED their happily ever after like I needed another breath. T.K. Leigh has THAT much power of me. Its scary really! She is just too DAMN good at what she does!T.K. Leigh once again, works her magic in the last installment of the Deception Duet series. She knows how to reel readers in from the get-go. With unforgettable characters and a suspenseful, sexy, and adventurous storyline, you will be hooked until the very last word is read. From the very beginning, there has been twists  around every corner. I know you have questions. I had A LOT! Fear not, my romantic suspense junkies, SLAYING THE DRAGON will pull you from every single direction, making you crave more with every turn of the page. With its lively plot, heated sexual tension, surprising twists, and engaging characters, Leighs latest is another WINNER!If you are looking for something sexy, edgy, captivating, and emotionally gripping, the Deception Duet by T.K. Leigh is definitely for you! It is a MUST READ in my book, and it will always have a special spot on my bookshelf where I can look at it from afar and pick it up whenever the mood strikes, which will probably be quite a bit.*Gifted copy provided by the author in exchange for an honest review*

WOW! I had a fantastic time reading HARD TO BREAK! Since Ive discovered this author, it has been hit or miss, and let me tell you this was quite the HIT! It was fresh, unique, and extremely sexy. We dive in to the world of fast cars, custom builds, and illegal racing. The sexual tension is at an all time high in Ms. Jewels latest standalone in her ALPHAS HEART series. This heart pounding, exhilarating, and erotic thrill ride will have you on the edge of your seat. This author delivered in a BIG way!This was a different and all around steamy read for me. HOT mechanics? Yes please! The main characters were fantastic in this. Our male lead, Tazen, is a cocky son of a *****. He is sexy, and he knows it. He is wealthy, accomplished, and he takes what he wants. His name even SCREAMS arrogance. At the beginning you will LOVE to HATE him, but dont worry, he grown on you and you will fall for his charms. My favorite character was our female lead, Quinn. She is a bold, strong, confident woman, with a good head on her shoulders. She has been through so much with her family and her familys business. She has had to grow up fast and took on so much responsibility at such a young age. She didnt have a normal childhood. When women her age are going out with their friends, seeing movies or partying the night away, she is trying to keep her fathers business afloat. She is a tomboy at heart and she loves hanging out with the guys. I loved her attitude and her sense of loyalty.When these two get together, their worlds explode. Crude and hilarious banter ensues, and a battle of wills begin. Both are determined and stubborn. Who will break first? Who will give in? With each page turned, the sexual tension kicks up a notch. The simmering connection turns to a full on boil when they get a taste of one another. As the story builds, and as Tazen and Quinn learn more about each other, the hate that they felt for one another slowly fades to a deep and passionate love that they will not be able to deny.Thank you to Bella Jewel for crafting such a smart, sassy, and steamy romance.*Gifted copy provided by the publisher in exchange for an honest review*

PHENOMENAL! Once again, Aleatha Romig puts us under her spell with this alluring and sensual start to an intriguing new series! I was held captive, a prisoner to this author's writing. Nothing could make me look away. Nothing could pull me from this trance. THREE hours I was drawn into a world of secrets, deceit, lies, and overwhelming passion. THREE hours I was held hostage to this epic dark romance. At the end of those three hours I sit with my blurry eyes, heavy heart, and scrambled mind, yearning, hell, craving for more.This book will have you saying, "Tony who?" Ladies, there is a new ALPHA in town and his name is NOX!*Gifted copy provided by the author in exchange for an honest review*

A slow burning romance full of so much emotion! The last 20% took a lot out of me. A truly tortured hero and the woman who will risk her heart over and over again to give him peace. Another Rock Kiss novel is just what romance readers need to satisfy their craving for a romance that tugs at the heartstrings. A beautiful friends-to-lovers tale that will bring out all the feels and leave you craving so much more.Readers have to be strong with this one. Kit and Noahs relationship is a whirlwind of ups and downs. A woman wanting so much more than the man can give. Kits heart takes a bashing when she allows Noah back into her life. Noah cant be who Kit needs him to be, but he NEEDS her in his life. She makes everything better. He is tormented every day, and even though he needs her, he WILL NOT subject her to his past, present, or future. The back and forth is killer, and the sexual tension is ridiculous. The happily ever after makes all of the emotional highs and lows that you go through while reading this book, so worth it. The emotion, the intrigue makes this hard-won romance a fantastic installment to a favorite series of mine.ROCK REDEMPTION is a rock star romance that is hard-fought for and deliciously won. This story of healing will touch you, and the intensity of the sensual connection will have you swooning. Im really diggin Nalini Singh writing in this genre. This is an author that Ive been following for years, and no matter what genre she sinks her teeth into, Im never disappointed.*Gifted copy provided by the author in exchange for an honest review*

A passionate, addictive, and sexy whirlwind of an erotic romance that will reach all of your senses and touch every part of your heart. Axel Dillon is one HERO you will never forget!The Wicked Lovers series always turns me inside out leaving me in an intense state of happiness and contentment. This series seems to get better with each installment. I crave Shaylas writing like no other, and every time I see she is releasing something new, I tend to get giddy like a school girl. I feel like Ive been waiting on Axel Dillons story for a while, when really, it probably hasnt been that long. I just get so enraptured in these characters lives, I yearn for more every time the last page has turned.Gripping, sensual, and seductive, WICKED FOR YOU will set your e-reader on fire! This author never slacks off in the erotic department, so each sex scene is better than the last. It always starts off so sexy and savage and then after the characters give in to their emotions, it turns tender, loving, but still with a heavy passionate edge that Black does so well.Mystery Mullins (can I just say, I freaking love that name for a heroine!) is our female lead. Axel Dillon has always been her hero and her fantasy. They live two totally separate lives, and the first time they come into each others lives, she is too young and innocent for Axels rough nature. She heads back home to her tabloid lifestyle, but never forgetting the man who saved her body and captured her heart. Years later and she still cant get Axel out of her mind and out of her dreams. So she decides she needs to scratch that itch and finally move on. When Mystery, is a mystery no more, Axel becomes addicted himself. Axel is nobodys hero, but when danger draws near to the woman who still intrigues him, he will stop at nothing to become her protector once again.With sharp, crisp dialogue and sky-high tension, WICKED FOR YOU will have readers guessing until the very end. Once again, this author gives us a sizzling romance that will stay with us long after the last page has turned. This series and this installment is something I would recommend to every romance reader out there. This was an EASY FIVE STAR READ!*Gifted copy provided by the publisher in exchange for an honest review*

Katie Ashley continues to raise the stakes, giving her readers a sexy MC romance that they crave! Intense. Dramatic. Sexy. Dangerous. This next installment of the Vicious Cycle Series takes the MC genre to the next level! I just knew that after reading about Nathaniel Reverend Malloy in Vicious Cycle, I was going to fall hard when he got his own story, and boy did I fall HARD. This rugged, sexy beast of a man has a gentle side and past that should have broken him. When Annabel Percy falls into his life, he instantly feels protective of her, and will do what it takes to keep her safe, no matter what. Explosive chemistry and a connection they cant deny, these two come from different worlds, but when they come together, they make a world for themselves that house so much passion and love, there is nothing that can break through.Every single second of this thrilling romance did something for me. There was an intensity that flew off the pages and so much sexual tension you wont know what to do with yourself. Stunning writing where the vibration of the motorcycle engines sink through to your bones, and the smell of leather takes over your senses, REDEMPTION ROAD has become a favorite of mine in a genre that I adore. This is turning out to be a fantastic series with a great group of characters that you will yearn to know more about. Katie Ashley is a truly gifted storyteller.*Gifted copy provided by the publisher in exchange for an honest review*

Spectacular writing! Captivating story! Provocative, sensual, and full of passion and intrigue. My mind was stimulated. My stomach was in knots. This amazing book is like no other. Jasinda Wilder is at the top of her game and shows no sign of stopping. I will tell you right now, there is NO putting this book down once you started. I was completely sucked in and I DID NOT want to escape. I cant tell you how refreshing this was. I wanted something different, something sexy, and something mysterious, and Ms. Wilder game me that and SO MUCH MORE! I am AMAZED!If you are looking for sophisticated writing with so much vivid imagery and a highly mysterious and erotic storyline, THIS is the book for you! The beautiful, alluring book cover and the fascinating blurb will reel you in, but the plot and the complex characters will hold you hostage until the very last page. There is this beautiful, enchanting inner dialogue that the female lead gives us that will just astonish you. I absolutely LOVED the heroine of this story and the herolets just saydepending on how you like your book boyfriends, some of you might be divided, because there are two men that want Madame X all to themselves, and they couldnt be more different. The past collides with the future and a woman must choose to listen to her head or her heart.I want to shout out from the rooftops to anyone who will listen that they need to read this book. If you are in a book club, make this your next buddy read. If you have a coworker or neighbor who loves a little dark erotic twist to their romance, tell them to pick this book up. Tell anyone who will listen, because once you finish reading, you WILL want to talk to someone about it, believe me!*Gifted copy provided by the publisher in exchange for an honest review*

HOLY HOTNESS! Elle Kennedy brings the HEAT in this first installment of her brand new sexy suspenseful series! CLAIMED is the first book in the new OUTLAWS series and is sure to captivate fans and newbies alike. The sexual tension alone will set your kindle on fire, leaving you gasping and wanting more. Step into this brand new world full of outlaws, bandits, and enforcers.There is a war going on and enemies are just around the corner. You have to know who to trust. A man who has lost everything struggles with being a leader. He had someone he loved depending on him and he couldnt protect her in the end. A beautiful stranger seeks his protection and he cant help but be drawn her. He doesnt trust her. He doesnt trust himself around her. Their chemistry goes from simmering to boiling HOT in a matter of days. It was only supposed to be about SEXmind-blowing, erotic as hell, SEX. Just when the lust turns into love the truth comes out and puts them all in danger. Will LOVE be able to overcome betrayal?Oh, Im going to absolutely LOVE this series! We get a great introduction to some amazing characters who we will see in upcoming novels. This has the witty writing and sexy banter that Elle Kennedy is known for, along with some pulse-pounding action and suspense that brings it all together for one FABULOUS read!*Gifted copy provided by the publisher in exchange for an honest review*

This was a pure delight! A great conclusion to an emotionally filled, sexy as sin romance between a couple we have been swooning over for a while now. Rachel and Malcolm deserve their happily ever after and this installment gives us a beautiful glimpse into what that finally looks like. There is no more battling feelings in this one. They know that they are IT for each other. No second guessing. Rachel will be his and Malcolm will finally be hers and hers alone.You are invited to the wedding of the year and all of the ups and downs that go along with it. Decisions need to be made. Feelings need to be expressed. The passion gets even hotter in Ms. Manwhore. Finding the perfect dress, the bachelor party antics, AND trying to abstain from sex until their wedding day; all this and more until we reach the epic finale when the vows are said, they kiss as man and wife, and the ever so HOT consummation of marriage between a woman and her manwhore.This delicious, fast read had me on the edge of my seat, swooning hard, blushing deep, and laughing over and over again. I was sad at the end, but super excited for the potential of so much more from the secondary characters that we also fell in love with during this MUST READ series by the incredibly talented Katy Evans!*Gifted copy provided by the publisher in exchange for an honest review*

A captivating and thrilling tale of sizzling paranormal romance! Even though this is a paranormal retelling of ONE TO HOLD, it remains just as fresh and enthralling as if it was standing on its own. The richness of this new world Tia Louise has created makes it a VERY fascinating place. The characters that we have all grown to love are just as feisty and gorgeous as ever. I didn't think it was possible, but the chemistry and passion between Derek and Melissa is HOTTER than ever! This surefire hit will liven up your night and leave you with a huge smile on your face. ONE IMMORTAL was a dangerously sexy story with a fine supernatural touch!*Gifted copy provided by the author in exchange for an honest review*

Scorching hot, fiery, explosive, and undeniably gripping, LAST HOPE has got to be my FAVORITE of the series! You will feel the sexual tension encase your body like a warm unforgiving blanket. Shivers and goosebumps will surround your skin. Your cheeks will become inflamed, and your mind, body, and soul will be held captive until the end of the journey. These two authors continue to amaze me with their fantastic co-writing skills.A strong heroine and a TO DIE FOR hero is the perfect recipe for a captivating and beautiful love story. With every new book in this series comes more sex, more suspense, and more drama. I will never get enough!The story of Rafe and Ava was intense, steamy, and adventurous. A mercenary hitman and a hand-model find themselves deep in the jungle struggling to survive. Danger is all around them. The elements of the jungle are unforgiving. They have to battle that danger along with their lust for one another. Objectives change in the midst of their situation. Rafe still has a mission to accomplish, but his strong protective feelings for Ava might end up costing him more than that.Ava was a great heroine - strong with such courage. Rafe was a fantastic hero. I had no doubt of that, because the male leads in this series always surpass my expectations. Together, these characters have such great and intense chemistry. You feel it from the moment they lay eyes on each other. Surprises, suspense, and a ridiculous amount of sexual tension cover every single page in this amazing new installment of the Hitman series. Clare and Frederick certainly have another hit on their hands!*Gifted copy provided by the publisher in exchange for an honest review*

I can always ALWAYS count on Ms. Armentrout to deliver a beautifully touching love story. A heart-warming romance full of humor, emotion, and passion, FOREVER WITH YOU was a thing of grace and charm. It brought out all the feels and satisfied all of the senses. This author gives us strong characters and highly emotional storylines. If I were to pick one word that sums up this novel and every novel Jennifer turns out, it would be LOVELY.I fell pretty hard for Nick and Stephanie's story. There was such a strong connection with these two and when it was ripped apart it gutted me. You have to be strong through this one and just know in your heart that this author will give you a happily ever after you will always remember.Stephanie and Nick were fantastic characters. They were so strong, refreshing, and charming. I loved how bold Stephanie was and I loved the fact that even though she had this tough exterior, Nick was always able to knock her off her game and rattle the hell out of her. My heart swelled for these two. I cheered them on the whole way through. You will experience a broad spectrum of emotion throughout this novel. It goes from funny, witty, and light to deep, tragic, and raw. This deals with real issues that some women and couples will be able to relate to. This is embedded with a great message and will definitely be able to touch some hearts.I'm never disappointed with this series or with this author. Her love stories always picks me up when I'm feeling down and reading them always acts as a great escape for me. Jennifer's writing is a thing of beauty and her stories are always must reads for me. FOREVER WITH YOU is part of a series but CAN be read as a standalone novel. If you are a newbie, I trust that you will fall instantly in love with this author's style. Hard core fans of this series and this author be prepared to fall in love all over again.*Gifted copy provided by the publisher in exchange for an honest review*

THIS was just the fix I was looking for! Another badass alpha hero sneaks his way into our hearts in UNTIL JAX. Prepare to get HOT under the collar because the sexual tension is OFF THE CHARTS!Before I go any further, I need to warn you that you DO need to read UNTIL JULY before you start this book. I know this is labeled as Book 1 in the UNTIL HIM series, but believe me, you need to start with Book 1 in the UNTIL HER series to be caught up at the beginning of UNTIL JAX.Ok, back to it! Jax Mayson has experienced his BOOM with Ellie Anthony. I love this whole BOOM concept with this family. It's INSTA-LOVE, but I freaking ADORE it! Yes, it is instant for Jax, but it's not for Ellie, so you get to experience the journey of her falling for this beautiful alpha male. I'm not a fan of overuse of terms of endearment, but it works for me with Jax. He says 'baby' all the time, and each time my heart flutters. I also love Jax's confidence. He knows what he wants in his future, and Ellie is IT. No more, no less. He just needs to spend his time protecting her, and convincing her that this is the real deal. It's cute, it's so alpha, and I expect nothing less from the amazing Ms. Reynolds.Ellie has secrets. Jax wants her trust. Enemies get closer, and the Mayson crew is ready for battle. Ellie is one of theirs now, and they will stop at nothing to stand by Jax's side and take on whatever threat might linger.UNTIL JAX is full of drama, scorching hot love scenes, and beautiful moments. I will never get enough of this amazing family and the new characters that pop up in every book. The family dynamic is so tight and makes me envious of what they share. They are always there for each other no matter what. It is just a beautiful experience with every new read. Full of ALPHA-GOODNESS and emotional and erotic scenes, this is one read you DO NOT want to pass up. So go forth and purchase, your lady parts will thank me later!*Gifted copy provided by the author in exchange for an honest review*

Victoria Ashley always brings the heat in her books. They are wonderfully erotic and extremely sexy. I enjoyed the reading despite a few things bothering me throughout. The plot was predictable BUT still enjoyable. Im a HUGE fan of dirty-talking heroes and Alex Carter was definitely one of them. There were parts that were sweet, a little emotional, and heavy. There were parts that were a little repetitive, but it didnt deter me from continuing on. This was fast-paced with not a lot of angst. I enjoyed Alexs POV. Im a big fan of love stories given in the male POV. Something for the Pain was dual POV, but I could have done without Tripps side. I didnt connect with her well. She was a little too much oh, woe is me in this book.The chemistry between Alex and Tripp was good. The chemistry between Lucas and Tripp was not so good, but that might have been intentional. The leading characters said each others names WAY too much. That made it a little awkward and a little too forced. I was digging the secondary characters, Ace and Harley. It seems like the author has another story there. We do get a little bit of Memphis and Lyric from book 1, but I could have used more because I adored those characters and missed them greatly.Towards the end, the declaration of love was a little anti-climactic and felt a little rushed. I wanted something emotional, something big, and it fell flat. All in all, I DID like this read, I just wish that it reached me on a deeper emotional level like Book 1 did. That being said, if you are an erotic romance reader, you should try this book out. It will get you all hot and bothered. If you are looking for a more powerful and emotional sexy read, this might not touch your heart the way you want, but it will make you blush.*Gifted copy provided by the author in exchange for an honest review*

WOW! I just fall in love every. single. time. with these books! This beautiful, sexy, and breathtaking book is over 700 pages of SEXY and EMOTIONAL goodness! Its page after page of pure delight and hours and hours of sensual scenes that will make you melt. I LOVE everything about this series. Im so grateful for Red Phoenix for bringing us this amazing character in Brie. Ive been a fan since the beginning and with each new book, comes a passionate and erotic journey of self discovery. Im emotionally invested in not only Brie and Sirs character, but every secondary character as well. Its amazing because you get to learn SO much about each character  their past, their present, their desired future. Each one has taken up a piece of my heart and with every ending, I miss them more and more.The intense love that Brie and Sir (Thane) share is transcendent. Im envious and yet I am their biggest fan. I feel for them during their struggles and I cheer for them when they triumph. They are so good for one another. They learn from each other and make each other whole in every way possible. Their easy dynamic is beautiful and refreshing. They chase away each others demons and bring light to each others darkness. I cant say enough good things about these two. This deep lovethis heavy devotion is something that I hope to have one day. They have fondness, friendship, respect, and love. You can feel it jump out of the pages with each turn.Again, Red Phoenix gives us SO MUCH MORE than just a sexy read with her Brie books. There is always a variety of emotions that these books pull out of me. She keeps us on our toes, and makes damn sure that we experience every laugh, every cry, every moan just like we were in the room with these characters. I will NEVER get enough of these books, and I hope that each journey Brie takes us on, we become that much closer to the characters that we fell in love with at the very beginning! I can always count on a Brie book to put a smile to my face and warmth to my heart. I will never tire of her adventures and her spirit. Red Phoenix created an amazing character, so easy to fall in love with and so easy to share a journey with.My recommendation: Take the journey. You will not regret it.*Gifted copy provided by the author in exchange for an honest review*

I can't stop smiling! What a fun, delectable, sexy read! Chelle Bliss always takes her alphas to the next level, giving us scene after scene of spicy goodness with a nice romantic undertone. It's always a special treat when you get the male's POV and it's done extremely well. Always making us swoon, always making us sigh, and always making us blush like crazy, this author gives us another intense, passionate, and overwhelmingly sexy love story. Every character she creates, I fall in love with. We always get a taste of the original Gallo men and that just makes me giddy as a school girl. The men of ALFA PI are dreamy, gorgeous, sexy, and freaking hilarious. I love how they are going down one by one by the women who are strong enough, witty enough, sassy enough to hold their own. This was a truly delicious, steamy good time!*Gifted copy provided by the author in exchange for an honest review*

BAD *** sassy female. BAD *** rugged biker. EXPLOSIVE chemistry. LIES, SECRETS, and MURDER. This fantastic MC Romance was raw, gritty, fast-paced, emotional, sexy, and INTENSE to the max! What an adrenaline rush! I devoured this book. I let Lip and Cherrys story consume me from the inside out. A solid, steamy and intense read!With every new book in this series, comes a new sense of admiration for this author and a new love of her writing. She takes a premise that you might not be comfortable with and turns it in to something so incredibly beautiful. She makes you fall in love with these foul-mouthed, sometimes rude, sometimes lewd, but ALWAYS sexy bikers. MC Romances are my favorite and MN Forgy is at the top of my list of authors I love in the genre. There was so much going on in this story. There is an expansive timeline we go through, but it adds so much to the story and helps guide us through this intense journey.Lip and Cherry. These two are quite the pair. Their initial meeting was fantastic! The sexual chemistry was scorching hot. The banter between these two was hilarious. There are twists and turns along with some pretty amazing sex scenes. I couldnt turn the pages fast enough. I wanted to get to the end but I didnt. I wanted to savor it, but I needed to get to their happily ever after. This was a tough journey to love for these two, but it was all worth it in the end. Im not bashing insta-love, because lord knows I love me some insta-love, but I appreciated the fact that this wasnt the case for Lip and Cherry. There was a slow build-up there,  and it was a lot of work, but that made it that much special when they finally experienced it.You cant go wrong with this series. Every character brings something special to the table and it seems like the stories keep getting better and better. MC Romance lovers will immediately sink their teeth in to this baby and they will not want to let go. If you are looking for a light, fluffy romance, this is not your book. This book has meat. This book has substance. This book has so much heart. Get ready for one shocking, incredibly, and intense journey.*Gifted copy provided by the author in exchange for an honest review*

Get ready to meet Blakelys sexiest, dirtiest alpha yet! Ryan Sloan will turn you into a tingling pile of goo. He will invade your dreams and fantasies. He will sweet talk you right out of your panties and charm you right into bed. Be prepared to be swooned right off your ass ladies!Book after book, chapter after chapter, page after page, and word after word, Blakely continues to take me to my happy place. Her sexy, dominating alpha males and her sassy, strong-willed leading females come together for the perfect mix of happily ever afters. She sets the scene like no other and her love stories are always a cut above the rest. Ryan and Sophies love story touched my heart and seared my soul. I know I probably say this with every new release, but their story is Blakelys best one yet!*Gifted copy provided by the author in exchange for an honest review*

A delicious and highly addictive tale of two people who never saw each other coming. Good intentions turn absolutely WICKED in Shayla Black's latest Wicked Lovers series. If you want a taste of what this author is capable of making you feel, pick this up immediately. I have no doubt that you will become completely obsessed!A rock legend...A small town girl...Get ready for a WICKED good time!The story of Jesse McCall, you might remember him from DECADENT, and Bristol Reese, sassy hometown woman who is in need of some assistance, she just doesn't know it yet.Horrible circumstances have forced Jesse into hiding until the media circus settles down. He overhears Bristol's predicament and steps right up to the plate to help her out. What was supposed to be a quick ruse to her family turns into a one night stand. That one night stand turns into playing house with the beautiful knight in disguised armor. Intense passion ensues. Emotions become tangled and feelings deepen. When Jesse's cover is blown, Bristol finds herself incredibly hurt. Bristol has become special to Jesse and he will do what it takes to earn her trust back. He wants forever. Is it possible to fall so hard in such a short amount of time or is Jesse just using Bristol to help his reputation with the media?I just ADORED these characters and it was nice to get a few visits from some previous Wicked Lovers characters as well. This little novella had it ALL - humor, quick wit, steamy love scenes, emotional upheaval, I couldn't put it down. I found this read charming, sweet, and sexy. I'm used to Shayla Black's Wicked Lovers series to be more heavily erotic. I'm not complaining either way. Black absolutely KILLS both genres. I only mention it because if you are brand spankin' new to this incredible author, PURE WICKED would be a great read to cut your teeth on. I have no doubt in my mind that you will fall in love with this author's writing, her characters, and the uncanny way she completely sucks you into her stories. I CANNOT and WILL NOT ever get enough!*Gifted copy provided by the publisher in exchange for an honest review*

Angel Payne and Victoria Blue are back with another scorching HOT, emotional romance that will have your head in the clouds and your heart in a vise. VERY well done!This story was smoking hot right from the start. Michael Pearson shows his dominant side in more ways than one, and I LOVED it! Margaux and Michael's chemistry is just on point and oh so heady. Together they took the good ole' school girl fantasy to another level. This was one of the best scenes in my mind because this is where Margaux realizes what Michael can really do for her. He can take her to another place and make her forget her worries. He can bring her a pleasurable pain that she never knew she craved. This was a great turning point for them and was a small window in to what was to come in this love story.Margaux Asher was not my favorite heroine going in to this book, but man did she redeem herself in NO MAGIC MOMENT. She won me over 100% in this installment of the series and she just surprised the hell out of me. I even realized the Margaux and I, are not all that different. I was able to relate to her on a couple of levels in this book. I mean sure she is ridiculously wealthy (and I'm not). And sure she has the gorgeous and sexy Michael Pearson on her arm (and I DO NOT). But she showed us great strength and tenacity in this book, and I was incredibly proud her the entire way through. The fact that it is so hard for her to shed tears, made my heart ache. The strength she shows for herself and for her relationship with Michael was a beautiful thing. She does NOT give up. She WILL NOT give up on herself or their relationship.Michael Pearson. GOD! I just melt every single time 'sugar' comes out of his insanely sexy mouth. I melt. I shudder. My heart skips a beat. Michael was a FANTASTIC male lead. We get to experience the yummy dominant side, as well as, the vulnerable side of Mr. Pearson. He put his heart in Margaux's hands and he trusts her with everything he has that she will take good care of it. Michael's past is the main topic on display in this book and I was so happy to have it revealed. Margaux shared her past with him, it was only fair to reveal his. The problem is, is that his past puts everyone he loves in danger and Margaux holds that top spot right now. When he decides that the only way to keep her safe is to let her go, well, let's just say, maybe he doesn't know Margaux as well as he thinks he does.Their relationship, their love, their happily ever after is put to the test in a big way in the latest installment of the Secrets of Stone series. We get TONS of make up sex, a deeper level of emotion, and a dash of suspense and I enjoyed ever minute of it. Don't worry ladies, you will get your Killian Stone fix as well. The easy relationship he has with his sister, the deep love he shares with his Claire, and the heartbreaking confession he has yet to share with anyone, comes to light in this fabulous read.Angel Payne and Victoria Blue did it right with NO MAGIC MOMENT. I'm looking forward to more of this series and more of these wonderful and complex characters.*Gifted copy provided by the authors in exchange for an honest review*

An absolutely beautiful conclusion to one of my all time favorite series! Finally, it is the Happily Ever After we have been waiting for and Lisa Renee Jones finishes it with such grace and beauty.With the enemies finally behind bars, Amy and Liam have a chance at living out their lives together forever. Amy is having a really hard time adjusting because she has been looking over her shoulder for years. On top of that there may be a couple missing pieces of the puzzle that are not accounted for. Liam is her safe place, her hero, her heart, but is it enough to finally move on from the past?In the final installment of this beautiful series, one of my favorite all time heroes shows his romantic side. Oh don't be fooled, the dominant is still VERY alive, but to help ease Amy's mind, Liam tries his best to shower her with tenderness and love. Amy deserves the world, and Liam will do everything in his power to give it to her. With all of the turmoil and strife still lingering, these two amazing characters draw strength from one another, showering each other with love, affection, and devotion. The love runs deep and so intense between Amy and Liam, you can't help but envy their connection.These two have been through so much. The obstacles, the struggles, all of it, testing their love day by day. Finally, their roadblock to happiness has been cleared.I felt such a sense of contentment while reading this book. I feel like I know these characters inside and out. I've been emotionally invested from day one, and it is so important to have their ending go down as one of the greats. There is just something about Lisa Renee Jones' characters that get to me down deep. Amy and Liam are two of those characters and they will forever be remembered in my heart.*Gifted copy provided by the author in exchange for an honest review*

It is incredibly hard to find the right words to describe this book and do it justice. All I know is that Alessandra Torre is a beautiful genius! I completely lost myself in this book from page one. For a few hours NOTHING else existed but these characters and their story. I didn't blink. I didn't breathe. I didn't sleep. This book surrounded me and I didn't want to come up for air. It teased all my senses, leaving me in a completely blissful state of mind. Ms. Torre sucked me in and everything else was a blur. I fell in love with Cole and Summer. I fell in love with their story and I fell in love with this town. Alessandra Torre is one of the elite. She is in a category all her own. Novel after novel she brings something new, something fresh to the table and I devour it every single time.This was an enthralling, emotional romance about taking risks. It's about finding yourself, finding your love, your passion, and the other half of your soul. This was EASILY one of my FAVORITE reads of the year!*Gifted copy provided by the author in exchange for an honest review*

What a thing of beauty! EVERY LOVE is a story of hope, acceptance, and sacrifice. This is an engaging love story about two people who are constantly fighting against their past. They shed light on each other's darkness. They chase away each other's demons, and as each day passes they slowly chip away at each other's walls, only to find bits and pieces of a broken heart inside. But with each smile, each laugh, and with each tender moment, they come closer to making one another whole again.EVERY LOVE moved me so much. It evoked such intense emotions out of me and had my full attention from the first few pages. It broke me in the best way possible. With each chapter came one more emotion that rocked me to my core. I didn't know what to expect with Nate's story. This man has been through Hell and back getting a second chance at life, only to have his heart destroyed when coming back home. It's rare you read a story where the hero get's a third chance at life, and Collins executes beautifully with EVERY LOVE. This author always pushes all the right buttons for me, making me feel emotions that I never thought possible. I was extremely excited for Nate to get his HEA, and Collins did his story justice. It's hard to beat the first two books in this series, because those characters held such a strong place in my heart, but Nate did wiggle his way in, even after all of the frustrations I had with him, and dug himself deeper than I thought possible.If you are EVERY looking for an emotionally gripping, real to life, beautiful love story, LK Collins is your author.*Gifted copy provided by the author in exchange for an honest review*

LOVED this! I used silk pillow cases in high school and I LOVED them then and I love them now! So comfortable and soft. Fits my pillow perfectly and it keeps my hair looking great in the morning! I think I will buy more!

WOW! This was so brilliant! One of THE BEST erotic romances I've ever read!I don't even know where to begin! I am so incredibly IN LOVE with this book! Beth Kery is one of those authors that just pop up out of nowhere with a FABULOUS read. I've only read one other novel by her and it was fantastic as well. I've become addicted to her writing style and every single thing that comes with it. It's a curse and a blessing that I didn't find out about this series until it was all bundled up in one pretty HOT package. It's a curse because, HOLY ****, where the **** have I been, living under a rock I guess. How did I not know about this? The blessing is because, THANK GOD, I would have gone absolutely bonkers if I had to stop for one second in Emma and Michael's story. THE AFFAIR is over 500 pages of delicious and erotic exploration. It's an explosion of  lust, sensation, and passion. This book oozes eroticism like no others before it. I'll say it again...ABSOLUTE BRILLIANCE!OMG! I'm so in love with these characters and their incredible journey they take together. I adored Emma. She is going down as one of my favorite heroines of all time. She is so strong, so complex, and yet, so new to the kind of passion that Michael brings to the table. I love her vulnerability and her courage. But most of all I love how she takes care of Michael. She breaks him down and builds him back up. She shows him his strengths and teaches him about forgiveness and acceptance. Oh, and Michael <insert sigh here>. I have fallen hard for this character. He is tortured. He is possessive. He is filthy rich and gorgeous. And like Emma, I admire the vulnerability he shows to Emma and Emma alone. He needs to be in control, but when Emma walks into his life, she steals it away, along with his heart. He has been through so much pain and suffering, and to him, Emma is a breath of fresh air in his life. She makes him feel alive and more important she just makes him FEEL. Together these two are explosive!I felt curiosity and excitement. I felt giddiness and a sense of adventure. I felt happiness, sadness, and so much angst. In the end I felt a profound sense of peace. The entire time I was reading this novel I was FEELING. It was refreshing and so **** perfect. I was utterly captivated by Emma and Michael's grand passion. This is a story I will always remember. These are characters that will forever be in my heart. This is the book you keep on your favorite bookshelf and every once in a while you look over at it and it just makes you smile. That my friends, is what you call an EPIC ROMANCE.*Gifted copy provided by the publisher in exchange for an honest review*

LOVED it! UNSAID was one of the better MM Erotic Romances I've read in a while. There is SO MUCH going on but not so much you get lost in the mess of things. It's complex, hilarious, and ridiculously steamy! Chock-full of drama, witty banter, and rich people problems, UNSAID played out like a TV show in my mind. It was incredibly enjoyable and warmed me in all the right places.If you are looking for a story with humor, romance, and all of the feels, UNSAID is the book for you. It can be a great summertime read or a one-nighter. Either way it will take you on an incredibly erotic journey you will not want to miss.*Gifted copy provided by the author in exchange for an honest review*

Sexy! Edgy! Raw! Perfection! This book made my pulse race and my entire body shudder. It gave me goosebumps and ripped me to pieces! BEGGING FOR IT smolders! It captivates and enthralls you. Pace takes us on a dark and erotic thrill ride that will test your limits. This book will have you diving deep into your soul making you crave your own dark fantasies.Jonah and Vivienne were superb characters. Their sensual bond is something to be envied. I came off of such a high after reading the first book and BEGGING FOR IT brought me right back up and I soon became addicted once more. In this stunning and enthralling conclusion to this series, we find out what happens when the games have ended. Is there more to their relationship than the various sexual scenarios that are played out between them? Jonahs struggles continue once he realizes Viviennes past. He doesnt want to be a monster, but Vivienne craves that beast inside of him. Vivienne is complete when she is in the midst of a game with Jonah. He gives her EVERYTHING she needs and in turn she satisfies his darker cravings. The games become too much for Jonah and Vivienne must decide if she can continue this relationship without them.THIS book! This fantastic read was unforgettable. This series is one that I will never leave me. It was so incredibly sensual, passionate, and intense. It was thought-provoking, emotional, and brilliant. It was just EVERYTHING!I became addicted after finishing up ASKING FOR IT, now I can safely say, Im completely and utterly OBSESSED!*Gifted copy provided by the publisher in exchange for an honest review*

Love Love LOVED this novella! STRIPPED DOWN was an all around SEXY good time! Steamy, sexual, and plenty emotional, this little gem of a book will bring a huge smile to your face, a blush to your cheeks, and a heaviness to your heart. BIG things come in this sexy little package!OMG! There is plenty of dirty talk right off the bat. Lorelei James wastes NO time at all. I could NOT stop smiling the entire time. I adored this premisebest man hooks up with maid of honor. I mean COME ON, that is PERFECT! Wynton Grant and Melissa Lockhart were SO GOOD together. So fun, light, witty, and ridiculously sexy. They will go down as one of my favorite couples from this author. Flirting turns into so much more in this Blacktop Cowboys novella. I loved how open and honest both characters were. They werent trying to hide or sugarcoat what they wanted from each other. They wanted to get down and dirty, simple as that. But a steamy hookup opens up the possibility of MORE. A secret withheld, brings out feelings that they never thought possible.STOP what you are doing and READ this quick and saucy love story! Hardcore fans of Lorelei James, like myself, will bask in the glory of her awesomeness with STRIPPED DOWN. Want a little taste of James style? Are you ready to become addicted? STRIPPED DOWN is a marvelous start down a journey you will never want to leave. Its SEXY! ROMANTIC! EMOTIONAL! The intense passion in this book will make you shiver. The emotional connection between these characters will make you sigh. The sexy as sin male lead will make you SWOON big time, as do all of Lorelei James heroes!Saddle up ladies and gents! You are in for one **** of a sexy ride!*Gifted copy provided by the publisher in exchange for an honest review*

"Rattlers" is a film made to watch under the stars at your local drive-in, along the lines of other such 70's "nature-gone-crazy" flicks like "Grizzly", "Kingdom of the Spiders" or "The Pack". Is it a good movie? I guess not, at least I don't think people looking for a great story, compelling characters and top notch acting will be interested in watch "Rattlers". But if you enjoy a so-bad-it's-good type of film, then this is definitely worth visiting.Something seems to be driving the rattlesnakes crazy, and forcing them into populated areas attacking people even when not being provoked. After two young boys are killed on a camping trip, the local police bring in a professor from the local college to help investigate the rash of snake attacks and the odd behavior of the reptiles.I think that what I love most about these cheesy 1970's critter features, is the use of real snakes. This may be a cheesy B-movie, but if the sight of snakes wriggling around in your bathtub or crawling up your pant-leg doesn't give you the uber-willies, then you have to be made of stone. There are some seriously goosebump raising scenes in the film (the bathtub scene in particular gave me the heebie-jeebies).Streaming for free for PRIME members, so check it out.

I've heard the saying that a Bonfire is the hillbilly equivalent of a Night Club, and I would have to agree with that. From about mid-May through Halloween, at least one night every weekend, you can find my family and friends hanging around the fire pit, roasting hot dogs, making hobo pies while we listen to music, or watch movies on the outdoor screen, it's our Spring/Summer/Fall ritual. But come November, it's time to pack away the outdoor gear and get ready for the bitter cold and snowy weather. Thanks to this cover, I can make sure that our Summer hang-out remains in good condition through the Winter months.

Fun game that combines gameplay from Cards Against Humanity and Apples to Apples. Gameplay consists of each player taking turns being the "judge", the judge draws a phrase card that reads something like "True love means ----" then each player turns in one of the 8 Urban Dictionary words to fill in the blank. The determines which card is funniest and the player that turned in the card wins that round. There are also rounds where the judge picks up a card and has to either draw or act out one of the Urban Dictionary phrases.With a lot of friends this can be a fun, raunchy game.

I picked this up for a pretty selfish reason. I actually have no issue with just grabbing a quick glass of water straight from the tap, I guess having well water as opposed to "city" water can make a difference? Either way, my wife says that the water from the tap tastes "gross" so every week when we're grocery shopping, we always pick up a case of water....and that thing is HEAVY!! I honestly got tired of lugging the things up the steps into the house every week.I grabbed the Ultimate Pitcher for her to try (along with a sport bottle she can take to the gym), and so far it seems to work great. We simply fill the pitcher as needed, the little filter LED lets her know the filters are working and she claims the water, right from the tap, tastes great. The PUR says the filter will last for 2 months, or 40 gallons, something like that. All I know is that I haven't had to carry a case of water into the house in the past two weeks, and I'm lovin' that!

If you want a solidly built watch, with a classic look, then this Invicta is for you. I was surprised at the weight of the watch, and the feel. It's heavy, but I like that feature. If I'm going to wear a watch, I want something with a little heft and bulk. I see some other reviews claiming the watch face looks "cheap", I don't find that to be the case. I think is has a classic look, and it's actually quite striking.While I usually only wear watches when I'm wearing a suit for work or going to visit clients, this may be a watch I wear more often. This watch looks and feels like it would/should cost at least twice what it's listed for here.

I vividly remember seeing this box on the shelf in my local video stores, and thought it might be fun to give this film a try sometime. Well I guess I waited long enough and found this on TV one late night (on Turner CLASSIC Movies of all places???).  I guess if you've never seen a killer fetus movie, you might as well pop in "It's Alive".Hoping for a cornball, so-bad-it's-good movie, I sat down to watch this thing. And while it does have that 70's aesthetic I like, I found myself bored about 20 minutes in, and as the film played out, it just became a chore to sit through.A married couple are about to have their second child, they've waited awhile, (10 years or so?) and the mother has been on birth control pills. When the labor pains kick in, they drive to the hospital where is soon becomes apparent that something is wrong with the baby. Once the little thing pops out of the womb, it starts murdering the doctors and nurses (no, we don't get to see any of it) and takes off through a skylite. Of course the murders are big news, and the family's life is wrecked as it becomes known that they conceived a little monster.Somewhere in here, there is a fun movie, but the slow pace, the lack of any decent horror or suspense, and the complete lack of cheesy fun make this one difficult film to slog through. Maybe if they chopped the running time down to 80 minutes, I would feel differently, but at an hour and 45 minutes, this is painful.

Finally got around to watching this latest entry in the "Child's Play" series, and I went in with very low expectations. While I loved "Bride of Chucky" and the sense of humor that film brought with it, "Seed of Chucky" went a loooong way in killing off any interest in this series. I knew this had come out, and I also knew it went straight to video, which is never a good sign, so "Curse of Chucky" fell off my radar pretty quickly.Stumbled across the Blu-ray at a yard sale a few weeks back and picked it up for $2, I figured I couldn't really lose at that price. Popped in the movie last night, and me and the kids had a BLAST!! This honestly may be my favorite film in the series.As the movie opens a young woman in a wheelchair living with her mother in their old house receive a large package from Fed-Ex. Inside the package is a Good Guy doll, neither express much interest in the thing, and neither know who sent it. Forgotten they shove it in a chair and forget about it. Later that evening the mother "commits suicide", and her extended family come to the house for the funeral, giving us a large pool of victims for Chucky to work through."Curse" isn't just a re-tread, it adds some new, fun twists to the story. I really liked that the film featured a young woman in a wheelchair as our protagonist, I'm not sure I've ever seen that in a film before? (No.....just no....."Mac & Me" doesn't count!!!). I like too that while they kept a touch of comedy in the film, the suspense also made a nice comeback. Now, I won't try to convince anyone that "Chucky" is scary, but they do a good job of building up the suspense in several scenes.If you are a fan of the series, you'll enjoy all of the flashbacks, and ties this film has to the previous films in the series, but even if you haven't seen any of the other films, you'll still be able to enjoy this movie. Great for a Halloween party!!

I actually picked this up for my son, but my wife was the first to open the box, and the minute she felt that soft, warm fleece lining, his hoodie became her hoodie.Perfect for the cool crisp nights of Autumn, this hoodie is perfect to take along to the pumpkin patch or to those Friday night varsity football games. You stay warm, but not hot.

Makin' waves. My daughter asked me to grab this for her, she has beautiful hair, but it's straight as a pin. She uses a curling iron, but she wanted to give this wand a try because she wants waves, not curls. It took a couple tries, but she finally found the heat setting wanted and how to use the wand to get the waves she wants.

While I enjoy these film adaptations, I want to highly recommend you read the novels first. While the film's are done very well, each novel is filled with such rich detail, you can't help but lose quite a bit of magic in transition from page to screen. Specifically starting with the third novel, "The Prisoner of Azkaban" and through the end of the series, so much is trimmed for the purpose of the film running time, that whole chunks of story and sometimes even great characters and character development never makes it to the screen.Harry is returning to his 6th year at Hogwarts, but after the events in "The Order of the Phoenix", he finds himself a bigger celebrity than ever. Voldemort is gaining more power and his Death Eaters are bringing havoc to not lonely the Wizarding world, but causing harm to the muggle world as well, killing or kidnapping anyone that gets in their way. Harry, Ron and Hermione suspect that Draco Malfoy has joined the Death Eaters, and suspect that he is plotting with the Dark Lord to overthrow Hogwarts.I will say that this film seems to change the most from the source material. Yes the basic storyline is the same, but tons of details are swapped around. For instance in the novel, Dumbledore warns Harry against being "collected" by Professor Slughorn, when in the film it's said that Dumbledore wants Harry to become part of the "Slug Club". Sure it's a small detail, but it the shift changes the characters, and their actions, quite a bit from the page to the screen. There are similar changes throughout the telling of this story, with some fantastic character development surrounding Voldemort that is completely left. out.This film seems much darker in tone, even in the way it's shot, there are no sweeping shots of the castle or grounds. When Hogwarts is shown,  it's usually in the dark or the sky is murky cloudy. The wonderous, magical quality is toned way down in the film, so that instead of fantasy, you feel uneasy about what has happened in Harry's world. A good film, but bit more morose and melancholy than what's come before it.

If you are a fan of this series, you will love this book.....but, you'll hate this book at the same time, and one thing is certain,  you won't be able to put it down. I would say that this is Rowling's most challenging novel of the series. Unlike the previous novels in the series, "The Order of the Phoenix" really feels aimed at an older reader, tackling subjects such as; losing as loved one, life after death, aging, isolation, political machinations, bureaucracies, higher education, etc.Before Harry can even think about returning to Hogwarts for his fifth year of education, he has to get through the Summer with his obnoxious, borderline abusive, "muggle" family. While trying to keep and eye and ear open for any sign of "You Know Who" after the events of the previous novel, he's having a hard time adjusting to non-wizarding life, and feels cut-off from his friends and the secret world that he loves so much. Not know what is happening with Voldemort and feeling that his friends have abandoned him, Harry is dealing with the mounting of tension, waiting for Voldemort to strike, and when he's forced to use magic one Summer night, Harry soon finds out that even the Ministry of Magic may be compromised.If you thought Voldemort was horrible, he's nothing compared to Rowling's creation Dolores Umbridge. You will despise this character, she is simply horrible....delightfully horrible. I honestly cannot tell you how wonderfully awful this character is, and you'll want to continue reading this novel in the hopes that she will get what she deserves. by the end of the novel.With that said, I think this may be the weakest novel in the series. Not because of Umbridge, she is a wonderful addition to the story, and a much more grounded evil for Harry to fight. I had a few issues with the novel, first and foremost was Harry himself. He's kind of jerk throughout this novel, whining and full of self-pity one moment, losing his temper and raging at those around him the next. Harry also seems to have suddenly gotten a bit stupid between books, as he makes dumb mistake after dumb mistake in this novel. I always like Harry prior to this novel, but he just comes off really badly in this entry. I would also say that "Order of the Phoenix" is the first time where I really think Rowling's editor should've done a bit more chopping, and tightened up the story a bit. Even after the climax of the story, the book drags on as we get quite a few chapters of exposition where two characters sit and talk for page after page after page. While the info being discussed is important to the story, it's written here as an information dump, just page after page of dialogue. This info should've been doled out in a different way, or sprinkled throughout the story instead.I do want to end on a positive note, and will say that I loved the introduction of Luna Lovegood, and I really enjoyed leaning more about Neville Longbottom, and "Order of the Phoenix" really builds to the final two books of the series as Rowling has created real stakes for her characters.

My daughter recently discovered "The Monkees" and had to get this shirt. She loves it and wore it to a recent "Monkees" concert. She got lot of compliments from fellow fans, and it's almost a guarantee that when she wears it to school, she's only one sporting a Monkees T-shirt.

I remember when this book came out, and I was amazed that kids were lining up to read a 1000+ page novel!! (I have to admit I was right there in line with them), and while I read the novel, I kept wondering just how in the world they would ever be able to make a film adaptation. The novel is PACKED with tons of new characters, the Quidditch World Cup, the Tri-Wizard tournament.....just tons of stuff, and I thought for sure it would have to be split into two films. When I found out that "Goblet of Fire" was going to be a single film, with a running time similar to the earlier films in the series, I figured they would be cutting the story to the bone, and was prepared to be disappointed in the movie.I will say that they story is cut way, way down. We go from the opening at the Riddle house to the Weasley household to the World Cup to Hogwarts within the first 10 - 15 minutes of the film. What took a few hundred pages in the novel takes up almost no screen time. The storytelling in the film is crisp and while huge sections of the novel are glossed over or left out completely, the film is very entertaining and coherent, but quite a bit of character building is lost in the process. The leads get their time to shine, but the supporting case doesn't get to do a whole lot. Snape is relegated to the background for most of the film, and Rickman's portrayal of the Potions Professor as been a highlight of the series so far. We don't really get to know the other competitors in the Tri-Wizard Tournament either, specifically Cedric Diggory. It's a shame that we can't really get invested in these characters as they play such a vital role in the overall story. The F/X again are top notch, and again the three leads really feel natural in the roles now, they've made these characters their own, and it shows.I really think this film should've been split into two movies. There is just so much lost in the transition from Page to Screen, that while this film does feel complete, fans of the series know there was a much bigger, and better story to tell. As it is, "Goblet of Fire" is a good movie, but it's not a great movie.

"The Prisoner of Azkaban" may be my favorite book in the Harry Potter series, and while I was excited to watch the film adaptation, I was a bit worried about what would be left out of the film (so many wonderful parts of the books never made it onto film with the first two movies), and I also worried that the filmmakers would tame down the exciting climax, because this is, after all, a "kids" movie.I will say right up front, that the film makers nailed the climax, and while some details are changed from the source material, the climax to this film is absolutely nail-biting fun. The F/X are top notch, and the score this time around is a bit less "fantastical" and a bit darker, almost horror-like. As we see Harry return once more to Hogwarts School for his 3rd year of wizarding study, we learn that an infamous wizard known as Sirius Black, suspected of being one of Voldemort's supporters, and a convicted murderer, has escaped the wizard prison of Azkaban. Due to Black's escape the countryside and Hogwarts school is being patrolled by Dementors, the nasty wraith-like Azkaban guards who are searching for Black. It is thought that Black is coming after Harry to finish what Voldemort was unable to.Lots of twists and turns, and the supporting characters get to shine as much as our hero. With the introduction of Professor Lupin, Rowling creates one of the most endearing characters of the series. Alan Rickman as Snape, gets a bit more to do here than in "Chamber of Secrets" and steals every scene he's in. I think what really lifts this third film in the series over the previous two is that the kids feel more natural here. Instead of constantly wearing school robes, we see them running around in jeans and t-shirts. This film also doesn't feel so "by-the-numbers", and while some of the stuff I loved about the novel is missing, the film doesn't suffer for it. Best film of the series to this point.

Who knew that those old Church hymns such as "Leaning on the Everlasting Arms" or "Bringing in the Sheaves" could send chills of terror up your spine?"The Night of The Hunter" is a fantastic film, chock for a atmosphere, chills, thrills and one of Robert Mitchum's greatest performances as psychopathic preacher Reverend Harry Powell. As the film opens we see a group of children playing hide and seek when one of the kid's stumbles upon a woman's body shoved into a cellar. We then meet the murderer, the "Reverend", as he's talking to God, already on the lookout for his next victim, targeting young widows. The "Reverend" spends some time in the local jail for car theft, and his cell mate happens to be a young man about to hung for the murder of two bank clerks that he shot in the middle of robbery. The Reverend soon learns that the man made off with $10,000 from the robbery, and that he's left a young wife behind, and two children, and the killer now knows who his next victim will be.There is so much to enjoy about this film, from the stark black and white photography, lit and shot for maximum atmosphere, to the haunting soundtrack. But honestly, this movie is worth the price of admission for Robert Mitchum. The menace just drips off the screen making Harry Powell one of the greatest villains in movie history. Charles Laughton's direction is fantastic, it's really a shame this was his only film behind the camera. Highly recommended.

I will say that the first 5 minutes of this film had me hooked. Two hillbilly delivery guys delivering toxic materials riding along a country road, hit a deer and container of their poisonous goo falls into a small, beaver infested lake. We then meet three girls on a weekend country getaway...and the film starts to go downhill. It's usual horror movie set-up where the girls are soon joined by their boyfriends at the rustic cabin, and the next thing you know, zombie beavers are attacking.I'm normally a big fan of stupid. I willingly admit, I enjoy more than a fair share of those lame Syfy movies, and with a little editing, "Zombeavers" could almost go into steady rotation with "Snakehead Terror" and "Lavalantula". Where the film loses me, is the supposedly "clever" dialogue, which just.......doesn't........stop. The jokes fall flat, and the dialogue feels like the writer sat down and reach a bunch of "witty" comments on Facebook and incorporated them into the film. Even at just over an hour and 10 minutes, this film feels drawn out, and exceedingly dull.

With the second installment in the Harry Potter film series, we get a nice bump in the visual F/X, and a story with a bit more edge than "Sorcerer's Stone". Unfortunately, some of the best elements of the novel, and from the first film are left out. Again, I want to state that if you are only familiar with the world of Harry Potter because of the films, you are really missing out. J.K. Rowling packs so much into each installment, it would be impossible for any film to capture it all, and some of the greatest bits of the novels don't make it onto film.As we pick up Harry's story, he's trapped with his abusive "muggle" family waiting to return to Hogwarts. We learn that Harry has been pretty much cut off from the wizarding world thanks in part to his nasty Uncle, but also in large part to a small house elf named Dobby. The small creature is doing his best to protect Harry from returning to Hogwarts in fear that Harry's life is in danger. With the help of the Weasley's, Harry is soon back in Hogwarts ready to start classes again. It's not long before students are found petrified, and bloody messages are written on the walls proclaiming the "Heir of Slytherian" has opened the Chamber of Secrets, and has unleashed the monster that resides there.There are some really fun scenes here, and a few that will make the goosebumps pop (Ron and Harry in the forest!!!!), and the story is a bit more complex this time around. The special F/X are top notch in this entry, and the CGI work, specifically on Dobby, is fantastic. While I really wish they could've squeezed in more scenes with Alan Rickman's Professor Snape, I did thoroughly enjoy Kenneth Branagh as Gilderoy Lockhart. This was Richard Harris' last film and while Dumbledore doesn't play a large part in the film, it was a nice send off to a great actor. Finally, Jason Isaacs as Lucius Malfoy is wonderfully evil. Isaacs was born to play this role (and almost every bad guy...ever! Would love to see him in a James Bond villain role?!), and he steals every scene he's in.Really good film, and the series only gets better from here.

Nice shower caddy. If you are looking to maximize your space, this is a handy shower caddy to pick up. It gives you plenty of space on the top shelf for even the largest shampoo and conditioner bottles. Bars of soap, razors and any other small toiletries you might have will fit perfectly on the bottom shelf too. The hooked end of the shelf also makes a handy place to hang your loofa.

I want to start this review by saying that if you are only familiar with the film versions of "Harry Potter" and have not read the original novels by J.K. Rowling, before you push play on this DVD, pick up a copy of the novel and read it before watching this film, or any film in the series. Yes, I like this movie just fine, but Rowling packs so much into each of her novels, and so little of her rich storytelling actually makes it onscreen, you're missing out on quite a bit if you've skipped the novels.With that said, I'm not sure that I really need to go into the plot of this film? I think that "Harry Potter" and his story have entered the public consciousness in the same way that other films like "Jaws", "Lord of the Rings" and "Star Wars" have. People know the story even if they've never cracked a page or seen a flicker of the films. This first film tackles Harry's first year a Hogwart's School of Wizardry and Witchcraft, we meet Harry's friends and foes, and see Harry adjusting to life as a young wizard.The special F/X are a mixed bag, at points capturing the wonder and feel of real magic, but at other times, the CGI work is pretty poor, and it feels cartoon-y (the troll attack and the centaur Firenze looking especially poor). But the setting, the castle, the Quidditch scenes all look great. If you're a fan of the novel, you'll probably like what they've included in the film. The cast is pitch perfect, in particular Alan Rickman as Professor Snape. His menace just oozes off the screen.I guess what it really comes down to for me, is what is left out of this film. The real character development, the friendship between Ron, Hermione and Harry. In a novel as packed as "The Sorcerer's Stone", I fully understand the film makers dilemma of wondering what to include, but this film feels like they were so concerned with hitting key points from book, that they've forgotten to develop the characters. While the film does capture some of the wonder of Rowling's material, it lacks the heart. I wonder what this movie could've been if someone like Steven Spielberg had been behind the camera?

I have used another brand of pods in my laundry, but wife didn't care for the results, She said she felt as if the pods left an itchy residue on her clothes, and preferred liquid detergent.I decided to give the Wisk pods a chance to see if we had better results, and it seems that we have. The Wisk pods left the laundry smelling and feeling great. Here in the middle of summer we had grass stained shorts, sweaty socks and t-shirts, ground in dirt, ash stains from the bonfire, bug repellant residue...the usual grime and grit of summer on all of our stuff, and the Wisk pods got it all out. Our clothes came out of the wash smelling fantastic, and really clean.

We usually have a big 4th of July party every year, and I like to make sure there are lots of things to do for my yard full of guests. When the kids were little, it was easy, hook up the sprinkler or the slip n' slide and for the adults it was usually horseshoes, ladder ball and a cooler full of beer. Not much has changed really, I guess the kids have outgrown the sprinkler (but probably not the slip n' slide?) so I've been looking for new and different things to try. I saw this hook and ring game and thought, that might provide a little distraction (especially combined with the cooler full of beer), and it does the trick....for a short while. We had a bonfire the other night, and I saw several people stop to give the game a try, and I would say at one point in the evening almost everyone gave the ring a toss or two, but they quickly lost interest. It's actually pretty difficult to get the ring on the hook!! It probably didn't help that it was almost 95 degrees out and pretty humid, so that even swinging in a hammock could make you sweat. I'm hoping we get a better day for July 4th, and if the results are better I'll post and update.

I'm really glad I"ve decided to go back and re-read the "Harry Potter" series. It's been years since I had first read these novels, and I was hoping that they were as fun and imaginative as I remembered. With the film adaptations, which I'm very familiar with, you forget all of the little things in the novel which never made it onto the silver screen, and for that reason alone, you should make sure you read Rowling's series and not be content with the films alone."The Chamber of Secrets" features Harry's second year at Hogwarts School, but getting to the school in the first place seems to be a challenge, with both magical and mundane obstacles out to stop the young wizard. As the school year begins, someone or something is attacking students, seeming to pick on wizards born to "muggle" families specifically. Because of his fame, and his history, suspicion soon falls on Harry, and he must prove his innocence and stop the attacks before someone dies.With "Chamber of Secrets" Rowling proves that she is more than a flash-in-the-pan, and that her imagination is astounding. From the "Headless Hunt" on Halloween, to pruning the garden gnomes, to a forest full of nasty spiders, fantastic images and passages drip off every page. And not only does Rowling provide a fun and imaginative ride, she writes it so well, building on the foundation of her first novel, and expanding her magical universe in a way that pulls in readers of all ages.Captivating, full of wonderful characters, scary monsters, and at times a wonderfully morbid sense of humor, "Chamber of Secrets" is a fantastic novel.
Fancy soap. I almost hated to take this out of the box as it looks so nice! The Pre de Provence Soap smells great and lathers up very nicely, perfect for everyday use, or for a guest a bathroom.

I knew little to nothing about this novel when I pulled it up on my Kindle. I had heard of the title, but I think that was in relation to the movie (which I've never seen?). I have to say that I was hooked almost immediately, as I like this style of narrative. Like Fannie Flagg's "Fried Green Tomatoes at the Whistle Stop Caf". "Water for Elephants" is told through a series of flashbacks by the elderly narrator, and one of my favorite writing styles is where I'm reading, but being told a story by the narrator.As the novel opens we are witness to a "murder" and a horrible "accident" under a circus big top. We then meet 93 year old Jacob, a former veterinarian who is having a difficult time getting used to life in a retirement home. The entire home is abuzz due to a circus arriving in town. Jacob soon begins to recall his youth, and the time spent as vet on the Benzini Brothers traveling circus.Jacob's times spent with Benzini and the people who run and worked that show will pull you right in. This is the first Sara Guren novel I've read, but it won't be the last. She creates wonderful characters, that you both love...and hate. Her writing is so vivid, you can smell the sawdust and cotton candy, and she has the ability to get you chuckling one moment and choking up the next.This is a wonderful novel, and one I would highly recommend.

With a pretty decent cast, and an interesting premise, I was hoping that "Would You Rather" would be a fun little nail-biter, and while it has it's moments, it's not a movie I will re-visit any time soon.A young woman named Iris agrees to take part in a secretive game in hopes of winning enough money to get her cancer-stricken brother the medical procedure he needs. Iris arrives at the mansion owned by the Lambrick family, and we see the father and son have set up a nasty little game for their entertainment. 8 contestants much choose between two options per round, with the difficulty increasing each round. Actions such as strap a set of electrodes onto your head and onto your neighbor's head, and they have to choose whether to shock themselves or their neighbor. As the stakes in each round climb, so does the body count.The premise isn't bad, and Jeffrey Combs and Robin Lord Taylor as the twisted father and son Lambricks, are fun to watch, but honestly, in a movie like this we already know the outcome...or I should say, genre fans should know where this is going pretty much from the opening moments. There are no surprises here, and the repetitive nature of the film can get a bit tedious over it's 90 minutes.Still, if you happen to see this movie available Prime, it's worth a view.

July 4th is right around the corner, and at my house that means a huge party. We live right behind a park where one of the largest fireworks displays in our area is set off, so every year our house is packed with kids, animals, and every relative within driving distance.
