Because of this, I'm usually doing yardwork the entire week before, not only making sure it looks nice, but also making sure we don't have any scrub brush where ticks can be hiding, or worse yet a poison ivy patch where one of my little nephews could wander in and become a bumpy mass the next morning.I grabbed up this Ortho Max to make my life a little easier. Instead of walking around with a hoe, and chopping at the brush, I can simply stroll along spraying the thicker brushy areas with this specifically designed tough brush & poison ivy spray a couple weeks ahead of the game. Give it some time to die off and dry up, go back with my heavy rake and put it all in a burn pile. No more breaking my back attacking the thicker growth, and I don't have to worry about anyone leaving the party covered in nasty poison ivy bumps.

When it comes to recommending this series, I really have to say it depends on the person I'm speaking to. "Sons of Anarchy" is a gritty and brutal TV show, with shocking scenes of violence and for a television show, quite a bit of sex. With that said, it also features some of the best characters I've seen on TV this side of 'Breaking Bad", and several episodes that are edge-of-your-seat nailbiters.The Sons of Anarchy are a motorcycle gang that operates out of the small California town of Charming. Through the series we follow Jax Teller, the son of one of the club's founders as he's making his way through the ranks of the club. His step-father is the current president as the show opens, and his mother, Gemma, is the de-facto den mother to the whole club. As the series progresses we see that Jax is determined, like his father, to get the Sons away from the outlaw activity they've gotten pulled into over the years. Jax wants a better life for his family, but extracting the club from the criminal activity is much trickier than he knows.Power struggles from within and from without the club, rival gangs, the local cops, the federal government, and even the IRA all have some sort of claim on the Sons. Watching Jax try to maneuver through this minefield, all while dealing with the various personalities in his club makes for fascinating viewing.I know that the show's star is supposed to be Charlie Hunnam's character Jax, but I have to say that the reason I kept turning back in was to see what Gemma (Katey Sagal) was going to do in each episode. Gemma is that rare TV character, like "Walter White", where despite their despicable actions, you still like them. Ron Perlman as "Clay Morrow" is another huge reason I recommend the show. There is just something so charismatic about Perlman and his character, you get pulled in one episode after the next. The acting across the board is first rate, as you get to know the club members, you really begin to like so many characters. And I have to say that "Sons of Anarchy" doesn't pull any punches with the fates of it's characters, there are certain episodes where you'll sit with your jaw on the floor, and a tear in your eye when the end credits roll.The only thing holding me back from a full 5 star rating is there are two seasons which hurt the overall story. During the 3rd season, the club gets stuck over in Ireland for a large chunk of the show. Taking the club out of Charming just didn't feel right, and having them roaming the Irish landscape with the IRA just didn't click for me. And I have to ding the show for the final season. Without providing spoilers, they basically turned the entire core premise of the first six seasons on it's ear, and it dragged on a few episodes too long.This is a compelling show, full of unforgettable characters, and definitely worth checking out.

I'm honestly not sure how many times I've watched this film, a few dozen since my first viewing in the theater probably? I love this movie, it has everything you could want, great action, extremely quotable, a cool synth heavy 80's score, great F/X, and Schwarzenegger at his physical peak.Does anyone really need a plot synopsis of this film? I can't imagine there are too many people new to this series or story, and even someone seeing this film for the first time probably already knows the basic idea. Mankind is nearly wiped out in the future by machines, but a leader emerges that unites the survivors to fight back against the machines. In order to stop this leader the machines send back a terminator, a robot designed specifically to kill a specific target, in this case the leader's mother, Sarah Conner. The human send back someone as well, someone to protect Sarah from the mechanized killer.I think what I like best about this film, is that it's a sci-fi film wrapped up in the trappings of an 80's slasher horror film. When you get down to it, there are very few differences between The Terminator and Jason Voorhees. And unlike later entries in this series, there is still a grit here, it's not all shiny and glossy. This is another 80's classic, and one you should definitely add to your collection.

I honestly don't know what I could say in a review of this novel that hasn't been said already, and judging by the overwhelming number of 5 star reviews posted here, it's easy to see this is one of the most loved books you can find on this site. I've decided to re-visit the world of "Harry Potter" for the second time, specifically to re-read all of the novels in order to see if they still hold their magic all these years later, and if my rating is any indication, the first story is as good, if not better the second time through.I won't bother with a plot summary as I think this story is so well known, it's like "Huck Finn", "To Kill a Mockingbird" or "Carrie". The story simply entered the public consciousness that I would figure even people who've never read the books or seen the movies could still tell you the basics of the story. With that said, you are really doing yourself a disservice if you skip this book and only watch the film adaptation. "The Sorcerer's Stone" is so jam packed with imagination, and fun little detail, I truly think you could read and reread this tale several times, and pick up something new with each reading. J.K. Rowling not only creates wonderful, lovable and horrible characters, but she also builds an amazing world to place them in. I was so impressed with the work Rowling built for her story, and upon this reading, I was fascinated to see all of the little things she drops into her first novel which play a much bigger role in the whole story, right from the beginner, the building blocks are in place for the larger tale, and it's really fun to go back and pick up on the clues she's sprinkled around.There's are good reason this novel, and this story captured the world's attention, and if you are reading it for the first time (I'm envious of you), or for the 50th time, you are going to have a great time.

I had no clue that this movie/mini-series even existed? Flipping around Netflix I stumbled onto it, and figured it was a remake of the Drew Barrymore film, so I popped it on. I didn't realize until it started rolling that I was looking a 3 hour film viewing. Apparently this was a mini-series for the SyFy channel back in the early 2000's, that most likely explains why it flew under my radar. As a big Stephen King fan, I'm usually on top of any made-for-tv or theatrical films made which are based on his work. But once SyFy canceled MST3K, they kind of dropped out of notice."Firestarter 2-Rekindled" is a remake in a way, but it falls more into the sequel territory. They do re-tell the McGee's story through flashbacks, and the expand a bit about what the Shop was doing with Lot 6, so if you aren't familiar with the original film or King's novel, you can get caught up to speed pretty quickly. As this film opens though Charlie is in her 20's and has been hiding from the various agencies and people that want to study/capture her. A young man who thinks he's tracking down people to help settle an old lawsuit has inadvertently been tracking down the survivors of the old Lot 6 experiment, and he manages to track down Charlie. John Rainbird, the assassin from the first film survived the events of Charlie's run-in with the Shop, and he's expanded his role to caring for several "special" children, each with a unique power or ability. Rainbird wants to use Charlie to demonstrate the abilities of his new children.While not exactly good, "Firestarter 2" isn't horrible either. The cast is really good with Dennis Hopper & Malcolm McDowell chewing up scenery. The F/X are about on par with your typical SyFy film, lots of CGI flames, but again it's watchable. The story is also kind of fun as it plays out like "Firestarter vs. X-Men Babies". The film lacks any real punch or excitement, but it never really drags either. I would say give it a view if you have nothing better to do on a rainy Sunday afternoon, but doubt I would buy the DVD for repeated viewings.

If you love 80's horror movies, like I do, you'll probably enjoy "Survive the Night". It has all of the tropes of a classic slasher, with a variety of stereotypes getting offed while enjoying a rave in an abandoned NYC subway tunnel.Casey, a one-time soccer champ is just getting out of rehab after dealing with a nasty pain pill addiction. Casey tells her parents that she's going over to her former soccer teammate's house for a sleepover, but soon after her father leaves, Casey's "real" friends show up. Julie, Aya and their leader Shana leave with Casey to go into the city to watch Casey's ex-boyfriend play a gig. While at the club, Casey begins to think back on her actions, and her stint in rehab. She regrets how she her relationship with her boyfriend ended, and she's not too sure hanging with Shana and her friends is the best thing to do so quickly after getting clean. The night's events get amped up a notch when the group goes in search of an epic rave they've heard about, a "Survive the Night" rave, which won't end, and participants are unable to leave until the following morning. Once the group find the rave, it's not long before people begin turning up dead, and the survivors learn that something is stalking them through the mold covered tunnels.I have to say, "Survive the Night" threw me a few twists, I won't spoil anything here, but what at first appears to be a straight ahead slasher, becomes something else about 3/4 of the way through. The characters aren't developed very well beyond Casey and Shana, but if you're a genre fan, then that's nothing new. "Survive the Night" is a quick read, and it's pretty enjoyable if you just want something quick and nasty.

I was never a big fan of this movie and I wasn't quite sure why? My wife on the other hand loves it and while flipping around the channels looking for something to watch, we happened across this film, and showed it to our kids. I'm pretty sure that everyone knows the plot of this one, and it's entered the public consciousness, but just in case there are a few cave dwellers out there.An obnoxious voice-over artist gets fired from his latest job, and travels over to his kids' school to pick them up so that he can throw his 12-year old son a birthday party, even though his son has been told by their mother, that no party's are allowed. The party soon gets out of hand with petting zoo animals running wild, loud music and police arriving to shut everything down. The mom arrives home in time to see kids literally swinging from the chandeliers, and horses roaming through her living room. She is so furious with her oblivious husband she demands a divorce. Instead of learning anything from his wife or the experience, the actor pouts and places all of the blame on the mother. Being without a job and without a decent place for the kids to live, the actor loses custody of the kids. And unless he can prove that he can hold down a job, then his visitation will be restricted. The mother, needing some help with the kids and house, puts an ad in the paper for a housekeeper. Her now ex-husband sabotages the add, and answers the add himself, dressed in an old woman disguise.I think some age has put into perspective why I never really liked this film. Robin Williams' "Daniel" is a horrible person, just completely unlikable. He's a jerk, he's rude, he's awful to the people around him, and he honestly doesn't care. As the film opens we see him wasting thousands of dollars by refusing to stay on script while voicing a cartoon, he the proceeds to throw his wife under the bus by throwing a huge party trashing their house, and then whines when she says she's had enough. Then, instead of securing a job and finding an apartment, he belittles his case worker, refused to clean up his house, and talks trash about his ex-wife to the kids. Then instead of sucking it up, and getting on with his life, he deceives his entire family by showing up in disguise, and then tries to manipulate each of the kids and his ex by insulting the new boyfriend of the mother. Daniel tries to sabotage the relationship at every turn. And, if all of that weren't bad enough, when Daniel does find a new job at the local TV station stockroom, he manages to destroy the career of a long-time TV host by trashing the host's show to the station manager. Daniel deserves none of the good things that happen to him over the course of this film, he's a horrible, manipulative person.With that said, there are some laughs throughout. Williams' does a fantastic job of bringing the titular character to life, and Sally Field is always fun to watch, it's just a shame she's stuck on one-note for most of the film. Pierce Brosnan doesn't get much to do here but play the generic handsome love interest. If "Daniel" were played by someone with less charm than Robin Williams, then this film would be unwatchable, but thanks to the manic energy and humor Williams brings to the role, you can't help but get a smile or two.

I just got back from a National Conference in Detroit, and these headphones were just what I needed. The Philips NC1/27 Noise Cancelling headphones work as advertised. From the moment I sat on the plane, I popped these headphones on and was immersed in my own world of music, I was able to block out the engine noise, as well as my fellow passengers.These headphones have great sound too, and you'll hear your music in a new way. All the intricacies, the lows and highs, it's like discovering your favorite music all over again. From the pumping bass lines of Iron Maiden, to the sweeping scores of John Williams, to the steel guitar twang of Hank Williams to the pulsing beats of the latest dance tunes, these headphones bring you closer to your tunes.

The Ultra Power Plus did a great job of cleaning my dishes, and it dried without leaving streaks and spots. The dishes looked great too, my old soap would often leave behind any food that hadn't been washed off beforehand, meaning I would have to wash the dish a 2nd time. The Power Plus left them thoroughly cleaned and shiny.

I've just finished reading "The Talisman" for the third time. The first was when it was first published, the second when "Black House" came out in 2001 and just now as I'm going through King's stories in chronological order, and with each reading I find something new to take away from this collaboration with Peter Straub, and once again I'm reminded why "The Talisman" is one of my favorite novels as the story is so compelling and imaginative.Jack Sawyer, a 12-year old boy is taken by his mother, Lily to the off-season beach of Arcadia in New Hampshire. Lily is dying, and she wants to pass in peace, away from her late husband's pushy business partner, Morgan Sloat. Morgan has been harassing Lily about signing over her husband's share of their talent agency. Jack, having very little to do in the nearly deserted resort spends his days roaming around the hotel or the local arcade. While killing some time in the arcade, Jack meets Speedy Parker, and old man that refers to the boy as "Traveling Jack", a nickname Jack's father also called him. Speedy seems to re-awaken memories in Jack, memories of a "daydream" land, a place called the Territories.Jack soon learns that this mystical place is real, and that he has the ability to flip between our world and the Territories. Speedy tells Jack that the boy can save his mother, and also the dying Queen of the Territories, if must go on a quest for "the Talisman". And object of immense power that lies on the Western Coast beyond the "blasted lands" in the Territories. But the Quest is not an easy one as not everyone wants the Queen to be saved, and they will stop at nothing to make sure Jack fails in his quest.Populated with wonderful characters, from a companion werewolf, to a murderous TV evangelist, to ghostly knights, "The Talisman" features something for everyone. There are strong parallels to King's "Dark Tower" novels, but it wasn't until "Dark House" that we actually see a definite tie-in. I will say that if you are interested in King's "Gunslinger" series, but worried about jumping into an eight novel commitment, give "The Talisman" a read first. If you like this story, you will most likely enjoy King's epic tale as this novel feels like a condensed version of that much bigger tale (with a much more satisfying ending to boot!).Great novel, and I almost wish King & Straub had revisited the Territories more often through the years.

Whether or not you enjoy this film comes down to whether or not you like Musical Westerns? Yes, the entire cast of the film is comprised of little people, but honestly that novelty wears off after about 10 minutes, and "Terror of Tiny Town" becomes a by-the-numbers 1930's western.Two ranchers are heading toward a range war when an outlaw begins playing the two cattle barons against each other. The outlaw is stealing cattle from both ranches, but framing the neighboring rancher for the theft. Standing in the way of the war are two lovers from opposites ranches who are trying to find out who is at the bottom of the cattle rustling and why.Filled with some quirky little tunes ("Mister Jack and Missus Jill" is an earworm you'll find yourself humming all day), and some bizarre visuals; cowboys walking into the saloon under the batwing doors, cowpokes riding Shetland ponies, little people toting around huge mugs of beer and standard size six shooters.I enjoyed the movie, it clocks in at just over an hour, and as someone who grew up on westerns, I still have a love of the genre, but if you don't really like this type of film even when it's played straight, you probably still won't care for this film even with the novelty approach.

Great way to store your off-season clothes! I normally lug my winter clothes downstairs, stuff them in either trash bags or use an old plastic tub when the weather starts hitting 60 degrees regularly, and I repeat the process every September when it's time to store my summer clothes. The DII bags make it so much easier, I can store almost all of my summer clothes in these two bags, and most of my winter clothes, and then simply slide the full bags under the bed.Each bag is durable, and can hold quite a lot. The rugged construction means I'll get a few years out of them at least. And if for some reason you can't store them under the bed, the bags feature a nice design.

I really wanted to like this movie, and it does pull you in within the first 5 minutes, but it quickly goes downhill from there.As the film opens we meet a DJ who's hosting a New Year's Eve rock-a-thon on TV, she is celebrating the New Year across the US Time Zones, and as her show gets underway, she begins taking calls. The second phone call she gets is from a guy she calls "the Phantom", who is using an amazing voice disguiser. The Phantom promises to kill someone on the hour through the night, until he can finally kill the DJ at Midnight, local time. We are then treated to a bunch of scenes of the killer as he wanders 1980's Los Angeles looking for women to kill.This isn't scary, and it's not the so-bad-it's-good kind of flick that you can sit and laugh at. There are moments, like when the Phantom uses the kazoo thing to hide his voice where you'll get a chuckle, but those scenes are way too few and far between. For the most part it looks like a bunch of extras off the set of Magnum PI that got together to make a horror film.I will give the movie and extra star for the soundtrack, which I'm going to see if I can hunt down, but beyond that, this is a dull, bloodless slasher.

As a devoted coffee drinker, I must have Coffee-mate. Even when there is fresh cream available, I'll still go with Coffee-mate, it adds a nice smooth texture to coffee that other creamers can't imitate. This sweetened original, with the handy pump sits right next to my Keurig, and with a couple of shots from the pump, I'm good to go.

I saw these guys play a couple weeks back live, and grabbed this disk at their show. "Damage Control" is a great album, and will probably pay a big part of my soundtrack to this summer. You can hear the influence of a lot of 90's rock in Cinder Road, with flourishes of Soundgarden & Pearl Jam, mixed into a classic road sound gives the band a unique sound, and you'll be hooked by the 2nd tune on the disk.If you want to check out the band by downloading a tune before picking up the disk, I highly recommend "Sex Savage", the 2nd tune on the disk. It's catchy as hell, and you will instantly be pulled into the song. I do recommend getting the entire disk though as it's a fun ride, and really shows the diversity of the band's sound.If you've wondered where good guitar driving rock has gone do, then Cinder Road is the band for you.

Wonderful book for anyone be they Christian or Jew. I love knowing all the background of the Feast. As the Rabbi goes thru each food on the seder meal I was able to make the Christian meaning and fulfillment of each item. It is a very faith building book and is central to Christians. I study all I can on my Jewish roots as a Christian. The preparation for the seder starts 30 days before with the removal of every crumb of leaven from the house. Leaven is symbolic of sin for Christians. It is thought that this cleaning in the Spring for Passover is where "Spring Cleaning" comes from.Everything has a reason and represents an event that needs to be remembered. Passover is one of God's seven feasts that we are commanded to keep forever. Jesus was celebrating Passover on the Night we call the Last Supper. I learned so much like why the Jewish people no longer offer animal sacrifices. I know why Christians don't as Jesus was the final sacrifice. They no longer do because the temple was destroyed that is why there is just a lamb shank bone on the seder plate with no meat.Reading this book has made communion different for me. Knowing how Jesus celebrated and what he did for me that last Passover he celebrated makes it even more deeply moving. I see how very important it is to search out the sin in my heart before taking the symbols of his sacrifice. I highly recommend this book. I understand more of what it means to be Jewish now. I have a love of Israel and the Jewish people Gods chosen ones.This book was a spiritual experience for me kind of hard to put into words. It really is a must read.

Like this unit much better than my old one. I am using it on a 3 year old Laptop running Windows 7. I only have USB 2 but it works just fine I know it is slower this way but works perfect. I put 16,000 pictures, 8,900 songs, and about 100 documents and it took 1.5 hours, it was the songs that took the time. I will be getting a new laptop within the year I hope so I will love it being even faster. The unit is so small about half the size of my Samsung phone and very light weight. It allows you to set up password protection so your data is safe. The unit gets slightly warm while it is plugged into the computer and you are downloading.I like the easy interface of this unit. I can look up a file quickly. I look forward to using it to transfer these files to new computer when the time comes. You don't have to be a computer whiz to use this storage unit. Just plug in, download driver, name the unit, set password, then choose files to transfer. Done. I like Samsung products have never had any issues with them.

I have used this product for a few years in the granular form. It works and the smell is actually pleasant. I witnessed today how very well it works. I put it all along my back fence and above it truns the telephone line. Squirrels come and run that line all yhe time which causes the two dogs next door to bark constantly,  gets old fast. I was looking out and saw a squirl run the line and stop dead in his tracks when he hit my property.  I got my camera and did an 80 x zoom and he was sniffing and did not move forward. I let my dog out to see if he would run forward, nope turned around and went back into woods. Yay. I get skunks, raccoons,  deer, I think I have moles too. Very happy to keep them out of yard.

Sturdy little workhorse.  The unit is very durable. I used it the car first, it was sitting on the garage floor and kept falling over every move I made, very aggravating.  Then I stool holding it with my feet and it was fine. The suction is strong and cleaned the car well. I am disappointed in the length of the power cord as I had to use extension cord. I used it in the dry mode. I continued to use it all over the garage and was pleased with the results. The only thing it didn't work so well on was an astro turf rug I guess it was a making contact issue.It comes with a limited 5 year warranty which is great. Will be very useful in garage and for car.

The idea looked good but in person it just doesnt work. Size wise I am a size 14 to Large and it fit fine. Withe the space between the neck and top of apron it really lookes like headless Elsa no your head on her body, kinda errie. The rubberised application of Elsa is plealed off at every fold so it looks old right out of the bag. The quality of the apron is fine the black material is sturdy. I will wear I think for potting plants since it already looks old and odd.

Very unhappy doesn't work and Amazon will not take it back and send a new one. The Fire TV customer service even said it doesn't work in all HDMI ports. Right out of the box it took 30 mins to fuss and get it to work. When you do get something to play like Sling TV get interested in a show it just goes black. It is not my internet as tablet and laptop are fine. My HDMI ports work fine with DVD players. I got it free with 3 months prepaid for Sling TV but it is money lost as I cannot use Sling without the fire tv stick working. Was going to get Roku but this value seemed better, not so. 1 year warranty I have had just 36 hours and they will only switch out one part at a time. I said well at least I have Prime ship it fast. Was told it will be faster, ha 5 days then if that part doesn't work start all over hours on phone then 5 more days. Cannot recommended this.

This is so well made and will provide hours of creativity for children 2 yrs and up. I think most 20 month olds will be able to do it as well. The pieces are too big for going into the mouth and being a choking hazard. The only hazzard I see is if all the pieces are off and the child falls on it but that can be said about anything. Children this age are hopefully not playing unsupervised anyway. I love toys that are made to stimulate the imagination.  I can see this being used for counting as well in older say 3 to 4 yr olds. Would make a great gift as it is not so commonly seen in stores. I hope to get more of thr Kid-O toys in the future.

Love the tiny size of this pedometer.  I have another Omron pedometer I have been using daily and like very much but this fills the want I have had for a fitbit. You simply go to the Google Play store and download the Omron fitness app. Then make sure the pedometer is on and pair it with the app, really fast. Now I can just look at my phone and see my steps and calories burned. I am using it with a Samsung Galaxy S lll phone and it is workinh great. It is compatible with iphone as well. Love the daily graph that shows hour by hour how much I have walked. It truly is an incentive to go just a bit further each day. I am in the process of losing weight and it's a great tool. You can clip it just about anywhere on body and it comes with a second back that is smooth if you just want to carry it loose in your pockets.

Our 20 month old girl loves these. When first handed to her she got drenched as the concept was new but within minutes she got the hang of it and is drinking a lot of water. These are dish washer safe and feel very sturdy. The design is perfect for little hands, she uses both hands. Another accomplishment in her life. Highly recommend for toddlers 12 months and up.
Good quality flag,  love the words Live, Love, Laugh. Spreads joy in the neighborhood.  It's been out about a month withstands the storms.

There are almost no words to tell you how beautiful this music is. I put the CD in and is 15 seconds I was weeping the music is so rich, full, moves the spirit. I can imagine Heaven sounds this way. I want to get these for everyone I know. It is not just for babies not by a long shot. I have been listening for 3 hours now I cannot get enough. It gives you peace the deep abiding kind that comes from God.I so needed some encouragement and these sure did it for me. The music is more like movie tunes the kind that make your heart swell and tears pour out for joy. Amazing...just amazing.

This is so cute. It is small but it puts out the heat. I have a larger floor model I like a lot. As fake flames go this unit has the better look much better than the picture here. Looks like a little mantel like it belongs in a playhouse. I'm going to use it in my finished basement where my exercise bike is. Now cannot say it is too cold down there. Very good just to heat the area you are occupying at the moment. Be sure to not leave it unattended or where children can get close it does get hot unlike my floor model. It is well made, metal not plastic, well most of it at least. The top doesn't get too hot I will put a little framed picture on it. I trust the Frigdaire brand and highly recommend this cute fireplace.

I use the classification filing system for all my important paperwork. Never things falling out, very neat. With this set I transformed my plain folder I keep reoccurring bills that get directly deducted from my checking account each month. No notice comes on these accounts so I must have lists I check each month. Using the classification system now makes is so much more streamlined.  You just assign each different bill a number on the top page and you cac flip to it fast. Thanks Avery for the classification folder I put it to use with this set. Now all of my filing is using this system all the same blue folders. Love being organixed and able to get to specific papers fast. Highly recommend.

I have been using classification folders for a few years now for all my important paperwork. I have 6 of the 4 page ones and had to start stacking say different credit card papers on top of one another so now I can seperate them with these dividers. You have to use markers to write on them but then they can be erased and used again. The side tabs work as I can see them easy in the file drawer in my desk. The 2 holes are reinforced which is good. Very happy with product. Thanks Avery for sending me an extra classification folder I put it to good use.

Dusting is not my favorite thing but with asthma, allergies and a Pomeranian I do a lot of it. They come in a  box and pull out like a tissue. They are about the size of a dryer sheet but not quite as stiff. They hold an amazing amount of dust and dog hair. I cleaned my whole first floor with just two sheets. I'm talking cleaning tops of picture frames glass on the picture frames window seals things that don't get done every couple of days. Both of my cloths were totally grey with dust and hair but I wasn't just pushing it around it stuck. I am very pleased with this product and will be purchasing as it makes the job of testing so much easier. I have Victorian like bedroom furniture with lots of carved details on the drawers that made it a pain to dust this made it much easier. Highly recommend this product.

This is a very easy unit to use. Just plug in select the thickness of the sleeve and start feeding it in the machine then takes over and runs it through. I made some quick bookmarks that turned out very nice. I plan on making photo bookmarks with encouraging words on them. I have wanted this for a long time. So many craft and photo ideas going through my head. Much fun. It comes with a package of ten 3mil sheets.

Neutrogena is my favorite brand of sunscreen. It is still cold here but yesterday we had a sunny day and I went out and did some photography. I sprayed some on my exposed hands. I will say the scent is not bad but the aerosol caused me some coughing from asthma.  It does warn not to spray close to face and I didn't but it did cause a problem.  I will use this when I can spray outdoors before swimming I can have some spray my back. You spray in hands then apply to face avoiding eyes. I like the attached cap that you lock so you don't accidentally spray your face when getting it out of your beach bag.

I have a pair of these I got about 10 years ago they cut up to 1 inch thickness and have been great. These are a fantastic upgrade. They cut up to 2 inch thick branches and my yard was in desperate need of them. As we get older always looking for garden tools to make the job easier. These are non stick and carry a lifetime warranty. They are very sturdy and cut through wood just about like a knife thru butter. The very thick branches take a few more ratcheting cuts but the effort is small.  The orange stripes are helpful as well when you lay them down in the yard they are easy to spot.  I highly recommend this new and improved model. I paid more for my old pair than the cost of these. Great addition to an easier maintained garden.

These are so sweet. They are wood and come in a wooden storage box that has plastic covers for each compartment. They promote the children using their imagination making up stories about what the bears are getting dressed up to do. One bear has pink bows by the ears one a purple bow by ear. They have so many mix and match outfits, the bumble be outfit is so cute bears going after honey. Hours of fun even though they are girl bears younger boys may like them too at least playing with sisters. Highly recommend this set.

I really like the small size of this pedometer. It was quick and easy to get programed and the small size is comfortable at my waist. I like that you need to Press one of the buttons to see your display this should save the LCD Screen. I want a Fitbit but my budget will not allow that so this was a great comprise. It tells your steps, calories burned, aerobic steps, miles walked and current time. It resets at midnight and you can look back at previous days data. This is a good price point it seem accurate as my older Omron pedometer.  On this one you really have to press the buttons you don't accidentally hit them and reset the unit. Great unit.

The Caramel Nut bar is very good. I am in week 8 of Medifast diet and down 20 pounds this is the only diet that has worked for me since hitting menopause. I was wanting a special treat so my doctor said 1 maintenance bar a week in place of one of the regular ones it did the trick.

My first pair of Westcott scissors and I am very pleased. I held off making a pair of curtains till these arrived.  They are super sharp making a clean quick cut. You can even adjust the pivot if needed I have not as they are perfect as they are. I love that you can cut through tape and stickers without them getting ruined. They have a lifetime warranty that says a lot. I cannot count how many times I have replaced my sewing/craft scissors will not have to anymore. They are very comfortable to use even if you are left handed. I even tried them left handed and I could cut with them that has never happened I am right handed. I very highly recommend these especially for sewing the perfect tool makes cutting material faster and more exact.

I saw these first in a foot catalog and they say they are very good for high arches I didn't find that to be true. My arches didn't touch at all. I also have a bunion on the left foot and the harder bad hit right in the middle of it. The right foot has a hammer toe and a band hit it as well both very painful. Was very disappointed as the shoe came in my size and looks cool. They had to go back thanks Amazon for free returns on shoes. Back to the drawing board.

I am setting aside my personal taste preferences here. I eat 85 % dark chocolate usually so I am not afraid of the bitterness. This chocolate and coffee is so strong on the coffee it was bitter and unpleasant to me. I however pressed on and evaluated it for quality. The chocolate is smooth and very high quality no problem there the coffee tastes like expresso to me very strong. I usually love anything called Mocha this I did not. It would be unfair to rate it bad due to my likes. I had a few others taste these and they got rave reviews. So if you like strong coffee you will like this. If like me Mocha means a milder coffee with cream kinda taste then perhaps not. I do wish they came with nutritional information. I checked the website but couldn't find it  you must have to call them. I decided not to call and find out.I was surprised they just come lose not wrapped in plastic but they arrived in perfect shape. So coffee lovers one comment I got was tastes like chocolate covered coffee beans. Excellent quality.

So happy a friend told me about Otterbox cases for my new Samsung Galaxy S3 phone. I had first ordered the Samsung case but it was slippery to hold and offered no real protection.  I was a bit skeptical about the built in screen protector but it is great. I had already applied a screen protector and I left it on too and there is no distortion in the quality of the screen. I have dropped the phone a few times and not even a mark on the case this is the kind of protection I was looking for. I also love purple so it makes it look super cool. There is also a belt clip I don't wear it but sometimes put the phone in it face down in my purse if I am carrying one that it will get hit by keys or such. Very highly recommend this is now going to be the brand I always choose.
My favorite pens to write with. I am a purple girl and these write so smooth. I cannot find these anywhere in my town so very happy Amazon has them and at a great price.

This blender makes a wonderful smooth protein shake. I have also made a slushy lime drink and it had no trouble getting the ice into a consistent smooth slush. I do have one thing I dislike there is a space between the lip and the lids pop up lip that liquid spurts out when running on the 4th speed even when making a 12 ounce shake. The lid only fits in one exact spot and is closed there is just a gap. I know I have to hold my finger over it now. It has cord storage under the unit which I like. There are 5 speeds if you count auto which varies as it determines the need. There is a pulse mode as well. The container sits firm on the base during use. It is too tall yo sit under my kitchen cabinets so the pitcher has to go into the cabinet not a deal breaker for me but to some it may be check your measurements if that matters to you. Overall I like this blender a lot especially since my diet protein shakes made with ice are as smooth as a milkshake. I do recommend this unit. It has a sleeve to put over it to keep frozen drinks frozen that even has a window to tell you the volume left.

There was no warning posted on website that people with Kidney Disease should not use this without first consulting physician.  I had washed and dried the pitcher and was waiting out the long procedure of running 2 pitchers of water thru to activate the filter so I was reading the rest of the manual and under important notes it states if you have kidney disease talk to your doctor before use due to the potassium that is added about like a banana per liter. I drink 2 to 3 liters a day per doctor order he would never allow 3 bananas a day.The pour spout lid also falls off mine. It takes a long time to get it full then it is quite heavy to lift and just barely fits in my side door of the fridge. It is very nice looking I will give it that. I did just taste a sip of the water and it still has tap water taste not as good as my pur faucet filter, guess I will be staying with that.Because of the lack of health warning Amazon is graciously taking it back which I appreciate.

I have been using this service for almost a week now. What is see so far is with local calls there is a bit of a humming sound in the background.  With long distance it is crystal clear. With International it is crystal clear. I love that you get free 60 minutes of international calls per month. There are so many features with this phone I have not used all of them yet but with ATT you would be paying big bucks for all these things. I have not imported my number yet as I am still in the evaluation stage. You can pick your number from ones in your area code, city or state. I liked picking a number easy to remember. You can add a second line free as well. The plans and costs are a bit hard to actually figure what you will be paying. I saw $8.33 a month and thought yay then I see that is prepaid for a year plus taxes. It looks like you can get a 2 yr contract and pay around $15 plus tax a month, or go month to month for $20 or so. When you sign up you get a $79.00 credit to your account so that helps making the unit free.it looks like I will be staying with the service and importing my number as my ATT bill keeps going up. Hate to give up the land line as I like being able to call when power is out with my old rotary phone but then there is the cell phone backup. If the cell towers are down we have more to worry about anyway. I have 3 months to fully evaluate so I will retutn with an update. I want to learn how to send my calls to my cell when not at home and start blocking numbers that pester me. At this time I took off 1 star as the humming is on local calls if that stops then it will be 5 stars.customer service has been great you get a real person. I was having trouble with my international call and they even tried the call on their ATT land line. The trouble was the number I was given by my friend now that it is vorrect there is no problem. The ability to call England free is wonderful.

These are my second set of Woodstock chimes.  I have the Jerusalem chimes which I love they are a little bit of heaven. This set is okay but not as beautiful sounding as the other set. They are pleasant but don't touch my soul in the way the Jerusalem ones do.
This is one of those products that either works or it doesn't.  This works.  Great length.  If my opinion changes with extensive use, I'll edit this.  So far we're happy with it.

Please note - this will be an ongoing review.  My star count might change I just want to document as I go. I'm very early in the process and so far, as someone who has never tried to grow anything,  I love it.  So very easy.  No figuring out what pots, soils, plant foods, etc.October 19 - Item arrived and was set up at around 6-7 pm. The quick start guide was all that was necessary as set up is super easy.  You can unbox and have your pods planted within minutes.  Fill with water, place pods according to the guide (shorter plant in front, taller in the back and middle), add the amount of nutrients it tells you to.  Done.October 22 around 11 am - I looked and found a itty bitty baby sprout on the Thai Basil.  So not even three full days for the first sign of life.  So far so good.  Next update will be when I notice the next plant sprouting or in about a week, whichever comes first.October 23 - Checked in in the evening.  Thai Basil about doubled it's baby sprout.  The Genovese Basil has now also sprouted.October 25 - Dill sprouted.October 26 - Thai Basil and Dill had their domes removed.October 28 - Mint sprouted.October 31 - looks like Cilantro and Curly Parsley are starting to sprout.November 1 - Pruned the dill as it was closing in on the lights which I am not ready to lift due to the other baby sprouts.  I also had enough faith in this to order more pods (lettuce, tomatoes, and peppers).Nov 2 - Light came on asking to add nutrients.Nov 3 - Cilantro dome came off.Nov 9 - Curly Parsley dome finally came off.  Everything is growing at a fairly stable rate.

I have to trust my cat to tell me how this is and so far she says it's pretty good.  She gets one can of food a day then supplements that with her dry food bowl that is always full.  She doesn't go to the dry food bowl near as often as the canned food.  I'd say she goes to the dry once or twice a day.  The first day with this she went twice in half a day.  After that it mellowed out more to the normal status.I'd put this right up with most other dry foods she's tried.  This one didn't upset her stomach like at least one other did.  It also didn't have her camped out at the dry food bowl.

Based on the description and picture I think maybe I expected a material that was a bit more natural.  These are basically like any run of the mill vinyl placemat.  That's not necessarily a bad thing as it makes wiping them down very easy.  From a distance they do look more like a linen fabric.  It's only when you get up close to the that you realize it's maybe a plastic'y material.The ends aren't finished in any way, which is fine and not really noticeable unless you're a perfectionist.  Mine weren't cut perfectly straight so you see signs of -- not really fraying but kind of - the cut being right on a row then in the middle of a row.  I didn't notice until I really stared at the edges to try to figure out how they'll hold up.While not perfect, these are nice placemats.

The main use of this headset in our house is my hubby's PS4 games.  Before getting this set he thought he had found the ideal set for him.  Now he prefers this set.- While not truly sound blocking, they do a much better job at that than some of the other sets that we have.  We live in a small very open apartment so if they hubby is upstairs playing a game, I don't particularly want to hear what's going on in his games.  With this set I don't.  With some others I have.- when playing games people can hear him crystal clear.The only downside for him is that the mic doesn't flip out of the way (just his preference).  The mic can be removed, however, so if using them for music it won't be annoying.

I had the milk chocolate version of these before and rated those 3 stars.  I'd rate this tin the same.Half of the caramel chocolates in this tin are milk chocolate while the other half are dark chocolate.  I didn't find the taste difference between the two to be as stark as I'd expect when comparing milk and dark chocolates.They taste exactly how you'd expect Hershey's chocolates to taste.  Not bad but nothing fantastic either.The tin they arrive in is typical of the tins you see at holidays.  Nice and reusable.

Battery:  Mine arrived at 74% full according to the app screen battery reading.  It's a CR2032, for those who wonder about replacements.Advantages:  This thermometer is fast.  Way faster than the current digital thermometer we have.  Seems to be accurate.  Because there is an app attached to it, you can easily keep track of your temps, symptoms, etc. Works with the iPhone health app.Disadvantages: There is no display on the thermometer itself.  Wondering how much battery life is left?  Grab your phone, turn the thermometer on, go into the settings menu to find out.  Need to take a temp quick?  Grab your phone, choose a profile (if you haven't set one up and want to track your temps, then create the profile), then turn on the thermometer.Overall:  Fast fast fast temp readings.  If you don't mind having to have your phone handy when you want to take your temp then it's fine.  If, however, you don't like being tied to your phone then this will not work for you as it is totally useless without the phone.

First of these are the softest cloths I've ever had.  They're perfect for sensitive skin.  The only negative is that the little loops that make up the cloth do snag very easily, so I am not sure how well they'll hold up over time.

So basically you should ignore all of the miraculous claims you might see about belts like this.  You won't lose weight.  You won't magically have a 6-pack.  You will feel your muscles working.  I gave it a shot because I'm pretty limited on what workouts I can do.  I'd started hula hooping just before getting this and figured it couldn't hurt.  I so definitely feel the muscles contracting as I use this.  I can get through about 3/4 of the settings so far.  You won't really feel it unless you start out at level 20-25 at least.Should you buy it?  Mixed feelings. If you're already doing some form of exercise but aren't very fit yet, it can't to add this to the mix.  If you're already pretty fit and exercising, you probably don't need this. If you're not doing anything?  This will keep those muscles active but it won't help you to get fit.Keep in mind you'll need to buy replacement gel pads every few months, so the cost of the belt isn't the final cost associated with regular usage.

First I should say that I live in a warm climate.  These did arrive slightly smooshy.  I stuck them in the fridge and they were fine.  I suspect that a refrigerated gel pack would go a long way in ensuring these arrive in better condition.They are what you would expect from Hershey's.  A general retail grade of chocolate covered caramels.  They're not bad, they also don't stand out as something extraordinary.  While you might not find these in a fancy chocolatier, you also wouldn't be embarrassed to share them with others.

Concept, colors, etc = 4-5Reality of using it = 1Durability once you do get stars in a way you like = 2Overall = 2-3Super cute concept but requires a lot of coats to get any stars onto your fingernails.  Even if say ten stars were clumped on the brush, I was lucky to get one or two on my fingers - and that was after using coat after coat after coat in an attempt to get something on my nail other than clear polish.  Once you get enough stars to make you happy, you'll need to add more clear coats to protect the stars or they immediately  start peeling off.  If you have a lot of patience you could probably great a really pretty nail using this. I suspect that  it would be easier to put star shaped glitter on your fingers yourself and cover it with clear polish.

0:25 Mins I've included a video to show you my personal experience with leakage (which is none).  It is a larger bottle than most personal sized infusers (to go larger you may need to move into pitcher territory).  The infuser itself is large enough for a bottle of this size.  The part of the lid that opens (via push button and a latch both) has a small extended piece that fits perfectly into the drinking spout and seems to prevent leaks.  My only complaint with this bottle is that the lid for the infuser section and the hinge both feel a bit cheap compared to the rest of the bottle.  I guess I'll see how long it holds up.Although I personally haven't experienced leaks, if you are carrying this or any liquids in bags with electronics and other valuables, I'd recommend storing the bottle in something like a small wet/dry bag just in case.

So I have to give this a middle of the road review as there are two of us in the house.  One loves it (me) and one doesn't (the hubby).  My hubby has virtually no sense of smell.  He can handle a litter box that went one day too long and not smell it at all.  So this was mostly for my sake.  One of the few scents he can smell is Ozium air freshener.  To him, this smells like the cousin of Ozium.  To me, someone who can actually smell normally, this smells lovely (after you let it sit and mellow for just a few seconds - it can be strong at first).I doubt this would be some sort of miracle if you have serious toilet odor issues. It's more like preemptively spraying the air freshener right at the source.  I find that a couple of sprays in the toilet as you're leaving the bathroom keeps the scent nice and light fairly constantly.Not perfect and not a scent for everyone.  Still it does seem to help keep the bathroom smelling better than without it so long as you don't overdo it.

If you're considering hooping and have already searched the internet then you probably have already seen everything included in this volume.  I've seen it described as a workout video and while keeping a hula hoop going is a workout, this is no workout plan.  Basic instructions and tips for waist, hip, and chest hooping can be found here.  I'd only recommend it for those curious about hooping who have done no other research.  I'm a total beginner and had already seen everything here on YouTube, often those YouTube videos had better or more complete tips for the clumsier less fit amongst us (though kudos to the Hoopnotica folks for recreating all of our beginner mistakes).

So this pillow arrive in a cylinder zipped plastic bag.  I am amazed they got it in the bag at all.  I struggled to get the pillow out.  Finally a mix of pulling at the pillow while rolling the bag down allowed it to be freed.  Any of these pillows that arrive in any kind of packaging need to sort of fluffed and sat out to get to their full pillow shape (when I bought one at a bedding store, they recommended stepping on it even).  After being in such a tight package, once freed it looked a bit bigger than a queen and a lot flatter.  If your looks like that, don't panic.  While they say up to 12 hours, it generally takes a few minutes of real fluffing / beating your pillow up for it to get into its pillow shape.  I was a little worried this wouldn't fit in my queen pillowcase - it did, but just barely.  Feels a bit squishier to me than my pretty solid memory foam pillow.  Quite comfortable.  Not so sure about keeping your cooler or lessening your migraines.  It's pretty hot here and I didn't notice a change with this pillow.  With memory foam pillows all you can really do is look at the price and the comfort level and decide if that's a pillow worth having.  I have really cheap ones and an expensive one.  This falls in the middle price wise and comfort wise.  I'd definitely recommend it for anyone who prefers memory foam pillows.

I'm posting a pic of my hair pre-bleach, post bleach, and post pink dye. I probably didn't need to bleach it but the last time I tried to dye my hair with pinks (two different brands) it just didn't take very well.This took very well. The kit includes all you need (I used different gloves just because I prefer others). The directions are simple and complete. I would say that if you have hair longer than chin, maybe shoulder length, you will need at least two boxes. I have a pixie cut and used about half of both the bleach and dye. I always follow the direction when bleaching and did follow their directions. I never follow directions when using these "Direct dye" bright colors. Instead of the 30-60 minutes, I left mine in for 5 hours. I got a very vibrant pink (a little more fuchsia than the pictures on the box).My one complaint is that this definitely left me with more dye rubbing off than some other brands have. When I used other brands I might wake up the next morning to a streak light on my pillow and that was with lot of hair. Using this on short hair, my pillow looked like a pink paintball fight happened. This and all dyes like it will dye anything and everything they touch. So I highly recommend two things - 1. protect everything (your skin around your face and neck with Vaseline) 2. If possible do NOT rinse your hair in a shower/bathtub. If you have access to a stainless steel sink or some kind of utility / laundry room sink where stains won't matter, that is so much easier to clean.

So I want to start with a warning about the shipping and not the product itself -- This has a sliding open close hole at the top of the container.  It takes very little effort to open or close it.  I have no way of knowing if it shipped in the open or closed position, but it arrived open with a bit of powder having spilled.  Not a lot (it takes a bit of effort to shake out more than say a teaspoon full).  Still you'll want to be careful when opening the packaging.Now onto the product.  I really only got this because who knew there was such a thing as a powder cleanser?  Okay, probably lots of people knew, but I don't keep up with beauty product trends at all.  I had no idea what to expect.  I always need products that are truly gentle. All of them say they are, but with sensitive skin, allergies, auto immune issues, etc my body is extra sensitive.  The wrong smell or chemical and I'm in migraine hell or getting rashes, etc.  So far, this does seem to fall into the truly gentle category.  My skin is extra dry now because it's been hot here and my skin doesn't like hot weather.  I used this and bam - instantly softer yet tighter feeling skin.  It does have a very light scent but it's totally inoffensive and not at all overpowering like some other cleaners.  You should be able to get a lot out of this sized bottle as you only use "a small amount" each time that you wash your face.  My skin actually feels better than it does after using my night moisturizer.  I'd definitely buy another container of this powder.

I'd put this right up there with all of the other rug cleaners we have (4 or 5 of them - most designed for use with a spot cleaner), though this one smells a little better.  Our cat rarely gets sick / hairballs, but when she did -- she really did.  We ended up switching her food because the common cat food she was eating left behind toxic pink looking stains on our light carpet.  We caught it right away and have tried everything - carpet cleaners, vinegar mixes, the spot cleaner.  That toxic pink is still around, so I figured I'd test this on it... It's still pink.  Does seem fine on lighter, easier to clean stains.  But those really tough stains?  This is just average.

Great sound for the size and price.  I usually use headphones when I want music, but I recently starting using a hula hoop and find headphones a pain to deal with while hooping.  This seemed like a good solution, and it was.  On the lower volume settings it is perfect for the small room I'm using it in.  Easy to use (assuming you know how to pair a device).  If you do not have such knowledge, I'dl look it up online as the manual is in tiny tiny print / pictures which will be hard enough to see, let alone understand.  The cloth and bamboo styling are gorgeous.  If I have a complaint, besides the manual being worthless, it's that it makes a pretty obnoxious ding when you power them on and off.

I've only used Apple and Belkin cables before.  I'd put this closer to the Belkin (that's a good thing).  Better designed to hold up to daily use than the Apple cables.  No complaints.  It does the job it's meant to do.  If I had a choice between this and the Belkin cables, I'd probably go with this one as it seem just a little sturdier.

Plugged it in, turned it on, it worked.  Cannot currently measure the speed accurately but it seems to do the job.  We needed to get internet to the second floor and this worked like a charm.  I will update this if I can think of anything else to say or if we notice and problems, but so far so good.

Some people compare this to aspirin, some to things like Excedrin.  The real comparison in my mind would be Excedrin Migraine.  It has the same ingredients (Aspirin, Acetaminophen, and Caffeine).  Both have 65 MG of Caffeine, while this has 325 MG Acetaminophen vs 250 in Excedrin Migraine.  This has 500 mg of Aspirin vs the 250 in Excedrin Migraine.My migraines are pretty severe and are treated by a neurologist.  I've found that while preventative therapies do help me a LOT, the treatments for during a migraine do little.  Over the counter puts as big of, if not a bigger, dent in my pain than the more expensive migraine pain relievers.  Because of this, my neuro recommends I use Excedrin Migraine.  It generally does not kill a migraine but does put it on a tolerable level.  This does basically the same thing but in an easier to take form (for those of who hate swallowing pills anyway).  It doesn't taste great but not horrible either.  You do want to have water at the ready.It works as fast, or faster than Excedrin Migraine.  You could probably use it on other aches and pain in a pinch but the caffeine content is definitely a headache thing.  It might take the place of Excedrin Migraine in my medicine cabinet.  Not sure yet but it's close.

People seem to either love or hate these.  And the basis for both love and hate seems to be about the same issue - the size.I got these because of the size.  We've cut way down on our use of paper towels and instead have been using actual towels and these square microfiber rags we found in the cheapie aisle at the drug store.  They work fine.  No wasting paper.  Wash them, re-use.  But once in awhile something comes along where you instinctively grab for the paper towels.If you're like us and only use them occasionally for small to medium messes, or maybe to keep around you while eating for example, then these are perfect.  I tested these by holding them under a running faucet.  Once drenched they did hold up pretty well.  I could tear them easier than a dry sheet but they didn't fall apart on their own.If you're constantly using a giant sheet and feel like you're wasting them? This is a perfect solution.  If you have a lot of messes and paper towels are your go-to solution?  This sized roll probably isn't for you.

So for this price range, these are a really decent art tool. Usually when I want to do anything with colors I just use Derwent Inktense pencils, but pencils aren't always good for covering a lot of space and I've just not been very artsy lately so I couldn't bring myself to spend the extra money on the Derwent Inktense Blocks. I thought this would be a good cheap alternative for now. I've included an image (done on cheap printer paper, so excuse the quality) showing all of the colors (except white) in both a small thin line without water and a thicker line where I used a waterbrush (my own because I prefer waterbrushes to the regular brushes like this set comes with). I then also did a small patch of red going into light blue going into the darker blue and ran the waterbrush over that as well.Some blend better than others. The tan color really fades pretty bad even with just a light brushing of water so to get a decent color out of it you'd have to do several layers I think. Running the stick flat on a smooth surface gets choppy coverage instead of a thick smooth line so for coloring in wider areas, you'll want to run the stick over the area more than once for full coverage. The colors do seem to stick pretty well, I washed my brush right after and couldn't get all of the color out.All of that said, I do still like them. They definitely work far better than some other "on the cheap side" of water media pens/sticks/etc. Next time I'm feeling artsy I'll likely order their metallic set.  Unless you need top of the line artist quality supplies, this set will probably work fine for you.

I've only tried one other wet skin moisturizer (Jergens Wet Skin Moisturizer, Monoi Oil, 10 Ounce so I don't have a lot to compare this to but I will say that I had high hopes for this one.  It's Nivea, so a decent brand.  I's Cocoa Butter, one of the only scents I can pretty much always tolerate.  It's for wet skin, aka easy to apply on wet skin if you're like me and get out of the shower and head for the lotion - that can be a mess.Sadly, it didn't live up to my expectations.  With the Jergens Wet Skin Moisturizer you apply it after turning the shower off, then pat dry.  This Nivea in-shower lotion starts out that way - you turn off the shower and apply the lotion but then you turn the shower back on to rinse it off and rinse off the tub.  Another words any of the convenience of a wet lotion is lost.But hey, still cocoa butter and for dry skin, so it's perfect beyond that?  Nope.  The scent was just weird to me.  I can't really explain it.  It just smells wrong.  For the first two hours or so after using this my skin felt nasty.  Not quite sticky, but close.Nice concept but a total failure for me at least.  I do have pretty sensitive dry skin so maybe it would work better for someone with more forgiving / less sensitive skin.

Not a fan of these. The towels are thin and small, good enough to wipe your hands here and there, but won't hold up to serious kitchen messes.  I took a photo of my current potholder under the ones that come with this set.  The black potholder is nothing fancy, just something I picked up at a chain store locally - one of the typical cheap ones.  It's at least twice as thick as the ones that come with this.  The inner seam of the oven mitt are a mess and do not look professional at all.  I'd pass unless you get a really good deal.  If not for the cute graphics, it'd be a one star item.*update* had to downgrade my rating to one star after washing one that has barely been used.  Had no visible damage or snags.  Came out of the wash (cold water, low dryer heat) totally snagged and faded.

So my cat has shorter hair and has always been pretty good at grooming herself with no hairballs as a side effect.  As she gets older she is shedding more and getting hairballs more.  So it was time to find a miracle brush.  Not sure I'd call this that but it's still pretty decent.  My cat is a bit of a princess.  I've found that she likes to have this used on her so long as she cannot see it.  Once she knows something other than us is touching her, she's out.The only reason I cannot give it 5 stars is that while it does a good job at getting all of the loose fur to the top of her coat, it only actually picks up like half of that onto the brush.  It does make it easier to just do a quick wipe of my hand over that fur to collect it but I wish that more of it actually ended up in the brush.

Before I go further on this review I just want to say:  I have an iPad 3.  I realize it's not listed as compatible.  My mistake. It's probably the heaviest of the entire product line. The case is propped up by a magnet and unless I am on a perfectly level surface it just falls closed.  It's possible that the lighter versions of the product wouldn't have this issue.  I am, however, spoiled by the smart-case I purchased for it on launch day.  This product needs stronger magnets, if it had them I might give it 3 stars.The keyboard itself is okay but it does, in effect, turn your iPad into a laptop.  Or, to put it another way, it's a boat-anchor.  If you want to lay in bed and, say, play Angry Birds, you need to remove the case because otherwise you're trying to hold the case open and keep hitting the buttons.  It's not comfy.  Also, while the case is on, you're not using the camera since it's blocked, I realize this is my error since it's not on the list of compatible devices, but I also didn't care about camera access so for me this is a non-issue, for others wondering about if it works with iPad3 it does except for the camera access.I'm not a fan.  I prefer another KB I have where, instead of being part of the case, it's more like a dock you just drop it into the top.  Your mileage, of course, may vary.

They are lightweight, the audio quality is decent, but they don't fold up very compactly and the iPhone button on it only controls playback and not volume. .  Unfortunately they do almost nothing to block sound so I'd question their usefulness in noisy places.  That said, they're no worse than similar headphones, but I wanted to raise the issue in case pictures of the product lead you to believe that they are thicker than they really are.  Personally I'd prefer to use the standard iPhone earbuds.  I'd give it an extra star if it were under $10.

So is the miracle claim of youthful shiny hair after one use true?  Of course not.  Is it a really good shampoo?  Yes.  It did make my hair nice and soft but not some miracle perfect hair kind of soft.  It doesn't stink, which is a huge yay for me. I cannot stand strong smells and while this one does have that sort of "hair salon" kind of smell, it's faint and not at all offensive.  If you go into this with expectations of a good shampoo, you'll be happy.  If you go in expecting to have the hair you had a kid?  Not going to happen, especially not after one use.

I have only two complaints with this1. the scent is pretty strong for me personally but most scents and I don't agree so your mileage may vary2.  It doesn't work quite as well as my traditional moisturizers.That said I still really liked it.  The scent is a lot stronger if you use this on dry skin than when you use it as it's advertised for on wet skin - maybe the patting of the towel helped? Whatever it was, the scent was much more tolerable when I applied it on wet skin.  It definitely left my skin feeling really good after the shower.  While I've never tried any other lotions meant for wet skin, I have made the mistake of using regular moisturizers when I hadn't dried off enough and that was a mess.  This was easy to apply and didn't leave behind any gunk.I don't think it would totally replace my usual moisturizers but it's definitely good enough for me to use after every shower and when in a rush.

Haven't really been able to confirm that it's got the power level that it says it does as it doesn't seem quite as good as others we have in this range, but it's okay.  When charging an iPad it did start to get unusually warm.  There are better options out there but this would work as emergency back up of small devices.

The description of this book stated that no experience was necessary.  Id say that is definitely not true.  Ive tried crochet before and failed to really get it.  So I tried this book.  It didnt help me any though it did inspire me to go search the internet for videos again.  And this time I did pick the basics up quickly, so yay for that.  I still wouldnt feel comfortable with some of these patterns yet.  Some because they seem overwhelming (a single bedspread that requires breaking out the daisy loom as well as 32 balls of crochet cotton).  Some because they seem too fine for a newbie.  Some because theyre meant to mimic tatting, and I find needle tatting much faster and easier.  So thats the bad.The good is that if youre already comfortable with crochet of all sizes (specifically smaller hooks / motifs here), youll sure enjoy this book.  Aside from the patterns it attempts to give us some history of crochet.  Though the patterns are the main aspects of the book.  From gloves, to edgings, to blankets  theres a little of everything using primarily smaller motifs.  Much of it is meant to mimic more Victorian styles with little to no attempts to modernize those classics.Id recommend the book for advanced crocheters or those comfortable working with smaller hooks.  For newbies and those not comfortable working smaller, Id skip it.* Disclaimer: I received this book at no cost in order to review it. I offered no guarantee of a positive review, though I only request books I think I'll like because why read a book you think youll hate?

It's okay.  Not really sure how much it really helps in the allergy department, I seem no better (or worse) using this stuff than I did before it.  It does have a fairly mild clean kind of scent, not offensive but if, like me, you're sensitive to scents this may not be the right solution for you.  If you're looking for a light "make my air more neutral" kind of spray then this is fine.  Allergen blocker?  Who knows, your experience may be different from mine, I found it of little help there.

Artwork: 5/5 stars. Like the movie, this book knows what should have a darker more gothic look and what should look bright and cheery. All of it is done in a cutesy way that just works. I cannot imagine any other artist / art telling this story any better.Story: 3/5 As for the story, its just okay. Kims granddaughter confronts her mother about what happened so long ago. While the two fight, a new generation has emerged from the castle to cause fear in the townsfolk. Its not bad, it just feels like it could have been more.Overall a 4/5. Its definitely for fans of the movie, but new fans could enjoy it as well (though they will only get a quick hint of the backstory).* Disclaimer: I received this book at no cost in order to review it. I offered no guarantee of a positive review, though I only request books I think I'll like because why read a book you think youll hate?

Somehow, I expected much flimsier plastic based on reviews I'd seen.  It is actually a fairly thick plastic.  The needle gauges seem pretty accurate (I have two different brands of needles and  didn't know all of their sizes - while a few are borderline between two gauges, I still got a pretty clear view of which needle was which).  I'd give it 5 if the numbers were actually embossed.  It's hard to tell how well the color and lettering will last.  I coated mine with clear nail polish, just in case as it felt like there were a few spots where the color almost scratched and I didn't want to take chances.  Otherwise, a perfect little device for your tatting.

Charlotte is bullied. She takes it well considering even her own family members get their digs in. While I dont think I have a great idea of how big she was, Charlotte was, at one point, described as a ten  size ten. Its hard to imagine her as the target of bullying for her weight.Charlotte does have two close friends  Lani and Miles. Miles has had a crush on Charlotte since the third grade, the same year that Charlotte swore off boys after having her heart broken for the first time.As the trio starts high school, Charlotte starts to change  for a boy in her algebra class. A cute boy. A boy that the mean girl is interested in even though he gives Charlotte much more attention.Lani realizes that Miles has a thing for Charlotte and starts a countdown clock, fearing that hell miss his chance if he doesnt act soon. He tells Charlotte or Lani will.And adorable story where the bullied learn how to create their own small victories. Kids start to learn how to deal with disappointments (including figuring out that their adult heroes arent always so great). Friends question whether or not its worth risking a friendship over a relationship.* Disclaimer: I received this book at no cost in order to review it. I offered no guarantee of a positive review, though I only request books I think I'll like because why read a book you think youll hate?

I like the concept I hated the book. It feels like a love triangle searching for a story.America Singer (no surprise, shes a musician) is of an age where she can sign up for the selection. The selection being where families pimp their daughters off in reality show style competition for the love of a prince. Pimping feels like the right word even for the girls dying to compete. Families get paid for the weeks their daughters are away. Win or lose the winning girl steps up the social ladder. Ones caste is very important  if your number is too low, good luck finding a man, unless hes in your caste, no one wants a spouse of a lower rank, except maybe the prince. When a girl can raise her status by simply trying to impress the price, well, why not. Sure theyre told that they must do anything the prince wants, even if they dont want to do it ANYTHING. Small price to pay for not wondering where your next meal comes from. America (named for the country too disgraced to hold onto its name but not so disgraced that you wouldnt want to name your daughter after it) didnt really want to sign up for consideration. Her boyfriend (Aspen) and her mom nagged her into it.Once at the castle the chosen girls meet Prince Maxon. Despite meeting the top of the top at parties and the like, Maxon has developed no social skills beyond table manners. Everyone is his dear. Everything everyone does and says is a shock to him. America, staying for the money her family will get makes a deal with Maxon to be his eyes and ears among the girls and hell let her stay as long as possible. Win win - her family will eat and Maxon will know whos worthy of being his wife. He, obviously, falls for America. She doesnt understand why. I mean she does everything right, wonders why everyone isnt more like her yet finds herself to be a no one.The worst part of the book is that nothing happens. Sure there are rebels who give the castle a good scare now and then. Thats it. The girls get their pictures taken and rebels (never seen) show up. The end. The prince hasnt truly made a decision though hes let America know his thoughts. Despite being madly in love for years, America and Aspen havent worked anything out in their relationship (all of their drama is stupid and forced). I think Ill just read spoilers to see who wins. This is obviously a member of the every book must be a trilogy (and beyond) club. Which is pretty insulting given the first book isnt even a complete story in any way shape or form. If youre stretching your characters lives into 3 (or more) books, you better make me feel like I read some kind of complete story in each book. So disappointing. Thatll teach me to run off to immediately read a book that gets optioned for a movie. That and some mega fans gushing over it doesnt mean the book is good.

I've used these for Kumihimo and they're great for that.  But that's not my craft of choice so I was worried they'd mostly sit unused in my craft desk.  Then I realized they're perfect for holding crochet cotton while I needle tat.  People who have cats know that nothing attracts them more than thread (maybe the laser).  Seriously my cat hears thread.  She'll be dead asleep, I put thread to needle and she's wide awake trying to help.  I love the little monster but it can be very inconvenient, not to mention what her claws do to the thread she grabs as it leaves the ball.  Being able to wind a fair amount of 10 or 20 thread on this means it's tougher for said kitty helping and saves me a lot of thread.  I'll be buying more of them for sure.

I prefer needle tatting because I was able to teach myself the basics (DS, picots, and rings) in minutes using videos I found online.  Shuttles are far more frustrating for me but I'm trying them again as some patterns / tutorials just seem to be easier with shuttles.  I have two of these and two Clovers.There are two main differences -With these you wind the thread onto a bobbin. Each shuttle comes with two bobbins and you can buy more.  If, like me, you jump around from project to project this way of winding thread is probably better.  Instead of needing a lot of extra shuttles or cutting your current project off the shuttle and winding your new thread, you just slide the bobbin out.With the Clover shuttles, you wind the thread directly onto the bobbin.  I just explained why that is bad.  It can be good though.
