If you have extra shuttles or don't bounce from project to project, these accommodate a little more thread.The second main difference is the tip of the shuttle -These shuttles have a tiny crochet hook as their tip while the Clover shuttles just have a pointed plastic tip.  This would come down to preference.  I find the tip on these far more useful than the plastic tip style.  This makes joining much easier where as the shuttle with the plastic tip had me just using a separate tiny hook anyway.Less important but may matter to those who use them a lot = color and weight.  These Aerlit shuttles do come in various colors as do the separate bobbins so it's easy to mix and match to your personal liking.  The Clover shuttles also come in various colors though it seems the pink and blue combo is the most common.  Both being plastic you could always find ways to make either suit your look (I've seen some decopauged over).  They're comparable in weight though this one loaded feels just a little lighter than the Clover.  Some might like the added weight, some might like lighter, so again just preference and not a huge difference.Overall -If I had to do it again, I'd have bought these first and just added extra bobbins.  I don't hate the Clover shuttles, these are just a little more suited to my likes.  If you're new to tatting and debating between shuttle and needle -- I'd say go with needle but if you try both and still decide you prefer needles, don't feel like you wasted money on these.  Even when needle tatting I find myself using these -- much easier to keep the cat away when I just have a little thread wrapped around these in my hand than when I have a full ball of thread and plenty of room between me and that thread so she can "help".

I don't know what I expected, but I think I was expecting more than it is.First off I should say that if you have two cables exactly the length of this that you always need together, it'd be a nifty idea.I have two items that I tend to keep side by side, so this seemed like a nice way to keep the cables together, classier than the twist ties I'd been using.  One of them was just a few inches too long and the other is about a foot too long.  I decided to try sort of double over the extra foot in a way that added as little extra cable as possible.  It fit, kind of but getting the zipper to close was tough.  Some of the wire inside was exposed instead of sewn into the little casing for it.  To keep it wound tight, it'd need a stronger wire or you'll have to use a rubber band or twist ties or something to actually keep it tightly wrapped.  Its a nice concept, but the execution just failed.  The one bright side is you'll definitely find the cords in a bag now, they just won't be any more protected or better wound up than without this.

When the Tootings family finds themselves trapped in the 60s, theres nothing to but just enjoy it.  Until they bump into Chitty Chitty Bang Bang and the family that owned it in that era.  The book starts out a little slow but then jumps right into the wacky adventures (at least I'd call chasing Big Ben and visiting the moon a bit on the wacky side).Very few things top the original.  This is no exception, but its still a good book especially for kids (of all ages).  Technically it could be a stand alone book but I'd recommend reading the prior books first.* Disclaimer: I received this book at no cost in order to review it. I offered no guarantee of a positive review, though I only request books I think I'll like because why read a book you think youll hate?

Pros:Easy to use - spray it on or in the case of your face spray it into your hands then rub it in.Good level of protection (held up to half a day walking around in the CA sun)Dries quicklyCons:The scent.  I dislike 99% of scents as many of them trigger migraines for me.  This wasn't quite strong enough to be migraine inducing but it is also not a scent I'd choose.  I can't even describe it -- the best I can do is say it's some blend of a generic aerosol scent mixed with a flowery perfume.  Luckily it does fade rather quickly.The price.  We've had plenty of other good sunscreens that cost a fraction of the price.Overall:If not for the scent, I'd have given it 5 stars but had to knock it down one.

I gave the first book 3 stars.  This book is better.  So much better that you can probably skip the first book.  While I thought the first book was well written, it just felt like it was lacking something.  Everything good about the first book is in this book and then some.Told from Adam's point of view, we're led through the accident's aftermath.  While both Mia and Adam have reached a level of success that most people would envy they've also dealt with their losses in very different ways.  Mia is the happy go lucky girl who decides to put on a brave face, leaving Oregon and everything in it behind her.  Adam is the brooding rock star who used his pain to write the lyrics that would change his life.A not so chance meeting leads the duo on a farewell tour of NYC.  Face to face, they eventually have to talk through their history and decide if they can be parts of each other's futures.My main issue with this series is that "If I Stay" and "Where She Went" could have easily been whittled down to one book.

Because I had only minimal knotting experience (think old school friendship bracelets) I wanted a book that has very clear instructions.  This is definitely that book.  I did find the layout of the book a bit odd.  Unless you have memorized every symbol they used for every knot, you'll be flipping back and forth between the front of the book and the pattern you are working on.  Some of the samples in the book were shown on like colored backgrounds, making it less than ideal while you're trying to examine the details.  The photos of the completed projects are not near the instructions, which can also lead to a lot of flipping back and forth between the sections of the this book.Still, despite sometimes being awkward to use this book, the instructions are so good that I'd still recommend it.

Me and the hubby saw it in a store locally and agreed we needed this.  First off, right out of the box -- the battery compartments are screwed down with tiny tiny screws that none of our screwdriver sets would work with.  I was thinking we'd be running to the hardware store when the hubby finally found one that work -- not a screwdriver most people with just a basic tool set will have handy.We did play with it for a few hours.  Much of that time was trying to figure out the controls.  They should not have gone wireless with these controllers.  The line of sight for them is very very very picky.  Our cat walked by and oh hey, cannot use the controller.  Stretched out on the floor, moved a toe, oops the controller no longer works, get back into position.  If you find and use real atari controllers, you'd probably like this more than we did.Still we do have to give it credit in that some of the games are definitely still playable.  If you are of an age to have known Atari, the nostalgia factor is there.  You will be saying "Oh yeah, I played this one!" on games you thought you didn't recognize before loading them.3 stars is  a kind of high review for this to be honest but we did enjoy some of the games.  Although it wasn't all negative, I still wouldn't buy any of the other retro systems based on my experience with this one.

I've owned two slow cookers.  The first was a nice size, ceramic, but it didn't have a removable pot and had a plastic lid.  Needless to say I kind of hated it as the plastic lid eventually cracked and it was tough to clean since you had to take the whole cooker, cord and all to the sink to clean it.  The second one I got (the one I was using until this item arrived) was a rice cooker / slow cooker combo.  Electric with timers.  Metal pots that can be tough to clean.  It was fully enclosed so you couldn't see inside to be sure there was enough fluids without opening it.  Then comes this one.  I really like this one (enough to put my old one in the cabinet instead of on the counter).  It has the heavy duty ceramic style pot (removable).  Glass lid. There is no timer, just the High, low, and warm settings.Obviously the one thing that makes this different is the whole "wrap and serve" concept.  To be honest, it's kind of gimmicky.  It ships with a blue/white zig zag wrap, a red with snowflake wrap, a football wrap, a birthday wrap, red white and blue stars wrap.  You can also buy separate ones (currently about ten dollars for two at the company's website).  I suspect you could use a blank plastic sheet and create your own.  If you're the type to decorate for events, these could be a nice simple way to do that.  But since most people would take the pot and lid out to set that on the table, I really don't know how useful these are, even for that.  The wraps are on the machine itself.  Unless people will be seeing your entire cooker, they're what I said -- a gimmick.It is a really good slow cooker (if you don't need a timer feature).  The wraps are a cute idea, but probably not something most people would benefit from beyond sprucing up the kitchen.Disclaimer - I got this item free for review.

Large and thin compared to most kitchen towels I've had but they do the job they're meant to do.  We've tried to avoid paper towels as of late, these are a good replacement for minor spills.  Well made with a nice color scheme.  I have seen some describe the one towel a solid, it's not -- there is a bit of a pattern with white threads being woven through it.

You know who loves old Hollywood?  Me,  I do.  Id heard of William Desmond Taylor before reading this book.  Id heard only the basics.  After reading this book, I feel like I know a little, but not much, more.  A lot of this book is more about setting up the Hollywood scene than it is about William Desmond Taylor and his murder specifically.I had this one as an audio book from the library.  I think I liked it more as an audio book than I would have as a text copy.  The narrator sets the scene well.  Still, the book jumps around a lot.  At times I felt I should grab a notebook and start doing some how is x connected to y kinds of crime charts.  In the end, I think I'd find that x and y were barely connected, if at all.At one point, I wasnt sure I could carry on. There was an hour or two where it felt like the book was about poor Will H. Hays being used and abused by Hollywood and what could the poor sap do, after all they were paying him a fortune so he owed it to them to sell out his morals.  Riiiiiight.  Poor guy couldnt say no to the big money.  Those mean studio heads forced him to be the face of self censorship and he just happened to get rich in the process.I also felt, at times, as though a non-Hollywood junkie would learn more about the Roscoe Fatty Arbuckle trial than they would about William Desmond Taylor.  I happen to love the Fatty Arbuckle movies and am fascinated by his story, but that wasnt really what I signed up for with this book.Overall, its a really decent Old Hollywood primer.  It, by no means, solves the case though we do eventually get to a decent enough theory.  I guess, in the end, I had a love / hate relationship with this book.  I loved it more than I hated it. Still get ready for a dizzying ride that will take you right up to a point and then zig zag and loop around to something totally unrelated only to slam right into the end.Torn on the star rating.  I went with 3.  It's somewhere between a 3 and 4 just barely leaning toward the 3 side of things.

I like every Aussie product I've tried... until now.I tend to have sensitive skin and am super sensitive to scents.  Not that I cannot tolerate any of them.  Things the the cleaner aisle and the perfume aisle do trigger severe migraines.  A mild scent here and there, that I can tolerate.  The other Aussie products I have used have scents I find quite enjoyable.  This shampoo?  Not so enjoyable.  If you've ever walked into a hair salon and thought hmm this smells like they've been mixing every stinky hair product by the gallon all day long, well the fine folks at Aussie have bottled that scent and poured it all into this dry shampoo.Still, although the scent made me want to grab for my migraine meds, the dry shampoo was already in my hair.  So let's work it in as we're instructed.  Maybe the scent will tone down.  I should note that I have a pixie cut, so I don't have a whole lot of hair to work this into.  What I found is that it is good as a touch up -- for that point when you're missing the freshly washed feeling but your hair isn't really looking nasty.  It's not so good if your hair does look even a little dirty.  In fact I think it made my 1 1/2 day w/o shampoo hair look nastier than it did before applying it.  So for that level of dirtiness, this is no miracle.  Also, I washed my hair after testing it, and I'm still smelling that scent, blech.If you don't mind very strong scents, this will be fine for you.  It's super easy to use.  It does a decent job of making borderline hair look refreshed.  For actual dirty hair, just go straight for your normal shampoo.

Like:- It does moisturize your skin well.- Absorbs into the skin well and quickly.Dislike:- It feels a little thick / heavy to me.  That could just be me, some others say it's not at all heavy feeling.  Still, personally I can still sort of feel it on my face and hand hours after applying it (even after washing my hands a few times).  I forget to take off my beaded ring before applying and the lotion that I got on it was a pain to scrub off.- It does have a scent.  Not a super heavy scent but one that did bother me a bit.  On the plus side it didn't stick around for long, but the few minutes I could smell it, I didn't like it.Overall, a decent moisturizer.  Not my favorite, personally, but it does the job.

Does what a conditioner should do - conditions your hair.  And it does that well.  It does have a scent.  I'm pretty sensitive to scents but this one doesn't bother me.  I'm not sure I'd call it a "miracle" but it is a good conditioner.

The story of Grubb (like the worm, with two Bs). Grubb had no family but had been put to work as a chimney sweep by a less than kind man. After a bit of trouble, Grubb accidentally escapes to Alistair Grims place. But Alistair Grims place is not a typical home, its odd. Brooms are seen sweeping. Silent Samurais protect the residents. Watches talk. None of that really matters to Grubb though, what matters to him is that Mr. Grim is not punishing him for his stowaway adventure, instead he seems to be rewarding him with a decent job and a bit of a mentorship.When things are as odd as they are at the Odditorium sometimes people get curious. Especially curious are the investors who keep the building funded and the nearby residents who would like to know exactly what happens in such a mysterious place.As Mr. Grim sets out to put on a show, we learn that not everyone is simply curious. Some people dont like Grim and they might have a bit of oddness on their side as well.A charming story. If someone stuck some Dickens and some Harry Potter into a blender, theyd likely end up with something just like this.Not sure how I feel about it being a series yet, but this did give up a fairly complete story so whether you would read on or stop at just one, youd be satisfied.* Disclaimer: I received this book at no cost in order to review it. I offered no guarantee of a positive review, though I only request books I think I'll like because why read a book you think youll hate?

I, personally, am not a connoisseur of cat treats.  My spoiled little girl is.  Frankly she tends to like the big brands or the cat equivalent of junk food. We've tried other treat brands that, like this one, claim to be more healthy.  My cat had no interest in those, my hubby's theory is that they don't smell strong enough.  Needless to say I was leery of this one when it popped up in Vine, but I'll let my cat try different treat brands, so why not.What I expected to happen:  I call her name, ask if she wants treats, she hears the sound of a bag open, runs over, sniffs, waits patiently for the usual treats to be set down as these won't cut it.What actually happened: I called her name, asked her if she wanted treats, she heard the bag open and her ears perked up, she ran over to investigate.  Despite having a few of the junk food treats already on the floor, she snatched these up and left the old treats on the floor.  I tried again.  Same result only she did finally eat the treats she'd had waiting around forever too.  Then she looked at me like she might need more.  Sorry kitty, there is a limit on treats.

Stars: 4 out of 5Pros:- Audio quality is pretty good.  I'm not an audiophile but I do think they do their job just fine- I like that the mic only works when you have it unfolded, making it easy to mute.- Reasonably comfortable and solid constructionCons:- I think their instructions for installing the headphones could have been a little better.  You have to search their app store to find the headphone app to install, something as simple as putting the search term in quotes would have gone a long way.- It did take a good half an hour or so to get the install downloaded, and I did have to unplug it a couple of times to make it work. (Only had to do this on the first day, though.) Frankly I'm surprised that it wasn't as simple as "just plug into USB port and go".  I have another headset where you *can* do that.  It's weird.  But you only have to do it once.- The volume controls are, for stylistic reasons, only embossed in the plastic.  They did not paint the letters white or anything, meaning you have to angle the remote a certain way to find out which buttons you're pushing.  I get the minimalist style, but it would have been helpful if they had painted in the letters to make them legible.- *wife note* they leak sound out quite loudly so people around you do hear everything or nearly everything depending on how loud you have them.

I got this for Christmas and love it.  It's quite plain looking and seems kind of small so I wasn't sure I'd like it.  Then I started putting pencils in and realized just how much it holds.  I fit around 55-60 pencils while still being able to zip it up (60 was a tight tight fit but did zip while 55 was more ideal aka easy to open and close).  If you don't need to zip it, it can hold around 70 pencils.  Such a small and simple storage solution that I think I'll buy a few more for the rest of my pencils and pens.

First off, they probably have the best sound / sound control of any headphones I have.  Most have one pre-set setting and you cannot change it.  These offer you the ability to choose between several pre-set settings (good if you listen to lots of types of music as one setting does not always flatter everything you might listen to).  The only downside is if you leave your music on while shifting through to find the best setting, you'll hear the voice telling you what setting you're switching too over the music, so you'll likely want to pause the music, change the setting, listen, if not the setting you need, repeat.The ability to have them paired with both your computer and your phone and use both at the same times is awesome.  Many do let you pair to multiple devices but you can then only use one at a time.  This is ideal for accepting calls while on the computer.It comes with all of the cables you could need.While not noise-cancelling, they do offer a bit of what I'd call a sound buffer.  They're not totally blocking out sound before you turn them on, but they are greatly reducing it.  Once on, almost no noise gets in or out.You'll probably need to read the manual.  There's a lot more buttons that the usual 2 or 3 - the right cup housing bluetooth on/off/pairing, volume,  and the mic mute button, the left cup houses the buttons for powering on / off, adjusting the sound settings, and the mic settings (there are also multiple mic settings).The only real downside for me is comfort -- The ear cups having the ability to move is nice as are the ear cups themselves.  That said, my ideal headphone has some give to it.  I'm prone to severe migraines and ear infections so any headphones that feel like they're sort of gripping my head end up leaving me miserable.  These definitely have that clamped down feeling.  A little more give to them and I'd have loved them, as they are I just like them but cannot use them very long.  Someone not as sensitive will likely love them.The transmitter is easy to figure out as well, though honestly I really only used it to mute something much quicker than trying to remember what button was where on which ear cup.Although the fit wasn't for me, I'd still recommend them for most people.

I've noticed more than a few reviews saying that it's a cheap cord that falls apart after a week or less.  I've been using it just over a week with no problems.  One of the common complaints I've seen is that you get the not supported error message, I've not experienced that.  It does what it should do - charges my phone and in this case does so while being a pretty color.  I'm using it with an iPhone 5S and the current iOS (8.1.2 as I write this) and it works just fine.The coating plastic does feel different from my Apple branded charging cable but I'm not sure yet if that is good or bad.  We'll see how it holds up long term.  If I discover any reasons to complain, I'll update this review.*update* five months later and it's still working.  I see a lot of negative reviews but personally haven't had the issues other had.  In fact I never got around to replacing my official Apple cord before this has been working fine.

Coralie lives in a freak show.  Literally.  Her house is shared with her fathers Museum.  Full of oddities that her father (aka The Professor) has either created or hired.  Just as Coralie is starting to turn into a woman, her father uses her deformity to expand his collection.  Shell now be a mermaid, whether she likes it or not.  Shes not the only one who feels devotion toward her father.  Maureen, the housekeeper who doubles as a mother figure for Coralie is also prone to do whatever the Professor asks of her.  Some of the Professors freaks have worked for him so long that they too would do nearly anything for him, despite his less than kind reputation.As larger, more extravagant forms of entertainment begin to show up, the Museum must find a way to keep up.  Just as Coralie starts to realize that perhaps there is more to the world than her father and his museum, the Professor is plotting his largest and most disturbing creation.Eddie on the other hand has already escaped his fathers home.  Feeling his father was weak, he wanted to be everything his father wasnt.  First being taken under the wing of the neighborhood psychic and then later a master photographer, Eddies life isnt glamorous but it is fairly stable.  Until he witnesses the end of a vicious fire and becomes involved with the case of a girl missing since the fire.As the novel progresses it becomes more and more obvious that Coralie and Eddie are destined to meet, likely under less than ideal circumstances.My main issue with this book, the issue that prevents me from giving it 5 stars is that this book feels as though it doesnt know what to focus on.  Should it be the story of our characters or the story of NYC and what it was during that time period.  It leaves both feeling a little underdeveloped.  Its still a lovely book.  A book that tells a complete story without needing a trilogy to do so.

I gave this two stars, not because it's a bad product, but because it's actually a really neat product hindered by some poor choices.  Let me be clear:  This drone demos really well.  You control it with your smart phone, it beams video right to it, it *jumps* which is really cool.  It can flip in either direction and the video always shows you which way is up.  If you saw this in a mall you'd probably plunk your cash down on it right away, and for ten minutes you'd be really happy!  Except...... You can only do 90 degree turns.  No, seriously, you can only move this thing like a chess piece.  Intuitively you think you could drive it like a tank, but I've yet to actually get the control to work this way.  Since the thing bounces around a lot you almost always knock it off in a random direction, meaning you're zig-zagging it back to you.  I would add one star to this review right now if somebody showed me how to get more fine-tune control to the steering.  *update* Thanks to a comment we figured out we can turn while accelerating.  Still a very awkward control.  Cannot watch the video screen while controlling it.  What I would like is tank like controls.  Cannot turn the thing unless it is moving forward.There's one more serious problem that, frankly, I'm surprised made it out the door.  They claim you can add a memory card to this thing and record video.  What isn't clear until you buy it is that the type of memory stick it uses is not widely available.  Instead of using a standard USB port so you could plug in one of the three-hundred or so thumb-drives you have scattered around your domicile, it uses some mini or micro-USB port that ... well I've never seen a drive that will fit that port, I don't think anybody reading this review will either.  You will not be recording video with this device unless you make it a serious project to find the memory card you need to do so.  If they changed the port design, that would be one more star I'd add.One last problem is it doesn't really work on carpets that well.  I mean it kinda does, but I utterly failed to chase my cat with it.  This thing really is very light-weight and low power.  I'm an apartment dweller that has both hallways and a big parking garage to play with this this thing in, your mileage may vary.

This formula definitely gets the job done but can be too effective.  My newborn was having constipation issues with Similac Advance formula so I decided to give this a try.  It took about 28 hours to work, but after that he had steady diarrhea (very, very watery).  We cut back immediately and now use this in a ratio of 3 parts Similac to 1 part Reguline.  This seems to be doing the trick.  Please be very careful if this gives diarrhea to your baby - that can be very dangerous!

This is my daughter's first toy of this type - never been in a bouncy toy before either.  At first she was not sure what she was supposed to do!  Now we throw other toys in there and she "fishes" for them amongst the balls.  Like other reviewers wrote, the number of balls that you get is definitely not what's represented in the product picture!  We ended up ordering an additional 200 balls and that's been a winner.  So while this is nice, sizeable, durable, and *potentially* fun - shoppers will need to factor the cost of additional balls if they want to get full enjoyment out of it.

I love this case!  Finally something that doesn't cover up the color of the phone.  It's sturdy, doesn't have flaps over the ports (I hate the flaps on other OtterBox cases), and it's versatile in terms of designs that can be used in the window.So far the window is very scratch resistant, which was a concern of mine.  I put it in and out of my pockets and my purse and no scratches.  It does show fingerprints though, so if you've got greasy fingers you may not like it.Recommend!

This is a classy looking leather-banded watch.  The band is somewhat slick on the outside with an indented crosshatch pattern in it and the back has a soft leather finish.  It bends nicely around the wrist and isnt squeaky at all like cheaper leather or imitation bands.  The watch is water resistant to 30m and fits comfortably on an average sized wrist.  The only really notable thing is how large the watch's box is.  I've never seen a box so large for a watch - it's literally 11"x4.5"x1.75" so if you're looking for BIG presentation this is the one!

1:03 Mins This is an interesting puzzle.  I chose it because of the musical aspect, but the sounds are so darned annoying!  See video for demonstration.The puzzle is made of light weight wood and the decals are similar to what is on the cover of a Little Golden Book.  I think it will be durable as it has already undergone extensive gnawing.  Overall I like it for my little girl, but sure wish the sounds were cuter!

I recently purchased a lake home and it had drainage problems in the past which caused water damage in the basement.  The timing couldnt be better to receive this product because I just took it to the lake house and used it in areas where I thought there could be moisture issues.A bathroom flooded in the basement which ruined the vanity cabinet and part of the wall.  There was obvious mildew and mold present throughout bathroom.  I was very curious to understand if moisture was still present in the area.Using this FLIR moisture meter is extremely easy for a layperson.  Im not a mechanic or someone who works in an industry where testing and measurement equipment is readily used (Im a corporate guy).  Quite literally, I turned on the device and held it in front of an area where I thought there could be moisture and it quickly provided useful data.  Thankfully I did not find any new moisture in the bathroom, which means the previous drainage issue has been resolved.PROS durable construction and nice rubber grip extremely easy to use onboard software navigation and feature selection is exceptionally easy taking pictures is intuitive using the laser pointer is very useful because sometimes it is hard to tell from the device image what youre looking at until you shine it with a laser extracting pictures from the device to my computer was extremely easy and follows the exact same process as removing pictures from a cell phone.  The device acts as an external USB hard drive.  Simply navigate to the picture folder and transfer the pictures the device powers on quickly so there is no need to wait for the unit to boot or warm-up there are multiple uses for this device other than looking for moisture.  I examined my garage and easily identified drafts, hot water pipes, ducting, and anything with temperature differentiation.  I plan to examine each door and window for weather stripping issues. it easily picks up the heat generated from electronic devices moisture sensing ability is highly impressive, incredibly sensitive.  I grabbed a large beach towel with wet hands and placed it on the counter.  Given the size of the beach towel and the limited amount of water I transferred to it from my hands, you could barely feel any moisture in the towel.  I used the device and quickly spotted the wet spots which I could not perceive visually (or barely by touch).  It is amazing how accurate and sensitive the device is.CONS for the price I think this moisture meter should come with a case. The device comes with an accessory to more accurately measure moisture which consists of a two-pronged pin connected to the device by an Ethernet port.  I tried to use this accessory and couldnt figure it out by stumbling through it.  This is not necessarily a negative for the device, but using the accessory requires careful reading through the digital manual to really understand the purpose. I think this device should come with a printed manual other than the quick start guide which comes with it.  It is absolutely ridiculous how many languages are printed in the quick start guide, like every language on Earth (or so it seems)!  I think there should be a US version with the complete user manual and a charging receptacle just for US electrical outlets.  The device comes with electrical fittings for every possible international electrical outlet you can imagine.Overall I really like this device because moisture is a significant enemy to homeowners, especially those owning a lake house.  This device has prompted my curiosity into other measurement devices like high-end thermal imagers.  It is amazing what the human eye cannot detect but can be easily seen by this device.  Im sure there are a lot more uses that Ill stumble across in the future, especially figuring out how to use the pin accessory.  I am very pleased with how easy it is to use and its unbelievable accuracy.  I would recommend this device to anyone with potential moisture problems.

I have two babies that are 14mos apart in age.  Both have Britax carseats - one is the Marathon (pink giraffe print) and the other is this one.  Although the marathon is great, this Boulevard model is definitely a step up with more adjustments, easier adjustments, and better padding.  It is also much heavier than the Marathon (not sure why).We've used them both rear and forward facing in a Yukon Denali and also a Ford F150 pickup truck.  The latch system is super easy and the extra toggle straps make this seat secure even if not in the perfect position (this has occurred a few times during travel).  The kiddos are comfortable overall, my only issue being that the seats hold heat in the summer time.  I don't think that is any different than other car seats though.Overall we've been extremely pleased with this brand and model of car seat... they're just plain easy and reliable.  Recommend!

This face wash is very high quality.  I'd compare it to Lancome's Creme Radiance (cream to foam cleanser).  This Vichy product has a mild, pleasant fragrance and goes on so as not to be wasteful.  It adheres really well vs. other cream cleansers that just kind of slide off wet skin.  It leaves skin very soft with no tightness, and there is no lingering fragrance whatsoever.  My only question about this product is why it's called "thermale" - there is no warming property to it at all!

This is a pretty watch.  The color is a true rose gold, not brassy at all.  The leather band is somewhat slick on the outside with an indented crosshatch pattern in it.  The back is a softer leather.  It's water resistant to 30m and fits comfortably on an average sized wrist.  The only really notable thing is how large the watch's box is.  I've never seen a box so large for a watch - it's literally 11"x4.5"x1.75" so if you're looking for BIG presentation this is the one!

I'm on the fence over this bag.  It's a nice size, holds its shape, and seems as if it will be durable for rough treatment.  However, I have a list of dislikes as well.As I said above, the bag holds its shape - but this makes the material stiff and not smooth or soft.Also, the opening is a double zipper pullback and while that gives great visibility and packability, it's also a pain at times when you want to just quickly reach in and grab something.  The waterproof flap that covers the zipper will be great for weather protection, but makes opening not so smooth at times.The HUGE lettering and even the size (70L) are plastered on the bag and I feel like I'm a walking advertisement.  I prefer nice things that are much more understated.It smells like a pool flotation device when you first open it - I believe it's similar material used to make this bag so water resistant.  The smell does fade though, which is a plus.Bottom line, it'll get the job done by holding a bunch of stuff, staying intact, and not being ruined by the weather.  The downsides are primarily related to user friendliness.

This watch is listed as gold tone, but definitely has a brassiness to it.  It comes in a large box (the largest box Ive ever seen for a watch) that would make for nice presentation if it werent for the very strong solvent smell that I detected when opening it.  I sniffed around - its the watch, not the box that has the odor.  The white mother of pearl dial is only mildly lustrous with minimal pearlescence (see photo).  The functions are nice and it's a comfortable fit, but it is just not a nice match with my pale skin.

The idea of this toy is great, but the execution falls a little short.  The arrow points at an animal and when the lever is pulled the voice/song speaks the name of the animal and its sound.  It's cute, but really fast and it kind of runs together.  I expected the sounds to be slower and more distinct.  My 13mo old can pull the lever with some effort, but mostly we do it for her.

We love this motorbike!  I have a 13mo daughter and this is such a great toy.Out of the box it's a snap to assemble.  It's also an intuitive design so adjusting the wheels from a trike to a 2-wheel style is very easy and won't require looking up instructions or storing parts for later on.The sounds are fun, the buttons are engaging and the fit is right on for her at 33" tall (legs are bent and able to propel scooter forward).  This could probably work well for a baby from ~29" I'd guess, but their legs would be straight down, not bent.Definitely recommend - great value and lots of smiles!

I have two FP Snugabunny style swings and also 2 Graco gliders.  This Ingenuity swing rounds out my collection of baby motion devices.  I've found these items to be so very helpful in soothing a fussy baby and helping the baby to sleep (and stay asleep).  The somewhat unique features this one offers:- removable seat (but not that handy to do so)- lights in the mobileAll the swings rotate in multiple directions as this one does, which I think is crucial.  Some babies like back and forth motion and some prefer side to side.  That alone can make all the difference.  Music and the mobile are on par for a swing, but the lights really are a neat extra feature of this one.  Very young babies seem to be mesmerized by the lights, whereas my other devices (no lights) didn't really capture babies' attention until they were older and starting to reach for things.All swings seem to have wide bases for stability, and this is no exception.  Not the handiest things to move, which is why I have more than one!  My biggest beef with this unit is the timer on the swing.  I want the swing to run forever, not shut off after 60 minutes max.  My babies have gotten the best sleep of their young lives in swings and usually within 10 minutes of one stopping the baby wakes up.  The FP models run for 4 hours which I greatly prefer.  Hardly ever does a baby sleep that long, but when they do it's pretty exciting for a sleep-deprived parent.Overall this is a really nice unit with good features and quality fabrics.  Yes there are pluses and minuses, but this is definitely worth considering when you're in the market for a swing!

This is a cute little toy that's engaging.  It's colorful, has a button that makes squeaky noises, and lots of fun parts to play with.  My daughter is 13mos and carries the top (minus the bowl) around with her.  I think she likes all the shape holes - she uses them has handles.  So far, my biggest concerns were that it's not the smoothest on the backside (of the top).  There are some ridges and screw holes, some of which aren't what I'd call sharp, but they're not smooth and rounded either.  So far no issues though, so perhaps my concern is unfounded.  The only other issue to note is that the button (nose) that makes the squeaky noise would be impossible for a child to get a squeak out of.  My daughter loves pushing the button anyway, but it takes a focused effort for adults to get a squeak out of it using fast/firm motions.Overall, this is a toy that I think will be a staple in the long run.  The bowl is fun, the top and parts are colorful, and I think it'll be included in lots of activities.  Recommend!

What a fantastic little invention for car rides with baby.  Ours have been very fussy riders, but have also really loved the black and white books.  This is a perfect combo to fix the problem with something they love!  The nice thing is that the picture cards are interchangeable and we've also used our own pictures in there (pictures of the baby, pictures of us) and it keeps the baby interested for quite a while.Highly recommend!

This high chair offers a lot of bang for your buck.  Particularly helpful is how modular it is for use at different ages and also different situations.  We have a taller, counter-height table and our other high chair leaves the baby sitting low and left out.  With the removable seat on this one, we can put her (in her seat, with tray) at our height and she feels so much more involved.  A huge plus!

This glider is nice because it has a smaller footprint than standard swings - less space, easier to move.  It also puts the baby at a slightly higher level so its easier to get in/out of.  We used to only use a swing, but this glider has the advantage of the removable bouncer seat, which is great!  Imagine the baby being all comfy in a bouncer but they cant quite fall asleep with this glider you just pick up the bouncer, pop it in the glider, and set the motion/songs as desired.  With a swing we wouldve had to pick up the baby and start all over again in the swing.  Portability is a huge plus!  The main glider seat (removable bouncer seat) also has a vibrate feature which can be handy with a gassy baby. Ours has gotten relief this way when nothing else helped.One other nice feature is the timer (and lack of a default shutoff). This machine will run until you turn it off. This is great when baby is taking a super long nap. Other swings we have automatically shut off at 4 hours and this is no big deal, but once in a blue moon the baby takes a super long nap and the last thing I want is an interruption because the swing stops! This glider will keep running until it is turned off, so thats a huge bonus in my book.The fabric is soft and easy to wash, the music and volume are both par for this type of device.  My biggest beef is the location of the buttons.  They are on the side of the unit and our toddler is very keen to press them.  Im not sure how else the design would work though, so I cant really ding any stars from the review.The only other consideration for parents shopping this type of device is direction of motion.  Some babies dont like moving back and forth - they only like side-to-side.  We had one like that who didnt do too well in the glider.  It made her a bit motion sick I think.  Thats how we ended up with a swing, because swings usually do both motions: side-to-side and front-to-back.  It might be worth trying in a store or at a friends house to find out.  Otherwise, this is a great piece of baby equipment that Id definitely recommend.

This is a busy looking product that draws a child's attention.  We have a 1yo and she isn't entirely sure what to do with it... I can see that many people have this for older children and perhaps that's why.  We do play one-on-one with her and the toy to show her how the magic points work and she enjoys the songs.  She just hasn't quite gotten it for herself yet.  I think this will come in time.My biggest beef with this product is it's busy-ness extends into assembly.  It comes in so many pieces!  Most kids' toys come fairly assembled with only large pieces to attach, but this was much more involved.  Don't expect to pop this out of the box and have it ready in a flash - not happening!Overall I think this is going to be a very good long-term toy, especially due to the interactive nature and colorful setup.  It *is* nice that it folds and can be moved around.

This was seriously disappointing.  What on earth happened to the real game?  This is billed as being the "classic" game yet the parts being removed are a dog, cell phone, clock, frog, bell... I just don't understand!  The original game was perfect as it was.  This is just downright lame.  I've included a pic for reference, showing the parts, holes and game board.
This app is great for watching soccer or cricket. I thought I could of watch live tennis, but that wasn't the case.
I used this for sore gum or dietary supplement. If you drink it in water it does suppress your appetite. If you put it on your gum or a rash, it gets sticky but it will dry up rash and heal gums.

I bought these on sale for $10.00 which was a good deal. The cookies was fresh and tasted yummy. The texture wasn't hard or soft but just right. I shared the 24 packs with my friends and family. The only con is  the 2 cookies in the pack  are worth 200 calories. I highly recommend these cookies.

I love this app because it give you live updates on tennis matches on the WTA/ATP tour. It also tells you the draw for the tournaments, so you know who your favourite player is going to place. You can also find out players ranking. I highly recommend this app if you love tennis.

I bought this skirt in small for my 8 year old daughter as part of her school uniform. The skirt fits her great and looks good on her. The skirt is well made for $5.00 dollars. The skirt does have a zipper and a button on top. I highly recommend this skirt for the price.

I bought these pants for my 8 year old daughter in a small and she loves it. The pants is well made, soft material, washes well and looks great on my daughter. The pants run true to size. For the price of $3.00 dollars, I highly recommend it.
I missed placed my last cord and order these as a replacement. The cord works great with my Panasonic Linux DMC ZS5 camera and I'm very pleased.  The price was fair. I highly recommend this cord.

I bought this boot in size 1 for my 9 year old daughter and she loves it. I paid $28.00 dollars for these which was a steal. The boot is well made and run true to size. The boot looks great with dress or jeans.
This XMTV Palyer didn't work on my Kindle.

I down loaded this tv channel because I though I could of watch tennis matches live, but that was not the case. This site will show you old football games, and cricket matches. If you love football aka American soccer then this site is for you.

My daughter loves her nightgown and sleeps in it every chance she gets. The nightgown is true to size, well made and washes well. The fabric is soft and not itchy. The price of $8.00 was a good deal.  I highly recommend this night gown.

A child in my daughter's class had an eraser phone, so my daughter begged me to purchased one for her. I bought these for her as a stocking stuffer for Christmas. She has enough erasers to gave to her friends and many school years to come. The eraser does a pretty good job at erasing. If the sliding piece comes of it is easy to snap back on.

I bought this pajama for my daughter to wear on Christmas Eve. She is 8 years old and I got her size 8, the pants were a little to big. The pajamas are soft, washes well, looks great and very well made. They were worth the $10.00 dollars I paid for them. I highly recommend them.

I bought this sweater in small for my 8 year old daughter. The sweater fits her great and looks lovely on her. The sweater is thick , soft and delicate. It looks nice with Jean or leggings. The only negative is the sweater is nit/crochet, so the thread then to unravel a bit. You have to wear a tank top underneath the sweater.

I bought this sweater in small for my 8 year old daughter for Christmas. It fits her great and she looks lovely in it. I pair it with some black leggings. The sweater is very well made and the fabric is soft. My daughter is on the shorter side, so sweater reaches her knees. The sweater dress could have been a little thicker. I think it was worth the $15.00 that I paid for it. I highly recommend this sweater dress.

I bought this pajama set for $10.00 and it was well worth it. My 8 year old daughter loves cat, so I had to buy it for her. The pajamas are very well made, fabric is soft, thick and washes very well. I will buy  from this brand again. I highly recommend this pajama for any kid who loves cats or warm pajamas.

These Jeans are very well made and fits true to size. The fabric is thick and washes well. My daughter loves her Jean and it looks nice on her. My daughter has skinny legs, so the jeans isn't hugging her legs. I got these jeans for $15.00 dollars and it was a good deal.

I bought this boot for my 8 year old daughter to wear on 20 below degrees days in the winter months. She wore them to school in 25 degrees weather and her feet was warm. I think the sole is a little bit heavy but she loves them. The boot fits true to size. The only thing I don't like about the boots is the drawstring in the back and not front.

I bought this top in small for my 8 year old daughter. It fits her great and looks nice on her. The top is very well made but the fabric is  on the thin side, so you have to layer it for winter. I washed the shirt twice with the damage. I highly recommend it for $10.00 dollars.

I bought this in small for my 8 year old daughter. It fits her a little big because  my daughter is small for her age. So I will say the shirt runs true to size. The shirt is thin, so you have to layer it up, if you're wearing it in the winter time. The material  is soft and it washes up nice. I highly recommend it for $7.00

These jeans are very well made and thick. My daughter has very skinny legs, so these doesn't stick to her legs. The color is true to the picture with darker and lighter shades of grey. I paid $15.00 dollars for them and highly recommend them.

I bought the case in purple and it is an eggplant purple color. When you open up the smartshell  case you will see a  hollow out space on the right and you will pop the Kindle in. It  Will fit your Kindle nice and secure. The magnetic closure works perfectly by turning the Kindle on, when you open it up.

The necklace is nice for the price of $3.73. The necklace is light weight and lays flat on my chest. It will jazz up any outfit. The black enamel paint on the necklace adds a nice touch to it and it was evenly painted. I received the necklace in good condition in a plastic bag inside of a black box.. I highly recommend this necklace  for the price.

The necklace is nice for the price of $3.10. The necklace is light weight and lays flat on my chest. It will sure to jazz up any outfit. The pink across the gold looks nice. I received the necklace in good condition in a plastic bag inside of a black box. I highly recommend this necklace for the price.

The bracelet is nice and will jazz up any outfit. I received the bracelet in good condition with no stones missing or discoloration. I paid $3.19 for it and was very satisfied. The bracelet isn't heavy or cheap looking either. The bracelet is a stretched bracelet and all the squares line up nicely. The bracelet I received was red and came in a plastic bag inside of black gift box. For $3.19 I highly recommend this bracelet.

This bracelet is chunky and all you need to wear on your wrist. The bracelet is nice for casual wear, to jazz up any outfit. I will be wearing it in the Spring/Summer. I paid $3.63 and it was well worth the price. It has a nice weight to it.

I bought this chain in the hematite tone for $3.97 and it was worth the price. The necklace isn't as bulky as how it is shown in the picture and is very light weight. I was surprised when I saw the necklace but was happy it didn't look like a dog chain. The necklace lays flat and looks nice for the price. The customer who said "the chain doesn't lay flat" is putting on the chain wrong. You have to have the clasps in your left hand for it to lay flat or it would not.

These earrings are very pretty and dainty. You will get many compliments every time you wear them. The artwork with the gold foil is just exquisite on these earrings. The earring looks just like the picture. It came in a nice black box, so could gave them as a present. I paid $14.43 for these earrings and they're well worth the price. I highly recommend these earrings.

This lotion moisturize your skin and locks it in for over 24 hours. Very good lotion for the winter months when your skin  dries out a lot. This lotion keeps my skin moisturize in winter and for  $2.89 it is well worth it.
The only lotion I use on my skin is Nivea . This lotion moisturize my skin really well, leaving it smooth and soft. This lotion will make improvements on your skin if you gave it a try.
You can't beat the price on Amazon. I got 3 36oz bottle of dry roasted peanuts for $12.00. The nuts was fresh and tasted good. I gave 1 tub to my sisters and she was all smiles.

I bought this coat in midnight blue and fits true to size. The coat is nice and worth the $78.00 dollars I paid for it. It is fairly light weight but the feathers in the coat keeps me warm. I live in Philadelphia PA and we had 20 degrees days and this coat kept me warm. The only negative about this coat is if you don't move the fabric from on the right side of the coat the zipper will get stuck in it. So you just can't zip coat up with out pushing that piece of fabric away with one hand and then zip the coat up.

I love this product and would purchase it again. It tasted very sweet, so I put it in water and drank it. I bought it to help improve my liver and overall health. I can feel a difference in my body and will continue using this product.

This is a nice casual sweater but it runs a little large or may be it supposed to fit big. I'm 5'2 and 150 pounds. The sweater is soft and washes well without pilling. It was worth the $15.00 I paid for and highly recommend it.

I bought the medium/large but the waist was huge. I'm still going to keep them and take in the waist myself. I'm 5'2 150 pounds. These leggings are only good for wearing with boots. I paid $20.00 for them and I think it was a fair price. The material is OK with nice weight to them.

This bottle is just a 15 days supply. I put some  into my water and drink it. I bought it because of the healing properties such as high blood pressure, skin disorder, diarrhea, diabetes, increase urine product and rid body of excess fluid. I'm just trying to live the best life possible and if this helps my overall heal, I'm all for it. I feel much better with it in my life and it is very good for my digestive system and skin.

I bought this shirt for $7.00 and wore it at my office Christmas party and received many compliments. The shirt fits true to size and the cowl lays nice on the collar bone. The shirt is soft with a lot of gold thread woven through it, that makes it sparkle. I highly recommend this shirt for the price.

I love big earrings and the price of $15.00 was right, so I bought them. These earrings are well made, gorgeous,  looks beautiful hanging in my ear and doesn't pull down my ear lobes. If you love big earrings, then these might be for you.

The bracelet looks just like the picture. The color magenta looks like a combination  of a bright pink and purple. I received the bracelet in good condition with no discoloration and it has a nice weight to it. The bracelet is worth the $3.00 I paid for it and it came in a plastic bag inside of a black gift box. I recommend this item for the price and it will be fun to wear in Spring/Summer.

I really love Tourist and his voice is of the chain. This guy is the real deal and I hope he break through in the USA like he has in England. This is nice song and you can feel his pain. He had a great show in Philadelphia and it was of the hook. This man is very talented and can sing. I highly recommend this song for anybody who is looking for a song that  speaks to the  soul.

I love this song by Campfire. I first heard this song on 50cent show POWER on  STARZ and I had to buy it. I play this song when I'm exercising  or relaxing with a drink on Saturday night. I really love the beat on this song and hope the artist gets more exposure.

This shirt drapes nicely on the body and looks nice with jeans. The material is on the thinner side and would show all of your imperfections on  the back and belly. If  You have a stomach or back fat you would have to wear shape wear with this top. The necklace is nothing to talk about. I recommend it for casual wear more than work wear.

I love this shirt a lot and have worn it  like 5 times already.  The shirt runs true to size and hugs the body in the right places without looking tight. I like the zig zag print and the cowl neck draping on this shirt. The material is soft and it washes very well. The shirt looks great with jeans, skirt or dress pants. The necklace is nothing to talk about, it's a little cheesy. I highly recommend this shirt for anybody who is looking for a great shirt at an affordable price.

This top runs large, so you should size down. The top on the model shows a A line cut which comes in at the waist but it didn't fit me like that. The top looked like a moo moo on me and didn't gave me a shape. The material is flimsy with no structure at all. Most disappointed purchase I have made in a long time.

My daughter is on the smaller side of  seven so  I bought the large and it fits her great. The top is worth the $5 dollars I paid for it. The material is soft and the sequins make the shirt pops. It washes well and didn't pill nor the Sequins fell off. I highly recommend this shirt for little girls.

This is one of my favorite bingo game that I play everyday. You get 15 bingo bucks and 30 coins every 24 hours. You need 100 coins for keys and another 100 coins for power-ups. The keys is to open up crates that will appear on your bingo cards. The power-ups adds coins and crates on your bingo cards. The more bingoes and coins you get, you will open other games and receives more coins, bingo bucks and power-up. It is a good game to pass the time playing without having to spend a penny.

I bought these pants for my 7 year old daughter and it fits her great. I love  how these pants came with adjustable waistband because my daughter has a very tiny waist. My daughter loves the color pink and the stars and hearts on the pant. The material is soft and didn't pill after two washes. My daughter loves her pants and wears them to school atleast once a week.

These earrings are pretty and well made but they are tiny. I ordered the 12mm earrings but the earrings I received was only 5 mm. I guess they meant the stems of the earrings are 12mm long and not the actual rose on the earrings. I gave these earrings to my 11 year old niece. If you like small earrings then these are for you.

I bought this bag for $40.00  dollars in the stone color. The stone color is cream on the sides and black on the front and back. The leather is very soft and smooth. The handle is braided and fits nicely on my shoulder. The zipper at the top of the bag runs very smoothly. Inside the bag is lined with a pink and purple python print, one zipper compartment and two cellphone pockets. The bag is large with a lot of room for all your essential items. I love this bag so much, I wish had bought another color that's how much I love this bag. I highly recommend this bag for anybody who is looking for a stylish high quality bag.

I bought this top for my seven year old daughter for her birthday. The top fits her great with  room to spare. The fabric is OK and is on the thin side. I love the teal green color and the pattern sequence applique on the shirt. I washed the top twice and it didn't pill or shrunk. My daughter loves this top and the price of $6.00 dollars was fair. I highly recommend this top.

My son saw this and after watching the trailer, had to have it right away. This, Barney: Most Huggable Moments, is a very cute movie with a good message. The songs are very catchy with a good message. I am glad I made the purchase.

This is an awesome Silicone Vegetable Food Steamer / Colander by Kitchen Meister. I absolutely love the long handle. It makes it super easy to use. This is so easy to store too because it collapses all the way down flat. I love the red color of the silicone. It opens and closes quick and easy. It drains well and actually holds a good amount. I must say that I do hope they come out with an even larger one, maybe even one to hold double the amount in the colander area. The silicone is food safe, high heat safe, and even dishwasher safe. This particular one seems very sturdy and I do expect for it to last and perform well. I was fortunate to receive this at a discount in exchange for an honest review. I am very happy I made this purchase!

I love this little USB Light by Lampat. This is so cute and works very well. I ordered the bright orange color and I really like it. This is so small and lightweight that it can easily be taken on the go. I love that there are no batteries and that it is so flexible. This is super easy to use. It makes a wonderful gift too. I was fortunate to receive this for free in exchange for an honest review. I am very happy to have this product.

I love this Waterproof Travel Bag from SHANY Cosmetics. It is the perfect size. Not too small but not super huge. It is quite roomy which I am so happy about as it fits everything I need. It has such a nice handle on the top too that is very convenient. The see through clear plastic is great. It is nice and strong and made with non-toxic water-resistant plastic. It fits my makeup perfectly. The zipper is strong and holds everything secure. I couldn't ask for more! I was fortunate to receive this at a discount in exchange for an honest review. I am very happy with this purchase and it is already getting a lot of good use.

This is a good quality Generic Oral-B Deep Sweep Replacement Electric Toothbrush Head set from PAZ Generix. This comes in a generous package of 12.  These fit my Oral B electric toothbrush just fine! They cleaned my teeth well too. My husband likes to change the heads every few weeks so this is definitely a money saver. I was fortunate to receive this for free in exchange for an honest review. I am definitely glad to have these.

I love this Eyelash Growth Serum from InstaNatural . This comes in a 10ml tube with a fine brush at the end. You apply it right along the base of your eye lashes. It is very easy. It goes on smooth and drys quickly. I love the ingredient blend which includes Pentapeptide-17 and Hyaluronic Acid. It does seem to be very effective so far. My lashes do seem to be growing longer. I was fortunate to receive this at a discount in exchange for an honest review. I will continue to use to see further results.

I love this Dr Wyte Advanced Home Teeth Whitening Kit. This includes 5 syringes with 22% Carbamide Peroxide Gel. it has 3 mouth trays which is wonderful as some of these home whitening kits do not include the trays. This even gives you a tray to spare! I really love how this includes the LED light though. My daughter was very excited about this. This is good for over 60 applications and it has been working great. I was fortunate to receive this at a discount in exchange for an honest review. I am very happy I made this purchase and am loving the results.

I really love this Cooling Scarf/Cooling Headband by New Home Innovations. This is a really great design! This uses advanced crystal polymer cooling technology and is very easy to use. You soak it in water for about 3 minutes until the beads absorb all the water. It is then cold and ready to use! If you would like it even colder then after soaking you can put it in the freezer for 5-10 minutes. Then the cooling effect will last even longer. This is a very nice shape and perfect for wrapping around your forehead. I love knowing I have this in case someone in my family gets a fever. This  would be perfect to cool them down. This could also be used to wrap around a knee or elbow if there is an injury. This would also be good to take on the go to my kids sports games if they are playing in the heat. I can also see how it would give great relief if I had a headache. I love that this is reusable. I was fortunate to receive this at a discount in exchange for an honest review. I am very glad I made this purchase.

I love these Gel Toe Caps Covers from Cerkos. Wow, these are just so soft! These are cushion protectors that are amazingly comfortable. They honestly do provide immediate relief. I have poor circulation in my toes when it gets too cold. These really help keep my toes warmer and keep the circulation running better. Also, if my toes do happen to get sores from the cold, these help to cushion and protect so they can heal faster. I was fortunate to receive this for free in exchange for an honest review. I am definitely glad to be using these.

This is a good quality Cailifu USB Multi-function cable quick charge set. First, this all come packaged very nice and would even make a good gift. I love how this has different heads to charge different devices. It really comes in handy and makes it convenient for travel as well. So far it has been charging fast and working great. I was fortunate to receive this for free in exchange for an honest review. I am happy to have this.

As always Book*sense deliver a fantastic summary and analysis.  This time the book is "X (Kinsey Millhone Book 24.)  I have never read any of the other books in this series, but my wife kept insisting that I would love them.  So I read book 24 and I really did enjoy it, but I could not help feel I was missing something from not reading any of the previous books.  I bought this summary and analysis and it helped me very much.  We are implementing a new trouble ticker system at my job so I have been very busy and have had very little time to read.  That caused me to take a much longer time than usual to finish Grafton's book.  Book*Sense showed me that I had missed some key points and it helped me to be much more satisfied with the novel.  It also gave me the back story of the main character so I felt I was much more acquainted with them.  Book*Sense has never let me down!

The book and movie market is very saturated with zombie tales these days, so it takes a lot for a particular title to grab my attention and earn my praise.  "The Rise of Macon" is one such book.  I very familiar with the setting, Oak Island, so I can attest to the fact that author's descriptive powers are dead on.  Gurley's prose is crisp and moves along quickly and his characters, both healthy and otherwise are very well defined.  The story is not without its humor as well which makes for great comic relief between the more intense scenes.  I had a great time reading this second installment in the Macon Saga.

I first read this story using my Kindle Unlimited Subscription, but I ended up liking it so much that I bought it so I could reread it as many times as I wanted.  It is a very funny love story filled with goofy tongue-in-cheek humor, lots of sexy sex stuff, and one particularly crazy death scene that has to be read to be believed.  Jennifer Tate is a fantastic author who has managed to take a traditional love story and set it on its ear.  Her characters are larger than life itself and you will either root for them to win or root for them to die a horrendous death.  Great stuff.

Imagine being a female living in a world where rape and sexual slavery were legal.  Imagine being female and a virgin in a world where bedding a virgin is said to have medicinal properties.  This is the world the protagonist in Mya Robarts' "The V Girl" is forced to fight to survive in by any means necessary.  The novel is very well written and contains some very brutal and horrifying scenes that do indeed make it suitable for readers no less than 18 years old.  Robarts' characters are very well developed and the main character, Lila is instantly likable and sympathetic.  I have a soft spot for dystopian fiction with powerful female leads so this was a great treat for me.

The mother and daughter writing team of B.F. and A.J. Harrolle have a unique way of blending their voices together to keep the narrative of "Jessica's Truth" flowing in such a way that the reader cannot tell that it was written by two different people.  Even in book's like "The Talisman" by Stephen King and Peter Straub, it was easy to tell where one writer left off and the other picked up because of their unique story telling style.  "Jessica's Truth" tells the sad tale of a prostitute who is forced to work the streets under a vicious pimp named Sweets.  Jessica missed her family very much, but she knows if she tries to leave, Sweets will track her down and destroy everyone she cares about.  The book is both sad and suspenseful and is a great part of the "Tale of Dragon Tears" series which all explore broken children and their personal search for redemption.

This is a great guide to meditation including all the different types of meditation, the best type of locations to use while meditating, and what kind of music, if any, you should use during your times of meditation.  It is concisely written and provides a lot of information that is easy to understand and put into place.  If you're just getting started or thinking about getting started using meditation as a relaxation technique, this book should help you greatly.

"Money Management" does indeed offer five simple tips meant to help improve the reader's money management skills.  While I'm not one for spoilers, I feel it will help the author to let everyone know there is even a surprise 6th tip.  :)  The steps are all logical, common sense, and very easy to follow.  If you need help in making financial ends meet, this may just be the book for you.

Sam Mcleod is a new and unique voice in literature and "Last Call" is an amazing read.  It's kind of a philosophical apocalyptic comedy that doesn't play by the rules and never bores the reader.  The prose is freshly written.  McLeod's narrative flow seems like a natural conversation between a storyteller and a captivated crowd.  I had a great time reading this.

"The Sword of Telemon" is a fantastic piece of historical fiction.  I know very little about the region and the time period the author was writing about so it was wonderfully educational to me as well.  The book is very exciting and beautifully described.  The plot is very well paced and does not drag on or misdirect the reader with unbelievable plot twists.  Eiland could teach a master class on character development.  Every single character is believable and uses dialogue that does not seem forced or unnatural.  I am definitely looking forward to reading more of the Orfeo Saga books.

Yes, "Happiness Step by Step" is a running guide.  It explains how exercise like jogging along with other activities like yoga can improve your health both physically and mentally.  There is plenty of evidence that physically strenuous exercise releases endorphins that elevate someone's mood.  But this book is about more than just that.  It talks about how going for runs can help you clear your head and feel better about yourself and your life.  Oddman does a fantastic job of explaining how to get started jogging and how to enjoy all of the benefits it can bring.

"Highland Secrets," the prequel to the Dragon Lore series, is ripe with everything it takes to make a great fantasy and adventure novel.  There is Celtic mythology, dragons, highlanders, and my personal favorite shape shifters who can shift into dragon form.  As always Gimpel's characters are fun and multidimensional.  The dialogue, though even from another era, still feels natural.  The story grabs you right from the beginning and keeps you reading, hoping the fun never ends.  Even better, it sets everything in motion that happens in book one and leaves you with an extra sense of satisfaction and a thirst to read book one again.

Very rarely does a debut novel come along that contains beautiful prose, elegant landscapes, and multidimensional characters while taking on potboiler topics such as bigotry towards Jews and homosexuals so successfully. There are so many twists, turns, and trysts in this book that it becomes unable to put down.  The romantic scenes are steamy, but still tasteful and the addition of a gay couple really heats things up and shakes the status quo to the core.  Bruce Benzel is definitely a voice to watch out for.  I love the fact that he doesn't allow himself to be defined by one genre.  I have read the sneak preview for his next novel, "The Plaza Murders" and while totally different, it promises to be just as good if not better.

"Day of the JaJa" by Dan Spencer has one of the most attention grabbing and original opening sequences of any novel that I have read.  Something happens that slowly brings the world around Ben Muncie to a halt.  Traffic, people, machines, and even the sun, wind, and wildlife stop moving.  There is no sound.  Ben is the only one not affected by the phenomena.  He is free to travel uninhibited and sees so much that he overlooked when everything was "normal." He's sees people in the middle of mundane occurrences that normally get taken for granted.  He sees things that were never meant to be seen by him or anyone else.  Dan Spencer is quite the storytelling and his latest novel is a wonderful mix of emotion, suspense, and revelation.  I loved it.

"Driving Grandpa" is a sweet and funny read that will be over long before you want it to be.  You keep wanting to hear more and more of Grandpa's stories because the character feels so real.  There is a certain bittersweet sadness that comes from reading these tales because of Grandpa's advanced age.  While I am sure the narrator may have heard many of these stories more times than he could count them, there always had to be the worry that this time could very well be the last.  My grandfather served in WWII, Korea, and Vietnam and he was always full of stories to tell.  He would not talk about the wars himself, but had many a great story about being a fighter pilot and the men he flew with in combat.  I think that's why I liked this so much.  There are quite a few parallels with the Grandfather in the book and to my real life grandfather.  Author John Redstand has said these are fictionalized accounts, but I am all but 100% sure that he has heard many of them in real life because they seem so sweetly familiar to me.

"Legends Of the Collective" is the outstanding and impressive debut novel by Michel Kirk.  The story is told from the points of view of multiple characters, but Kirk's writing is so crisp and detailed, one never loses track of who is doing the narrating and when and where events take place.  His characters are very well developed and all have a purpose to the story.  His prose moves along flawlessly and doesn't get mired down with red herring plot devices or seemingly senseless character behavior.  This is a great story and I read it all in one sitting even though it took me deep into the night.  Definitely check this one out.

In this, the final entry into the Winston Trilogy, Law concludes the story of Peter, a talented and brilliant doctor who suddenly develops the gift of healing. The book continues to explore what some may consider to be "forbidden" knowledge in the fact that it toys with the idea of human immortality. If humans could indeed become immortal, would that make them at least equal to or even greater than the gods who are rumored to have created them? Stan I.S. Laws books are always fascinating and challenging reads. That's what keeps me coming back time after time for his next novel or series. When you read Stan, you are not only reading wonderful works of speculative fiction, but you are also being given a shared ride through the philosophies and beliefs of the author. It's a wonderful adventure that must be slowly absorbed and cherished, not rushed through. Stan I.S. Law is an international treasure.

"The Raping of Ava Desantis" contains some of the most horrifically terrifying scenes of any novel that I have read in quite a while.  While the rape itself is not told of in detail, the aftermath of the act, and specifically the harm done to the body and psyche of young Ava will chill you to the bone.  Ava was a freshman in college when she was invited to tutor the handsome son of a furniture magnate for twice the amount she was making as a waitress.  Things go horribly wrong on the first night and Ava is brutally gang raped by three men.  Wesley, the young man she was supposed to tutor comes from very old money, so Ava was coerced by her attacker's family and even her own father to accept a substantial amount of hush money to keep quiet.  As time passes, Ava's rapists become successful and she was just a speed bump on their road to success.But then, strangely enough, people start turning up dead and the past comes rushing back like an out of control freight train.  Carbia flexes her literary muscle and delivers a story that is both compassionate to victims of sexual assault and truly terrifying at the same time.  Its horror is unflinching and grips you so tightly that you keep turning the pages even though you know what's coming next will scare you witless.Even with its dark themes, the novel is not without a sense of humor.  I would add a 6th star if I could just for the line about a room looking like it was decorated by two straight men on a dare."The Raping..." is stark, blood freezing horror and any fan of a good scary read should snag this up as soon as possible.

Myasthenia Gravis is a heartbreaking disease.  It is caused by a dfect that causes a disruption of nerve impulses to muscles. Myasthenia Gravis causes antibodies to block and destroy these nerve signals and stops muscle contraction.  This can be something as minor as an eyelid not working properly to something much more serious like being unable to swallow or even take a healthy breath.The author Margaret Kane suffers from this horrible disease and she tells her story within the pages of "Patient Zero."  Margaret was misdiagnosed so many times, and went through so many unnecessary and harmful treatments that they caused her more harm.  Finally, after way too many years of ineffective treatment and being given only 3 years to live, Margaret finally finds a treatment program that works.  Granted it is very unconventional treatment, but it stops her own body from attacking itself.Margaret's story is touching, heart rending, and beautifully told.  Being the father of two children with rare genetic disorders, I feel closer to her frustration because I have lived it myself.  Watching your own children suffer and feeling helpless takes its toll both physically and mentally.I really loved reading Margaret's story.  It will make you cry, but eventually lift your spirits.

Holly Hunter is a student at Washington University in Seattle.  One night one of her friends, a sexually active girl, is out through hell at a frat party.The girl is forced out of the school, Holly wants to do something about it, but she is about to be forced out of school as well because she is running out of money.  Just when it seemed like Holly's dreams were over, she lands a job as a live in nanny for a rich power couple.  Holly becomes fast friends with the couple and then she becomes much more.  The sex does not happen right away, it takes some time, and Slater obviously takes real pleasure in teasing the reader about the steamy love scenes that are to come.  "Adult Education" is sexy and exciting and is definitely one of Slater's best works.

Michelle Wild, the female protagonist of Alvin Slater's "Intensive Care," is one of his strongest and best female characters to date.  She is so sexy that she can steal your heart with just one smile.  But like all of Slater's female characters, she is no ditsy girl who only has her looks going for her, she is also very intelligent and possesses a wicked sense of humor.  While on shift, Michelle must tend to armed robber and folk hero Logan Steward who instantly charms the panties of off her.  Logan escapes and Michelle is kidnapped and forced to provide medical care for Logan and his gang of never-do-wells.
