It is like a small paperback book. You could put it in your bag, briefcase, and pockets in notebook cases but not in your pocket. It is lighter than it looks. So the weight should not be a problem.2. WELL MADE. The speaker is made of durable plastic, it doesn't feel cheap. The buttons are placed where you can have easy access: TOP of the speaker (power, FF, REW, and volume buttons are located), and the SIDE (Bluetooth button, and charging connection are located). It also has audio jack, so you can connect the speaker to your notebook that does not have Bluetooth. The silver colored front looks elegant and expensive. Nice touch.3. SOUND QUALITY. The sound quality while not TOP notch compared non-Bluetooth speakers, it is excellent for Bluetooth speaker. Remember that your sound quality also depends on your smartphone, and the quality of MP3 or MP4. The sound comes out loud and clear - but not distorted, but balanced. Overall, it is clear, strong, and balanced.All in all, if you like to have great sound outside or inside, without the tangling cable, then consider this gem. You will be pleasantly surprised. Highly Recommended!!

SSD (Solid State Drive) is much faster and quieter than traditional HD (Hard Drive), though the price is higher. But nowadays, SSD is becoming more affordable than before. And Toshiba 256 GB Q series Pro is one of those SSDs. Since many use SSD for their recent notebooks and reviews many. But I chose to use SSD for my 6 years old netbook - such as ASUS eee PC 1000HA. Haven't used it for 4 years because of its degrading performance. But I wanted to see whether I could use netbook again for my work every day. Here is the review:1. QUIET. All SSDs are quiet since there are no moving parts. eee PC 1000HA has been amazingly quiet.2. LIGHT. Toshiba 256 GB Q Series is made of aluminum casing - much lighter than competition. Already light eee PC 1000HA has become lighter.3. PERFORMANCE. [a] Speed - is much, much faster. My eee pc 1000HA (2 GB RAM, Win 7 Home Premium) boots up less than 20 seconds. MS Office Word 2010 opens up in 2 seconds. Other applications vary, but many of my programs consistently open up faster than before (difference is NOTICEABLE). In short, the netbook is very much useable. I've been taking my 6 year netbook to work and it has been great! Thanks to Toshiba Q series, it gave new lease on life! [b] Bench mark - according to Crystal Disk Mark, Toshiba 256 GB Q series scored: Seq. Read 125.7, Write 121.1; 512k Read 116.7, Write 112.6; 4k Read 11.70, Write 28.08; 4k qd32  Read 17.17, Write 39.94. This score was much better than Kingston V300 series in the same netbook. And Windows Experience Index jumped from 1.2 to 2.3! [c] Multitasking - MS Word 2010, Firefox, Windows Live Mail, and Kindle were all opened, and I had no problem using them.4. OVERALL Usability. I must say that I enjoy using this netbook again, thanks to Toshiba 256 GB Q Series SSD! Music, pictures, videos, MS Office, web browsing, and other programs are all work well. Even Linux works well in this SSD as well!I am very, very happy to use my old netbook again because of Toshiba SSD! If you do not need 256GB, then you could consider 128 GB for your netbook. Toshiba Q series Pro SSDs are highly, highly recommended!

This is a small Nerf-type of football for the kids. But even adults can enjoy it with their children. If you have a child that likes football, then this is a great gift for him/her.PROS:1. It is soft (like a Nerf football), but sturdy (not cheap). So it will not hurt your hand playing. My kids (8 and 10 years old) love to throw it around, because it is small and soft.2. When the light is "ON" (there is a switch to turn the light "ON" or "OFF") at nights, it is real cool! Especially, when you throw a tight spiral. Kids are all smiles!3. It comes with the battery - so you do not need to purchase one.4. It is a LED light. So it can withstand abuses.CONS:There is no real con, but the switch is small and it is engrooved, so it is not easy to turn "ON" or "OFF." Just be careful of your nails.All in all, this is an inexpensive and fun toy for your kids, and even you might enjoy it! Recommended.

CONTEXT: I am 46 years old male, not overweight and in decent shape. And I was looking for a quick overall workout for my body. I cannot afford the whole Insanity set, so I just got this Insanity Fast & Furious (IFF).PROS:1. Wow! Amazing workout! After the workout, I was sweating like I've never sweated before. My heart rate was high and I was huffing and puffing. I KNOW I burned a lot of calories. Some say, you will burn 300 - 500 calories depending on your intensity of the workout.2. It is short. 20 minutes. BUT I had to stop several times to catch my breath. So during my workout, I just "PAUSE" the DVD and continue on after catching my breath. So the whole workout in reality is about 25 minutes for me.3. Overall workout: It works your abs, cardio, toning your body.4. After 3 months of using it (3-4 times per week), I've noticed more definition, tighter abs, and overall toned body.CONS:1. If you have any joint issues (knees, ankles, wrists, hips), you might want to avoid this. It has a lot of jumping and burpees.2. For me, the music is more distracting, so I turn off the music option, so you can hear Shaun T's instruction more clearly.TIPS:1. If you want to add more to your workout. Immediately after IFF, do weights (1 set of 10 reps) of biceps, shoulders, etc... You will burn more calories that way.2. If you want to change the pace of the workout, get Shaun T's Focus T25: Core Speed DVD workout. This single DVD workout is another excellent workout, and I use it with IFF.All in all, it is a great workout and you will see results! Highly recommended!

Excellent electric tooth brush with oral health kit! The Kit comes with:*Oral-B Professional Precision 5000 Electric Tooth Brush with SmartGuide*Crest Pro-Health Clinical Gum Protection Toothpaste*Crest Pro-Health Multi-Protection Rinse*Oral-B Glide Pro-Health Clinical Protection Dental FlossPROS:1. Oral-B Professional Precision 5000 is an excellent electric tooth brush. Certainly it is much, much better than the manual ones. Personally speaking, I prefer rounded head than the elongated head. With the rounded head, you can focus on each tooth more since it covers one tooth at a time (but for those who prefer elongated head, the kit comes with additional elongated head as well with 3 other types of head). It also has automatic timer built in: It is programmed for 2 mins total, and 2 mins are divided into 4 (30sec) durations. Each duration covering 1/4 (quadrant) of your teeth. This is quite helpful as you get used to it, so that you will not clean one section more than others. The brush is waterproof and rechargeable. And it is easy to hold being slim. It is also MADE IN GERMANY. The rechargeable battery is replaceable - this is huge plus.2. The brush has 5 modes: Daily Clean, Deep Clean, Sensitive, Massage and Whitening. Each mode works differently in speed of the oscillation with different types of head that is designed for specific purpose. You will feel the difference in each mode.3. It cleans well. As stated, it is superior than manual brushing. I always feel the smoothness of my teeth all around, even the wisdom teeth that is hard to reach.4. It comes with travel case to protect the electric brush and SmartGuide to show the progress of each brushing. It displays each quadrant of your mouth, and the timer that indicates how long you have left. It can be also used as digital clock. There is no extra work involved. Just put the batteries in and start brushing, then it automatically indicates the mode of your brushing. I find this very useful as I brush.5. The kit comes with toothpaste, floss, and a mouthwash. So you are ready to start a healthy oral hygiene. I realize that you may prefer other oral hygiene products over these, but these are not bad at all. If you do not like any alcohol based mouthwash, then Crest Pro Health Rinse is an excellent alternative. They are clearly good products that can help your oral health.CONS:1. Price might be little prohibitive for someone who does not need all the stuff. If you use your own preferred paste, floss, and mouthwash, then just purchase this electric tooth brush separately - it will be cheaper.2. It takes a long time to charge the brush. To charge fully, you need to put it on the charger for more than 15 hours. But this is minor issue.Over all, I love Oral-B Professional Precision 5000 Electric brush! Highly recommended!

Every man has different preference when it comes to shaving, therefore every review will be different as well. For the sake of this review, it will be helpful if I provide my context: I am mid 40s Asian man, who shaves 3 times a week. Throughout my shaving journey, I tried BOTH blade and the electric. So I can tell the pros and cons of both.It is important to note that no electric shaver will shave as close as the blade: Blade actually touches the skin while the electric does not. For this review then, I will focus not on the closeness of the shave but overall usability of it.POSITIVES:1. It does what it claims. It does cool your skin while you shave. The "active cooling technology" does work. I did not feel any burn sensation at all. Other electric shavers you have irritation on your skin, you would feel the heat traveling to the blade foil. But Cool Tec was comfortable.2. It gives you a closer shave than other electric shavers. I always liked the Braun electric shavers, because they gave me closer shaves due to straight foil and this Cool Tec also has adaptable 3-stage cutting system (basically, it has 2 independently moving cutting elements that cut BOTH the short hair and the long hairs. The two foils move UP&DOWN and SIDE-to-SIDE to ensure capture all your hairs, while contouring to your skin).3. It can be used in shower WITHOUT the shaving cream. Yes, you can use it in the water. I personally do not like to use the shaver in shower, but I can see that others might find it very helpful.4. Easy to clean. Just pop out the top, and you can simply rinse it with running water.NEGATIVES:1. It is heavier and bulkier than the most electric shavers. I have small hands, therefore it was hard for me to control and maneuver the shaver. To be fair, you can get used to it within 2 weeks of use.2. Price. I think it is somewhat pricey, but it is subjective.All in all, I do like the product a lot. If you only use electric shaver, and are looking for something that is excellent and can be used in the shower, then I highly recommend this Cool Tec!

DISCLAIMER: Products like this depend on various factors - location of your home, location of power line, number of electrical devices in your home, and strengths of signals of your neighbors' routers, etc. So my experience may not be yours with the product.Background: I live in approx. 2200 square feet home (two stories with garage). My family (of 4), we have 4 computers (2 PC, 2 notebooks) and 2 tablets (Surface RT and iPad 2) and 2 smartphones. And sometimes, our tablets'  WiFi gets disconnected due to weak signal from the router (esp. in one particular room, where my kids play). So I thought I needed a Wi-Fi Range Extender, so I got TP-Link TL-WA850RE. Here is my experience:POSITIVES:1. Setup is real easy. Instruction (in mini CD and quick installation guide) is simple, clear and easy to follow. You will be running the Range Extender in less than 5-10 minutes depend on where you plug the unit. [a] Plug the unit, [b] Press WPS or QSS button on your router (usually, it is a little blue button on the back of your router), [c] wait for 2minutes and you are done.2. The Range Extender itself looks nice and easy to follow - very intuitive.NEGATIVES:1. It works, but not all the time, strangely. Perhaps it is just my home, but it works sometimes, increasing the signal strength by about 15%. But other times, there is no real difference.2. When it does work, somehow the internet browsing speed is slower. So it works, but not as fast.Again, user experience may vary depend on circumstances and factors around the Range Extender. Your experience may not be same as mine, but this review gives an additional information for you to consider.

I love this drill! For every day "light to moderate" job (ie, drilling holes, tightening screws) this is a great product. Before this product, I used B&D VersaPak drill/driver (3.6 V), while it was OK, it wasn't powerful enough for certain jobs (making a hole in a wood, etc), torque was lacking. However, this Bosch PS11-102 is clearly more powerful (12V) so you can do many "light to moderate" jobs with ease.[NOTE: this drill/driver is NOT INTENDED for heavy duty jobs. For those you might need to consider commercial ones]1. ENOUGH POWER: the rechargeable battery (Lithium-Ion) has 12 volt power, sufficient enough for every day chores for home or garage. I was able to fix wooden fence, cabinet, and drill a garage dry wall with ease. The torque (115 lb, max) really helps when you are drilling or tightening a thicker or harder material.2. EFFICIENT MANEUVERABILITY: 5 Position pivoting head gives you a control and comfort for harder to reach areas (I was able to drive a screw under the sink kitchen cabinet with ease, esp the corners).3. EXCELLENT DESIGN: overall design of the drill is excellent. [1] There is a led light that beams when you drill, this is a clever design that helps you when you need to work in a dark area (under the cabinet), [2] Power indicator = the drill shows you how much power you have left, so that you will know when to recharge the battery. [3] The trigger is big enough (pressed with four fingers, when you grab) so that you can easily dictate the level of power you want.4. VERY STURDY: The materials used are not flimsy. Very strong/hard plastic (tested with hammer, and dropped on the garage floor, and no damage). Really nicely built.5. NICE CARRYING CASE: Some prefer plastic case, others prefer softer canvas. This comes with softer canvas case, that can hold the drill and the charger, it also has a pocket to put the manual, and ares to store some drill bits.6. ADDITIONAL INFO: If this might be a FIRST drill you will purchase, please note that it does NOT come with any drill bit set. You need to purchase the drill bit set separately.All in all, I am very satisfied. So if you need a drill for every day job, consider this gem. Highly recommended!

Although the product does not mention the compatibility with Windows Phone 8, it does work nicely.1. Sound quality is great for the price.2. Bluetooth connection was easy and quick.3. Receiving the text by voice is a great feature and also you can reply the text with voice. Just remember to read the instruction on it - it will help you.4. You can also get a call and respond it by voice as well.5. Battery is decent.6. Wearing it on your neck is comfortable and light. You rarely notice it.All in all, very satisfied.

My wife loves this! It is smooth, sensitive and it does not cut her skin when she shaves. My wife recommends this because:1. It shaves close to your skin. Although you may not see it with a naked eye, but you could certainly feel it.2. It is comfortable. Overall, the shave is comfortable. Although the razor is somewhat bulky for a small hand, after getting used to it, the razor becomes just right in your hand.3. It smells great. With Olay Sugarberry scent, you will smell nice after the shave. Only draw back is that the strip doesn't last long enough. But this is the case for all razor cartridges.So all in all, my wife likes the razor despite some minor glitches (little bulky, thus little difficult to maneuver). If the price is not an issue for you, then you might want to consider this razor.

This is NOT a Bluetooth music speaker. It is a receiver that connects to your music or stereo system so that your music from smartphone/tablet/iPod/iPad can be played wirelessly. I love this product!1. It is a small device, unobtrusive, and stylish. It will not take much space on the table.2. Easy instruction on how to connect the device to your stereo system. I connected Belkin Bluetooth HD receiver to my BOSE Wave Music System in a minute and necessary cables are included in the box.3. I connected my Windows Phone 8 (HTC 8X) through Bluetooth without any problems. Any Bluetooth device will be suffice.4. The sound quality was amazing! BOSE was able to play all my music from my smartphone with clarity and detail. There was no skipping, dropping, or lagging during the music.If you have a home stereo system, and want to play your music from your smartphones then you want to seriously consider this product from Belkin. A very nice product. Recommended!

There are many whey protein powders on the market. Like many, I have tried several kinds. And in my experience of using whey protein, Jarrow Formula has been the best. If you are looking for effective and clean taste of protein then consider this product:1. THE TASTE. For many protein powders, the taste has been the problem. They solve by adding sweeteners or sugar. But some do not want added calories or a chemical that might not be good for them. But Jarrow's protein powder has that clean taste without the "yucky-ness." This French Vanilla is natural, mildly sweet (without adding artificial sweetners) and easy to drink with water or milk.2. THE SOLVENCY. The powder easily dissolves in water or milk. If you do not want to use a mixer or even a spoon, try this. In an empty water bottle with cap, add 6 - 8 oz water with protein powder (you might need to use a funnel to pour the powder in), then close the cap and SHAKE well until it is well mixed. And enjoy!3. THE EFFECT. The protein seems to work well. When I drink it after a workout or even regular work (manual labor), I noticed that the soreness is somewhat diminished and I feel at ease. I also did not see any side effect of the the product. My stomach was fine.All in all, love the product and recommended!

All of us want pearly white teeth, but it is elusive as we age over the years. Especially if we drink or smoke. But if you want quick and effective way to whiten your teeth, consider Crest 3D White High Performance White Strips.[NOTE: Whitening effectiveness vary depending on your drinking/smoking/age. I am an avid coffee drinker, at least 3 cups a day, but I am not a smoker, so this is one person's experience]1. IT IS EASY TO USE. Compare to other whitening strips, Crest 3D is really easy to use. 2 strips (for upper and lower teeth) are clearly identified. And because it is a flexible strip (not a hard plastic), it stays on your teeth easily and without any discomfort. Make sure, you put lower strip first, then the upper.2. IT IS QUICK. Once you apply the strip on your teeth, it must be on for 30 minutes. But you only apply once a day so this is quick. Once it is applied, it sticks to your teeth so it is comfortable and you could do other things (reading, watching TV, exercise, etc). Make sure you have a timer on for 30 minutes. I used my smartphone timer.3. IT IS EFFECTIVE. The best way to describe the result is that - It is NOTICEABLE. After using it for 20 straight days, I could NOTICE my teeth being clearly whiter than ever before and therefore pleasant to look at when I smile. It is not as white as bleaching, but noticeably whiter.4. WARNING: If you have sensitive teeth, you may feel slight discomfort and ache. BUT this goes away after few days of use.This is a great whitening strips for your teeth. After 20 days, your teeth will be pearly white! If you need to attend a social event (wedding, reunion, etc), then you could use "2 Hour Express" strip for that quick but noticeable white.I love the product! The only wish or suggestion I have for Crest is that lower strip should be wider (horizontally), so that it could cover 2 more lower tooth. Other than that, I thought it was excellent product!YES! For occasional deep whitening of your teeth, highly, highly recommended!

Your HTC 8X is a beautiful phone in every way. I love using my phone, and I am sure that you want to protect the screen. No doubt, you have considered more expensive Skinomi, Zagg, and other similar military grade protectors. If you are wary of applying Skinomi and the likes, consider Halo screen protector.1. Easy to put on. If you follow the instruction, you will be done in a minute. If you are not sure, then watch the installation video in Youtube or their website. Some experience bubble - but this has nothing to do with the screen protector itself, but dust or lint on your screen causes the bubble. [HINT: Use rubbing alcohol to remove finger oil or dirt from the screen, this will greatly help the screen protector to stick well]. Again, I emphasize - use rubbing alcohol to remove any residue on the screen, THEN look at the screen at an angle, you might notice a lint on the screen you didn't see it before, blow it away gently.2. This screen protector is glossy finish. Glossy finish fully captures fine details of 8X display. But if you prefer Matte finish (non-glossy and non-reflective screen), it is also available in Halo. A rule of thumb is: matte finish is easier on the eyes, but loses some fine details of the screen and is not finger print magnet, but glossy screen captures color, pixels, and richness of the display well - but is reflective, also catches finger prints well. Ultimately it depends on what you prefer.3. Excellent fit. It doesn't cover your camera or the speaker. If you have a case (I use Diztronic & Incipio Dual Pro), screen protector edges do not touch the case, thus there will be no accidental peeling or wrinkles. But this depends on your case.4. It comes with 3 screen protectors and a lint free cloth. Excellent value. I know I am going to use this screen protector for a long time.5. Quality screen. It protects from scratch, residue (smudges), and UV resistant. The material is from Japan and it shows.All in all, I am very satisfied. Especially with the price & quality! Highly recommended.

I have 4 year old Asus Eee 1000HA netbook. It was good when it came out and I used it well. But being a netbook, it is still slow (even after upgrading to 2GB Ram and Windows 7), and I haven't used it much since last year. Then I thought that replacing HD with SSD might improve its performance. But I did not want to spend too much money on a netbook: Enter Kingston SSDNow V+200 60GB. Affordable and I thought it was worth a try. I was literally wowed after installing SSD.1. Everything is FASTER. Faster boot, sleep, resume, and shutdown. Faster open up of MS Office, browser, and other programs. SPEED is noticeable! I am actually using this netbook again!!2. Everything is QUIET. No moving parts, so you hear nothing. Sometimes, fan is on - but very quiet. The bottom of netbook doesn't get hot at all!3. Battery life is IMPROVED. SSD improves your battery life by about 30 minutes. I have noticed it in my netbook. (HINT: After installing the SSD, fully charge your battery, then completely drain the battery TWICE. This will help the battery to adjust to SSD).4. It supports S.M.A.R.T and TRIM, so your SSD will be optimized for Windows 7/8 or any other OS that supports them.Although the prices of SSD have been dropped, still they are expensive compared to HD. BUT Kingston is affordable, so you get the best of both worlds: SSD quality and price.Highly, highly recommended!

I know others prefer glossy HD screen (and Halo carries that), but I love Matte screen finish - absolutely no glare. Easy on my eyes. But if you do not like "grainy" element of Matte finish, then you can choose glossy HD screen from Halo: Halo Screen Protector Film High Definition (HD) Clear (Invisible) for HTC WINDOWS 8X - Premium Japanese Screen Protectors3. Excellent fit. It doesn't cover your camera or the speaker. If you have a case (I use Diztronic), screen protector edges do not touch the case, thus there will be no accidental peeling or wrinkles. I am sure you love your HTC 8X! Now you must be wondering which case is best for it. There are several good options: Otterbox, Incipio, and Diztrnoic cases. I have Incipio already (HT-316 Dual Pro) and I love it a lot. I also know that Otterbox makes great cases as well. But these are somewhat pricey. So what is a happy medium? Diztronic case for your HTC 8X.1. The case is made out of TPU - stronger than silicon while flexible, and more shock absorbent than Polycarbonate plastics. This is very strong and sturdy case. TPU is also known for oil resistant. All in all, TPU is a great material for your phone.2. The case is slim, thin, and light. My Incipio case is great, but because it has two layers of protection(silicon lining inside and polycarbonate shell outside), it is somewhat bulkier and heavier than Diztronic case. You could feel the difference when you hold your phone.3. The case is tight fit. Other reviewers have said it is difficult to put on (this is so, because of the material and for great fit with the phone). Because it is a tight fit, the phone and the case feel like one object!4. The case is easy to handle. My Incipio case is somewhat slippery, but Diztronic case is not, yet easy to take it out from your pocket.5. All the buttons are well covered - except for the power button. All ports are easily accessible as well.So if you are looking for a great case with a great price, then Diztronic case is your best bet! I love mine! Highly, highly recommended!

I love my HTC 8X! I am sure those who own 8X feel the same way and want to protect their phone. And Incipio Dual Pro case is an excellent choice! When I had HTC Radar 4G, I purchased some cheap cases and they were not really protecting the phone. Then I bought Incipio case, and wow it really protected my HTC Radar from all aspects: drops (including face down), hits, and abuses. So I came to trust in Incipio. And HTC 8X case is no exception. It is superbly & attractively designed.1. It is called, "Dual Pro" because the case comes in 2 parts: shock absorbing silicon core and outer plextonium shell. Plextonium is polycarbonate resin sheet material that is very strong. Your 8X will be protected well.2. Raised front silicon frame will protect your phone even if it falls face down. Very well designed.3. All the buttons (power, volume, and camera) are covered with silicon cover. Since some have complained about the hard time pressing the power button (it is flushed with the frame), raised silicon power button is a welcome design - you will not struggle with it.4. All openings and ports are fully accessible.5. It is very attractive and screams premium cover.6. It comes with clear screen protector, microfiber cleaning cloth, and applicator card.I am confident that this case will protect my 8X for years to come as it did with my Radar. Highly recommended.

Lacy was my favorite country female throughout the 1980's and 90's. Saw her once, in an outdoor show with Merle and Willie in Roswell NM. I think she was almost criminally under-rated and I still love her vocals, her song choices, and her style.
Some really nice Cash treatments of mostly old songs here. If you are a real fan, don't skip this.

I always loved Steve Allen, and because I am 70, I grew up with his TV presence in many forms. I wrote him a letter back in the 1980's praising one of his shows, and to my delight, eventually I received a two-page typed answer from him. This CD has 35 minutes of light jazz, and the only flaw for me is that it depends on the organ quite a bit, never my favorite sound in music. But his group is more than competent, he wrote all 12 songs (instrumentals here...I don't know if any have lyrics) and the bossa nova style suits his choices well.

Gosh, I was on page 120 or so, after a long, dense, somewhat dull struggle, before I could make a promise to stay through the remaining two-thirds. I found the stage-setting aspect confusing, with way too much description and too little dialogue. However, after those 100-pages, I finally got enough info about the characters, their crises, their histories, and their possible fates to interest me. And the rest of the story was much better, although no characters were all that likeable for me, and most of the time when I choose novels, I want someone to for whom to root. This is a tale of two wives, two husbands, and two sons, crossing from England to Spain and back, flashing back 20 years to a traumatic event and coming back to the present for the unfolding of the final consequences. You will find some sex, some suspense, some danger, and much sadness and anger in their lives. If that description intrigues you, fine. I do believe that Ms. Knight can be expected to produce better novels in the future. I don't want to discourage her, because this book reveals she has a clever mind. What this first effort lacks is a dose of wit, a dollop of joy, and a main character who deserves fully the reader's devotion.

Overall, I think this is the best of the Atkins novels based on Parker's "Spenser" series. However, the most vile bad guys, the ones with the least excuses for being evil, meet their fates without direct confrontations with our favorite Boston private eye. The situation requires him to get them in a roundabout fashion, and I wanted a fistfight. Otherwise, great job, Ace.

The Parker Estate used Michael Brandman to keep the Police Chief Jesse Stone character alive, and now the series is in the hands of Reed Farrel Coleman. I read most of the Parker-authored entries, two of the Brandmans, and now this one by Coleman. I always enjoy these crime thrillers, because I like Jesse Stone and his back story and his "current situation" and his officers, friends, and underworld acquaintances. Tom Selleck plays Stone in occasional TV movie versions, and so when I read these, I see Tom as Jesse. This one has a beautiful lover with a secret, an old baseball team-mate with a secret, the father of an abducted boy with a secret, a mobster's wife with a secret. There are two hired killers, one with a too-late developed conscience, one without. Stick them all around a small coastal town near Boston and you get "Blind Spot."

If you pick up a book and judge it by the cover and the "blurbs" and decide "It's local history" you just might put it back down if you don't think "I'm part of that locality." In some cases, including this one, that would be a mistake. The Anglo-American West and Southwest were populated in the 19th and 20th centuries by travelers, and those who came to places like the Concho Valley in Texas as adults already had histories elsewhere. In the cases of the three women profiled in this book, their "back stories" are as fascinating as their lives near San Angelo. Mary Jane Metcalfe, for instance, born on a Georgia plantation in 1826, only spent about a decade in Texas before her death in a flood in 1882. Author Dana Glossbrenner's account of that tragedy, which took more than 65 lives, including Mrs. Metcalfe, her brother, and her teen daughter, is the stuff of nightmares for readers living in areas still susceptible to flooding. Before her death, this pioneer woman survived the suicide of her father when she was 16, the births of nine children, huge losses of money, livestock, food and property as Civil War battles raged back and forth in her husband's county in Tennessee, and his battles with inherited mental illness which confined him to an asylum, forcing her and her minor children to move to Texas. There she found herself in a community that was in the grip of a lengthy, violent battle between rival political gangs.The second major figure profiled, Annie Tankersley, was born in 1829 and died in 1902. For unknown reasons, she let her children believe that she was an only child born to the owners of a plantation, but the truth seems to be that she had several siblings and grew up a child of a small farmer who was also a preacher in a part of Mississippi not known for extensive wealth. Annie and her spouse migrated to Texas before the Civil War, to raise cattle. They got to the Concho River country by 1864, generally considered to be the first Caucasian family to permanently settle here. This was a time when raiding Indians from several tribes were still a huge danger to ranchers and farmers. By 1871 Fort Concho had been established in what is now San Angelo, and when her husband went on a lengthy cattle drive to California, Annie and her children moved into the fort for safety. When her husband returned, they built what is considered the second private home in the growing settlement just across the river from the soldiers. In 1878 there was a bitter divorce, but Annie got a fair settlement, stayed in the cattle business, and operated a hotel. She played a key part in a riot when the black "Buffalo soldiers" of the Fort demanded that a white man who shot an off-duty trooper be turned over. Ms. Tankersley created a delay that allowed him to escape the immediate danger. Eventually he was tried elsewhere and acquitted. Upon her death in 1902, Annie was lauded as a person who had a special generosity toward orphans and the homeless.And finally, the profile of Ellen Farr, born in 1862 in upstate New York, a hotbed of anti-slavery sentiment. Her father had tuberculosis, as did several in his family line, and the disease also was common in her mother's family. He moved with wife and kids to sparsely populated Northeast New Mexico, likely to improve his condition in dry air, and became a clerk for a wealthy man at his compound between Fort Union and the last leg of the Santa Fe Trail. her dad died when she was 11, and the survivors returned to New York, where Ellen earned a teaching certificate, after her mother's suicide when Ellen was just 15. Because she had an uncle who stayed in San Angelo after army service at Fort Concho, Ellen ended up coming West for a teaching job. She married, but divorced four years later, claiming spousal abuse and alcoholism. She served as postmaster, deputy county clerk, wife to a successful businessman, bore five children, and died in her mid-'40's, of unknown cause, while her husband was serving as mayor of San Angelo.This is a lengthy review, but I've left out almost all of the interesting details of these lives full of trouble, tragedy, hardship, heartache and headaches. Accounts like these are not "local history" but rather "human history." And Dana Glossbrenner did a fine job in revealing the sagas. The question I was left with when I finished was "Could I have ever done nearly so well as these folks if I had lived in their circumstances?" And that's exactly the right reaction we should have if the history book is any good. This one is.

This is only my second Jodie novel, but I liked this one a lot better than the one about the killer wishing to donate his heart. I agree with a couple of the negative reviews: The character of Jacob seems to exhibit every possible symptom of Asperger's every day yet in his own journal entries is brilliantly aware of them. Also, there is a court case at the heart of this novel, a complex one, and the final result of that case in terms of punishment(s) is left to our imagination. Crimes were committed, even admitted, yet no resolution clearly stated. I have had brief acquaintance with two Asperger's men, one in his 20's whose symptoms were so mild he became a small town policeman, but when called to his parents' home on a domestic disturbance, he shot and killed his father to save his mother. (Yes, there could be a good novel in that tragedy.) The other was a man who was not diagnosed until his '40's, who was a successful printer, married father of two, and an excellent if obsessed amateur astronomer. His childhood was much like the character Jacob's in "House Rules." So I came to this book with quite bit of interest, and it was rewarded. Jacob's brother, Theo, has troubles of his own. His mom is nearly saintly, his lawyer a rookie who likely would have never been allowed, in real life, to handle a murder case without a veteran co-counsel court-appointed to take the lead, and the main detective a lonely man forced by the seeming facts of a crime to be on opposite sides to where his sympathies lie. There is a victim in this story who I wanted to live, and whose death seems too easy, and at the moment of that development I had to decide whether to keep reading. I'm glad I did, but based on my first two of her novels, Ms. Picoult's specialty seems to be challenging readers to hang with her and try to figure out why she is taking us on journeys with difficult people toward ambiguous ends. She does that well, if "that" is an intentional goal.

I was born at the end of 1944, just before Audie Murphy's bravery in battle led to his becoming the most decorated soldier of World War II, while looking like the high school senior he should have been back in Texas. I didn't know anything about him until I got old enough to see his cowboy/outlaw movies beginning at age ten. I liked him and was too young to care than he wasn't a highly talented actor. I didn't see the film version of his autobiography, "To Hell and Back" until it was re-released around 1962, when I was a senior in high school, although it originally came out in '55. When I was about ten, I began to become a fan of certain actors and singers. My first three "crushes" were for Doris Day, Fess Parker (Davy Crockett on the Disney version from television) and Murphy. I still like all of them, and now live in Parker's Texas home town. My niece lives in Murphy's Texas home county. Several years ago I read "Audie Murphy: American Soldier" a lengthy and excellent treatment of his life. This new book is about one-third as large, and covers most of the same ground concisely. Smith, however, explores Audie's personal demons and attributes them to post-traumatic stress disorder, what in WW II was termed "combat fatigue" as if a good month's rest back home would fix it. Audie's symptoms dominated his post-war life (until his death in a plane crash in 1971 just short of his 46th birthday.) He had nightmares, needed to carry a loaded, concealed pistol every day, and sleep with it under his pillow, became a gambling addict in a really big, destructive way, failed in a couple of marriages, had trouble coping with his fame, praise, and acting assignments. He was relegated to low-budget westerns with few exceptions in a 15-year major career which featured about 40 films. This book is worth reading to learn about Murphy's heroism, the frustrations he found in Hollywood, and his misunderstood PTSD. And if you want to see some his movies, here are nine I recommend, in no particular order: Kansas Raiders, 1950, for an early example; The Red Badge of Courage, 1951; Destry, 1954; To Hell and Back, '55; Night Passage, '57; The Quiet American, '58; No Name on the Bullet, 1959; The Unforgiven, 1960, and Seven Ways From Sundown, 1960. None are masterpieces, two are civil war plots, one is comic, in two he plays non-heroes, and in two he is a supporting actor, and only two are non-westerns. However, these, in my view, show him in quickies made in three weeks on low money, a couple of high-budget fairly big successes, and his self-portrayal in the story of his WWII exploits, in which he wanted to highlight the sacrifices of his fellow soldiers, not the glorification of his own actions (as the book did, but the movie had to compromise about in order to get made.) Audie Murphy may have been a difficult man to love intimately, and to live with, but incredibly stressful combat circumstances made him that way. And that part of his life saved the lives of countless U.S. military personnel. Fourth of July seems a good day to acknowledge him.

I like getting my Robert Parkers (or the novels produced since his death with the same characters, authorized by his estate) from the library for two reasons: 1. They are free. 2. Since they only take me a few hours to read (being all dialogue for 300 or fewer pages) free is a better deal than a purchase for twenty bucks. This "Jesse Stone" entry was quite good. Someone is murdered late in the book, and that came as a surprise to me. I expected Police Chief Stone and his bodyguard friend to be able to stop it from happening, so that twist made the novel even more successful. These are all written to a formula...enjoy that formula and all of them are worth trying, although some series entries do work better than some others. Many recurring characters appear, some friends, some foes of the still-drinking but not to excess rough-edged law officer. A beautiful woman shows up now and then, an interesting pet appears occasionally, troubled townsfolk are often helped by Stone's intervention, which begins in antagonism and ends in gratitude. No deep thoughts in these, just escape into someone else's troubled world for a few hours.

This is great collection of mostly late-career Louis, mostly ballads. For a person who may be skittish about jazz trumpeting, this will ease his/her fears. Armstrong's vocals are amazing, the song selection is high-quality, and the price is good. It should not be the only Armstrong in one's collection: there are compilations of fiercer tracks from earlier recording sessions which are also superb. He was a true American original, deserving of attention even in the 21st century.

I liked the early entries in Coulter's FBI series quite a bit, but her more recent efforts more often bring the following words to mind: Lazy, affected, stilted, formulaic, stale. This one has more than one villain, plot complications which are not credible, and bad guys who are kind of dull. The names of her characters are getting strange and annoying, as some other reviewers have noted. She also has this weird need to remind us about six times per book that one of her heroes drives an expensive German sports car, even on FBI duty. While the formula, having an established FBI couple encourage romance between two other characters while all four are involved in investigating lethal enemies of society, was charming in the first few novels of the series, by now it's all too predictable. I did stick with this because I wanted to know exactly who killed whom and why, and who ran a drug deal and who was innocent, there were no real surprises at the "reveal." These are light entertainment efforts, and as such, have their place in a compulsive reader's life, but I think Ms. Coulter has ridden this particular franchise to the finish line. Her titles were "in the money" the first four or five times they entered my home, but the last three or four efforts the results have been pretty much "ho hum."

This is a great reference book on the "western" part of the country and western music industry, concentrating on performers who included lots of songs about cowboys, Indians, cattle, criminals and their clashes with contemporary life. Great photos and short bios of more than 200 singers, pickers and writers. From The Carter Family through Gene Autry and Roy Rogers and up to Michael Martin Murphy and George Strait, there is fascinating food for thought here. A CD is included with a sampling of traditional cowboy songs by non-professional singers and some who were/are polished pros, like the great Cisco Houston. Frankly, though, the book is the real achievement, not the disc. And if you like cowboy culture and find this item at an affordable price, don't hesitate. You'll be glad you have it on your shelf.

This was my first Picoult novel, and it perhaps is not the best choice for a reader initiation. I had read some glowing reviews of her output, and found this on the library shelf last week. It promised an innovative look at the "religion v. spirituality" debate and an argument against the death penalty and a  challenging look at retribution v. forgiveness. I found that it attempted all three premises, but was only partly successful in each. It took 100 pages for me to commit to finishing, since the opening 25 percent focuses heavily on the lives of death row inmates, a subject I was not fascinated by. It did get better. Unfortunately, I guessed the major plot secret long before the halfway point of the novel, as did several other reviewers. The best characters in here were Maggie Bloom, the ACLU attorney who fights to give the alleged murderer an execution that would allow his organs to be donated, and her dad, a Rabbi.  I pretty much liked Michael the priest as well, although his back story was not convincing. The inmate, Shay, who somehow works a few miracles for his fellow convicts, never intrigued me. I will say that the final 100 pages are powerful and made me emotional, and for that reason, maybe 3.5 stars is a proper rating. And I will try another Picoult, when the half-dozen books that just arrived in the mail are consumed. My advice to newbies, however, is to read some reviews of her other titles and pick one that resonates with you.

I loved the first six or so FBI series entries. The last few I read, not so much. This was good enough to finish, but none of the three main bad guys were interesting or credible. One was wealthy and powerful and smart, one was back-woodsy but "gifted" with super-fast hypnotic talent, and the third was mixed-up in values and acting on bad information that didn't justify the character's rage. Agents Savitch and Sherlock were as usual, very likeable, and the formula of having one of their friends fall in love with one of the victims in their case is getting too predictable and pedestrian. I am about to read her FBI novel that was published a year before this one. If it isn't better than this, I'll give Ms. Coulter a rest.

These are mostly mellow rock/folk hits, very pleasant. I was never interested in Sting much. I bought one of his 90's albums but after a couple of listens, lost interest. However, I found this in a bargain bin and enjoy it while driving.

If you have few or none Segovia CD's on your shelf, consider this one. You'll get 75 minutes of a great guitarist performing solo a bunch of classical pieces by Spanish and Italian composers, and it is beautiful. Maybe this qualifies as "easy listening" which is a much scoffed at category. However, for meditating, relaxing in the tub, background for reading, you can't beat this level of artistry.

This was my first volume done by Felix alone, but I liked it. It has the spirit of his father's novels (I read about 20 of those at least) but with an up-to-date sensibility regarding technology, relationships, and the endangered horse race industry. I will read his other works when my library branch gets them for me via inter-library loan. Fans of Dick Francis' output may think that his son is not quite on dad's level yet, and they would be correct, but a few of the late Mr. Francis' novels were not as good as "Damage." Of course, that means 17 of 20 were as good or better. I look forward to Felix getting better and better.

These early '50's LP's, compiled on three CD's, sound great for their age and the price. You get three hours of jazz piano trio mixing up-tempo and ballad tracks by wonderful composers. Their "hits" are here, along with some lesser-known tunes. All are pleasant, intelligent treatments great for listening while driving, surfing the 'net, reading or playing a game of Scrabble with your significant other. I've owned a lot of Oscar's later albums, but this compilation is uniformly good and quite a bargain. I found my set in a chain music store bargain bin for a couple of bucks less than the listed price, but would have gladly paid that.

Yes, four stars for a great novel idea realized just a bit imperfectly. Mr. Howard has talent. He took a real incident (an attempt to hurt singer Nat Cole at an Alabama concert in 1956), moved it back ten years, changed some of the details, invented a soldier hero who saves the "King" but pays a harsh punishment price, and shows us the ex-soldier/convict as the crooner's driver ten years later. He and Nat go back to the scene of the crime to do a makeup show in the midst of the Montgomery bus boycott. Nat only has a supporting role. The driver and his friends and family are the major characters we come to know, like and understand. I am 70, so I am old enough to recall seeing Cole's famous brief TV series of 15-minute unsponsored NBC shows. My mother liked Nat's singing, so I got to hear several of his LP's in the '50's, and have owned a great many since. We were a white family in NJ, as casually racist in our use of language as all the other Caucasian families we knew, but we did no physical or economic harm to the African-Americans we did know, and we owned records not only by Nat but by Billy Eckstine and other black artists. Mr.Howard's novel demonstrates that even in Hollywood back then racial anxieties from whites hampered the careers of highly talented men and women. Although this book is fiction, I found it reminded me effectively of the Civil Rights struggles I lived through (at a distance) throughout the 60's and made me want to listen to my Cole CD's immediately after I finished.

This is a great 2 in 1 Lighting Cable. It has a very good quality 3.3 feet cable that is bendable. This is especially good because the cord won't shorten out as soon s regular chargers do. i had no problems charging my iPhone 6+. The other connector works for Androids and other devices i don't currently have but it will be handy for the future if i ever do. Should you have any questions, i would be more than happy to answer any that you may have. I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

First i would like to say that i wear a XL but i ordered a 3X and it fits perfectly.(Refer to my photo listed)This sweatshirt is so comfortable. It isn't too heavy and it isn't too light.It is perfect to keep the chill off you.I feel so comfortable in it, i know it will be my go to sweatshirt.It is a very nice material and feels so soft to my skin.I love it!Should you have any questions, i would be more than happy to answer any that you may have.I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

This fashionable retractable dog leash has a very nice 16 feet of ribbon-leash which may i add that is very durable. Supports up to 44 pounds. I use this for my small chihuahua and it is perfect. The ribbon leash is the perfect size for him rather than those bulky leashes. I love that there are different designs to choose from. I love the skull design, especially since i have a boy dog. The buttons on the leash work really well and it is easy to lock and unlock the leash. Should you have any questions, i would be more than happy to answer any that you may have. I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

Everyone should have a zester in their kitchen. I didn't have one but i am so happy i do now. The possibilities are endless with this zester. The premium stainless steel zester is good for cheeses, veggies or anything you want to grate or zest anything. It is lightweight and it even comes with a reusable cover. 0:14 MinsHere is the trap in action....  it develops a 1200 volt charge, then when it senses an animal stepping on more than one of the 3 metal plates on the floor... zap... dead as you can see.Pro:- it is very very rare for a rat to beat it...  I've been using mine 4 years, caught about 75 rats, and only one small female was able to freak out enough to get away...  she basically squirmed like crazy, got lucky and lurched backwards out of the trap.- batteries last forever...  I put one set of Cs in it and those went over 18 months before they died- you can just dump the undamaged, not bloody, non disgusting rat body on the floor then take your dogs pooper scooper or the likeCon-- if you are sloppy with whatever bait you use, it might arc across 2 of the floor plates and wear out the batteries or possibly kill the trap, so be carefulTips:-  leave it off for a couple of days so the rats get used to their new food stop, then turn it on and they will go to town.- a university study from New Zealand recently ranked baits for rats and it was surprising:1- english muffin (yup, shocking, I tried it and caught 3 rats in a day, one crawled over his dead mates body to get to the english muffin and got zapped)2- dark tuna meat... buy the cheapest nastiest can of tuna and stick a little of it back there3- slim jims style jerky....  a lot of rats cant resist this4- peanut butter...  no surpriseMost important tip:  I found that Rats got very inventive at licking or grabbing the peanut butter or bait from the airholes in back, so I just took an old metal box and blocked it so they had to go into the front to get the bait.... they still love the bait, they just aren't able to steal it anymore.Lastly, get a cheap infrared webcam and set it up so you don't have to go check the trap all the time... set it up to email you video of the rat getting caught, then you can pull out a fresh, non stinky rat and pitch him into the trash or local stand of trees as a food donation for needy racoons etc.

2:05 Mins this product works great, just put the eggs in the rings then snap it... easy....  however I've seen reviews on youtube and elsewhere and they are showing it not working or working awkwardly....  here are some how to's to get a better experience:- first, douse the thing in running water to get it clean and lubricate it well, this makes a big difference and helps the yolks separate easier if you are doing that- next make sure the egg is aligned with its points in the rings pretty good, doesn't need to be perfect, but close so the yolk comes out easily... in the video, you can see I was careless once and had to fiddle with the shell some to get the yolk out- the biggest point is....  don't be wimpy at all when you crack, snap the handles firmly so the egg gets cleanly cracked in one shot....  quick not slow and it will work great every time- lastly, be patient on the whites separating, it will work fine, but you may have to lightly rock it back and forth and wait 10 seconds or so.overall great product... enjoy!

This headset is awesome! I received a sample for review and definitely rate it 5 stars for its excellent quality. This headset delivers in sound quality, comfort, and fine details.COMFORT: These feel like a dream! The ear part is large enough to fit comfortably around my large lady ears, and the band is padded very well so I barely notice it on my head. Other over-ear headphones usually hurt my ears, as well as the headband part feeling hard and uncomfortable on top of my skull after prolonged use. These do not cause any discomfort from prolonged wear. The ear pieces swivel to conform nicely to my head.PHONE CALLS: I use it on my iPhone 6+ and my DH says I come in clear (although not the same as using stock Apple headsets which are pretty unbeatable for phone call sound quality). He sounds crystal clear on my end.MUSIC QUALITY: The music sounds crisp and bassy when playing through my phone, and sounds even better for some reason when plugged into my MacBook Air.AWESOME FACT: THIS ALSO WORKS AS A GAMING HEADSET FOR SONY PLAYSTATION 4. I'm super excited about this latter fact, can you tell? I'm an avid gamer and play daily with my husband. If you are on PSN, you know that the stock Sony headsets are very poorly made: they hurt your ears. And Sony makes an effort so that other headsets can't be used on their system, except for the few brands they have approved, like Turtlebeach. I found that old Apple headsets can work, if you can find a previous version of them (the current ones create a buzz in the chat party). These Sentey headsets can plug right into your controller and the chat party sounds crystal clear to everyone.I posted some pictures so you can see the fine details of how well this is made.Hope my review helps and happy shopping!

This is a nice budget headset. I received a sample for review and give it a good 4 stars. It isn't the best quality headset, but you get what you pay for, and at less than $20, this works well for the price. The sound quality isn't as good as stock Apple headsets. I LOVE Apple products and believe they make AWESOME headsets for phone calls and music enjoyment. So if you have Apple products, just hold onto those amazing ear buds. But if you don't, this headset is a good budget alternative. You can use if for phone calls since it comes with a mic, and the braided cord is made of really great quality. The headset is as pretty as the pictures, super pretty in white & pink. This also works on my Sony Playstation 4, although the sound quality wasn't the best, the other players said they could hear a faint hiss when I talked, so I won't use this for gaming. I also wouldn't be able to wear this for a prolonged amount of time because of the earpiece and headband: the ear buds are too small for my large lady ears and press in on my ears, and the headband part contacts the top of my head (not enough padding for my comfort).Hope my review helps and happy shopping!

It's ridiculous how expensive nice makeup brushes are, not to mention how high maintenance they are, I only have one LOL.Hope my review helps and happy shopping!

I received a sample for review and am happy with this product. I'm a very efficient packer (I used to be a flight attendant) and appreciate anything that makes traveling more organized and manageable. I'm not sure why these are labeled as "extra deep" since this was a lot smaller than I expected it to be. But I've never used a packing cube before, so I have no reference. The quality is excellent, but for $10, I think one cube is overpriced, so minus 1 star there. Maybe it would be worth it if it was made out of more thicker durable material, or was water proof, or had some extra pockets for small items. I know the description says waterproof, but there are huge holed vents in the top and bottom, so I really wouldn't call this waterproof at all. It measures to: 6.5" x 16" x 5" (deep) but doesn't fit in my luggage across, like their stock photos (my luggage fits in the overhead compartment). I could easily fit a pair of heavy jeans in it, with room to spare for socks or a teeshirt, but I couldn't fit my large bulky knit turtleneck sweater. I intend to use this as a dirty laundry compartment while on the road, which I think it'll be perfect for.Hope my review helps and happy shopping!

I received a sample for review and am happy with this solar powered light. I live in Southern California, so I had no problems charging up this solar light during the day. The product looks just like the photos, and comes in a small box with the lamp part detached (although connected with wires). All you do to put it together is place the light's hinge on the base's hinge, and use the connecting turn-handle screw. EZPZ. I didn't need the included lug nut, because the screw didn't pop out on the other side of the hinge. You have the option to put the stake in the base, or you can use the 3 included screws & anchors to mount it on a wall. The light is not powerful, which is what I was hoping for. This is going in my parent's backyard to ward off trespassers at night and help my dog when he needs to go out. I love that this automatically turns on at night. It has a setting for off, low and high, but there isn't a significant difference, as the light is VERY DIM in general. FYI if you're on a budget, I saw similar products for a few dollars cheaper.Hope my review helps and happy shopping!

I received a sample for review and give it 5 stars. I hesitate to give out 5 stars in general unless I'm totally in love with a product, but this wallet is excellent quality for what it costs, doesn't look or feel cheap, and I can't really find anything wrong with it. I received the Black 5.5" size wallet ($7.99 at time of review).It's 7" x 4" when closed, and 7" x 8" when open. The interior is lined with a soft material to protect your phone. The right side pocket has 3 slots for cards, and I could comfortably fit 4 cards in each slot. I probably could have maxed out at 5, but I didn't have enough cards to try it out with. I posted pictures of the wallet stuffed with 12 cards and an old iPhone 4. The leather is soft and flexible so that the wallet didn't try to fly open when stuffed (which would happen if it was stiff thick cheap leather). And it actually fits my iPhone 6+ without a case on (my phone is 6+" as its monicker indicates). I usually have a case though, so I won't use this to carry my phone.The only negative thing I could say about this product is that it's not quite as shiny as the stock photos (it almost looks like real leather in the stock pix to me). But that's a real stretch, because it looks really great in person, the fine details are all there: the weave is classy and perfectly cut and put together, the seams are smooth and cleanly done, no rough edges, no cheap molding. At less than $10, I would not expect this to last forever, but it could last quite a while depending on how you use it.I would totally buy this if it came as a regular compact sized wallet for my credit cards, because it's well made and looks classy. Unfortunately I don't see any offered by this company.Hope my review helps and happy shopping!

I received a sample product for review and give it a solid 4 stars. I've been wearing it daily for a week now, and can't tell if it's doing anything for my arthritis yet, but if it does, then I'll bump up my review to 5 stars and buy some more. If it were just jewelry, I would give it 5 stars, it's now one of my favorite accessories. But since it claims to relieve arthritic pain, I can only give it 4 stars since I'm happy with it, but it does not necessarily do what it's intended to do.These are definitely stunning!! OMG it's so pretty! I will wear this regularly. It's shiny rose gold plated (I have no idea if it's true rose gold, or what percent of plating mix), but it's a really solid plating - I have to constantly bend this bracelet when I put it on or take it off since my wrists are so bony, and so far, the plating has held up very well. I will update my review when/if the plating wears off. The magnets are very strong - I used my Restoration Hardware fridge super magnets and they gripped the magnets really firmly. This bracelet really is stunning though, I can't stop repeating it - I don't think the other reviews are the usual "free sample fluff."  My husband keeps making comments about my bracelet because it's so eye-catching. I may end up buying some more for my other wrist or to bunch up a few, because I love the color. I would buy rings if they made them. Do they make them?? The box says it's 99% copper, but I have no way to test it out, because I'm not going to cut up my bracelet to see what's inside, but seriously, I can't believe that copper would be this cheap. /shrugDoes it work for arthritis? Who knows. I don't think there is enough scientific data yet to prove or disprove that this works. But I'll give anything a try to help my joint pain.Is this worth the money? In my opinion, yes, because as an accessory alone, this is a gorgeous bracelet that will not tarnish, like most other bracelets at this price. The plating is thicker than most jewelry at this price, and the color is gorgeous. It's a great thickness, not too flashy, not too thin or flimsy. I would have bought this at the jewelry store if I had seen it for sale :)Hope my review helps and happy shopping!

I received a sample of this product review and definitely give it 5 stars. I also have one from Mudder, and this one is far superior. First, it comes with batteries (I was really irritated that the Mudder one didn't come with them). Then there's a lot of care in the details and it's made really well, which is something I care about. Both parts of the thermomter have a convenient stand, the battery hatch is very secure (Mudder fell off), the design is pretty, and it feels good in my hands. I cook daily for 2 and this comes in soooooo handy to make the perfect roast, turkey, steak, anything. This is a must have for BBQ grill n00bs like me. DH loves the steaks and BBQ stuff.I'll update my review if anything changes. Hope my review helps and happy shopping!

I received a sample of this product for review and rate it 4 stars. It's not the best BT out there, but it's solid and pretty. I got the red ones and use it with my iPhone 6+ and MacBook Air. I really like that I can clasp the magnetic buds together and just wear it down to the gym and not have to worry about wires dangling while I'm working out.The talking quality is good - it's not as crisp as stock Apple headsets, but I could hear my DH well and vice versa. I can talk anywhere in the same room with my device, but when I start moving far into the kitchen (no door to the kitchen) and my phone is in the living room, the connection gets unstable.The music quality is excellent. Clear sound, good bass. However I can't seem to get a good soft low volume with my iPhone6+, but I can with my MacBook Air (if I adjust the volume slider in iTunes).This pairs as "DT55" and was ezpz to pair. The audio confirmations are a nice touch - a female voice tells you whether you are powering on/off, in pairing mode, calling, etc.THINGS I LIKE ABOUT THIS HEADSET:- Reliable clear connection for talking on the phone without dangly wires (all the cheap BT headsets I've tried have horrible talking quality)- Pretty- Can wear around your neck with magnetic earbuds for easy transport- Sound confirmations- Great music sound qualityTHINGS I'M NOT CRAZY ABOUT:- When my iPhone6+ is on the lowest volume setting, it's louder than I want it to be. This is fine for when I'm working out because it's noisy in the gym, but I won't wear this to listen to music on my phone while I'm at home (I'll use it connected to my MBA instead)- Talking sound quality is not the same as Apple stock headset (imo fair trade for lack of dangly wires)- Music sound quality is excellent but I prefer a more boomy bass sound (just my preference)- The smallest size ear buds fit me but are a little bigger than I want them to be (I'm a 5'9", 150 lbs woman, if that helps any). I've seen smaller buds come with other headsets- No Siri button (that I could figure out, if you figure it out, please tell me :)I don't always keep my review samples, but this is a keeper for working out at the gym, and listening to music/talking on phone while cooking. I posted pictures of the instructions, in case you're like me, and just throw them away and want to be able to look them up later.Oh, and just in case you're a gamer, these do not work with PS4 (most BT are vetoed by Sony, boo).Hope my review helps and happy shopping!

I received a sample of this product for review and give it a solid 4 stars for being good quality cheap cutting board. I cook daily for 2 and am always in need of cutting boards! One day I will treat myself to a gorgeous wood block (maybe Christmas?), but for now, I use the modestly priced ones on Amazon. My arsenal includes: Foodie's Kitchen Premium Silicone CB ($22), Dexas Lemon CB ($10), Yolomommies CB ($20 for 2), a small bamboo board, as well as those large flat white CB's that are made with similar materials as these Equinox International boards ($19 for 3). Each board has pro's and con's, but I'm still not satisfied and continue on my quest for that perfect cutting board.WHY I LIKE THESE CUTTING BOARDS:- dishwasher safe- solid (feels great to chop on)- grooves to catch all those liquids!! Can't believe all boards do not have this :L- super cheap (compared to all the others I've bought)- small and easy to pick up and use for a quick chop and toss in the dishwasherTHINGS THAT BUG ME:- doesn't stay firm on my counter unless I flip it upside down to the side without the catch grooves (what the heck man, oh right, cheap)- narrow board shape, I would prefer it to be more square, or just a lot larger! (small is nice, but so is BIG)- color, I would prefer this to be in turquoise, pink, yellow, or lime greenHope my review helps and happy shopping!

I received a sample of this product to review and give it 4 stars. I'm 5'9", 36A-32-40, and got the XXL, but I definitely should have got an XL (I'm usually XXL in Chinese clothing). I have to cinch this tightly for it to fit and it's still bulky at the top. It's still figure flattering but doesn't fit quite right. I may return this or donate it.There is a flap in the back so there is no peeking though the laces - see pic.I'm not sure why, but the laces are super long, please let me know if you know why, I don't know what to do with them :) They are the flat kind of laces - see pic. If you have an eye for details, you might want to restring this with a lovely black cord or lace instead of the shoe laces.There are 6 tabs along the bottom of the corset (see pic) which I'm guessing is for detachable garter belt strap grips? I'm not sure why there are 6 though.. but I've never used a garter belt before.Hope my review helps and happy shopping!

I received a sample of this product for review and give it 4 stars because I definitely like it!Make sure to order your Chinese size! They make clothing a lot smaller in China. If you ever visit, you would know why. Everyone is super skinny and small. Except Yao Ming. For reference, my waist is 32" and my hips are 40" and I got this in XXL. If they had it, a XXXL would have been baggy and comfy. I'm 5'9", and at this size, the knee band is tight and comes right at the base of my knees. Another inch of length would have been perfect for me. But if you're shorter than me, they should be the perfect length for you. The pants are slim on me, not baggy, but not tight either. The waistband is a little tight, but not uncomfortably. These are high waisted and I love that! (I hate how low waisted everything else is these days)These have nice sized pockets on both sides, but aren't super duper deep. They aren't as shallow as other Chinese clothing though. I can almost fit my entire large lady hands in them (see pic).There are two different laces, a black one in the top red band, and a white one in the lower grey band. As other reviewers mention, the laces are a little on the short side, so the black one pulls back into the waistband when you stretch it to put them on. I removed both laces, since the waistband is very tight and doesn't need them. If you want to keep them in, make sure to double knot the ends so they don't get sucked back in. The white pair of laces are longer though, and don't get sucked in for me. They are not as long as the stock photo though. I'm sorry I didn't take a picture to show how long the laces are. But on me, the black ones came out maybe an inch, and the white ones came out almost 3 inches.Hope my review helps and happy shopping!

I received a sample of this product to review and am happy to give it 4 stars. It looks just as pictured and is well made and comfortable to wear. I am 5'9", 36A-32-40, and got the XXL. I've ordered from China before, and usually get an XXL, but this was a little too big for what it is. I wish I had got an XL. I wanted there to be some room for the lacing to show, but I have to cinch this tightly for it to fit. But because it's a little big, it's super comfortable, I think I could wear this all day and still it looks so slimming on me. I love the way it makes my figure look! You can't see my pooch at all and I look slender :)I'm not sure why, but the laces are super long, please let me know if you know why. They are the round kind of laces (not the flat style of laces, which I got with a different corset). I posted pictures so you can see exactly what you are getting. If you have an eye for details, you might want to restring this with a lovely black cord or lace instead of the shoe laces.Hope my review helps and happy shopping!

I received a sample of this product to review and give it a sparkly 5 stars. These are really nice!!! Even my husband saw them and thought they were beautiful and worth buying. I love cooking and baking, so these decorative labels are an elegant option for my jars and containers. I was using painter's tape and marker before which looks so ghetto. The "chalk" marker erases easily and writes nicely, so you can use these over and over. Make sure to give the marker time to dry so it doesn't smudge. The marker isn't firm like a sharpie; the tip is soft so it looks like chalk on blackboard. The pack comes with 6 pages of 8 labels, too many for my kitchen.. hmm I could use these for other household containers I guess? Yes, crafts and makeup!I saw a reviewer mention that they thought it was hard to remove, but I didn't think so; they are thin, so you peel them off carefully. The directions mention it too.Hope my review helps and happy shopping!

I received a sample of this product for review and am happy to give it 5 stars. I have no complaints about this product at all. My favorite part is how much I love the electric blue color! But practically speaking, it's really lightweight, just as advertised, but when you use it you can feel that it's very sturdy and made very well. For reference, I'm a casual acoustic guitar player, and play mostly by myself, and sometimes in groups.Small note: It's in hassle-free packaging - the plastic seal flips open easily!Hope my review helps and happy shopping!!

This thing is an amazing invention!!! My husband loves it and can't stop raving about his awesome collapsible tripod. I've got him many different tripods over the years and this is his favorite. It conveniently collapses and is high quality.

I love this salt! I don't just use it for finishing, I use it for cooking. It has a great mild flavor and is easy to grab pinches of when cooking. I cook daily for 2, sometimes twice a day, and this tub will probably last me a few months, maybe half a year.I found it sort of strange that it doesn't have an air proof seal - the top arrives secured by a breakaway tab, but the cap fits loosely so air definitely gets in. If you use this slowly over time, make sure to stash Arm & Hammer wherever you stow this.Hope my review helps and happy shopping!

I love the way these taste! Black peppercorns are too spicy for my palate, and I'm a little sick of white pepper, since it's used so often in asian cooking (I'm Asian). These green ones are a nice blend in between (more similar to white pepper). I got quite a huge amount from this sample pack - I used a Unicorn mill and got a whole week's worth of pepper. I will definitely re-order this in bulk, now that I've tasted a few different kinds of peppercorn. Thanks Spicely for providing these perfect little samplers of organic peppercorns!
Good rechargeable batteries. I use them for game controllers, remote controls, portable shaver, etc.
It is what it is. I wish it was a little sudsier and less "thick" feeling, but I like that it's a 2-in-1 and has a nice smell :)
I like to use these for cleaning up my dog. The sheets are somewhat sheer but sturdy. I wish they were a little more solid, but they are good. I like the subtle scent too.

I really like these gloves a lot. I assumed these would be the same as a black pair I got from a Teikis BBQ set because they look the same, however these are much better! They are softer and more flexible than the other brand, and these fit me much better. I have size Large lady hands and I like the way these fit. They are not like regular gloves, and do not fit perfectly, but I imagine this has to be sized a certain way to fit all genders and hand sizes and shapes. I like the color too, it's just as pictured. I received this product for evaluation and review and use this regularly in my kitchen. I would pay extra for them to be available in different sizes and lengths, these are so much better than cloth mitts that I had been using in the past few decades.Hope my review helps and happy shopping!

EXCELLENT APPLE HEADSET KNOCK OFFS! I am soooooooo excited about these headsets! If you are a gamer, you know that the stock headsets that come with PS4 (or Xone) are so awful! Apple headsets are designed so well, that they are comfortable and have wonderful sound quality. Unfortunately Sony has made it so that the new Apple headsets create buzz when used. It is such a pain in the butt that Sony does not let most headsets, especially bluetooth, work with their console. UGH. But I am so excited because these headsets WORK PERFECTLY WITH PS4 GAMING!!! Can you tell that I am a game nerd?? Yes. A happy game nerd. These are almost exactly like Apple headsets too. I can only see two tiny minor differences: the cable is made of a slightly different material - this feels a little softer/tackier, and I can see a very small seam on the side of the earbuds (barely visible) where Apple ones do not. I got these free as a sample, but will definitely repurchase these since I know for sure that they work with gaming consoles. If you are a gamer, these are the best wired headsets to play with! They are comfortable to wear for hours, and the sound quality is excellent both for you and your party, the sound cancellation is great, yet you can tell if someone is trying to talk to you in the same room (it does not completely block out all sound, which is dangerous in my opinion). Just don't click the volume buttons! It makes an annoying sound to your party and they will get mad at you. Happened. Heehee. Adjust the volume through the Audio Settings.Hope my review helps and happy shopping!

I love my new selfie stick! I would never have thought to buy one, but I was offered a sample product to evaluate and review and am really digging it. I have really long arms, so I never wanted one of these, but they make such nicer pictures with the added distance. I don't know how it works, but you plug it into your iPhone (I have a 6+) and the button on the handle takes the picture! So awesome! Ha ha I am super excited about this stick, particularly because it's a pretty turquoise (my favorite color), and folds up so compact. It even comes with a carrying case too, although it's kind of linty, so I won't be using it. I really like the level of quality: it doesn't seem cheaply made to me, the button is easy to press, it telescopes well, and it holds my heavy iPhone 6+ securely.Hope my review helps and happy shopping!

I received this product for evaluation and review and am very happy with the product. I occasionally use vitamin C serums to help with wrinkles all over my face, neck and body (especially my neck, yuck!). I really like that this is a bit larger than the bottles I usually find in the stores, and it has no frills: Sometimes I've got serums that are diluted with fragrance and/or cream, but this seems like the real deal. My mom is old school and actually rubs lemons on her face. I admit she has amazing skin for a senior citizen, but I'm just not willing to deal with all the fuss of lemons, so Vitamin C serums are perfect for me! I like that this is not diluted with cream, but I would prefer this to have a nice scent, maybe of citrus or anything, then I would give it 5 stars.Hope my review helps and happy shopping!

This works fantastically in my Mini Cooper S (2008). I had one of these from a different brand, but my parents needed one, so I gave it to them and was in need for another. Fortunately I was provided a sample of this product for evaluation and review and it works exactly the same. I have no need for a CD player in my car and use my iPhone for music, so I don't mind that this sits in the CD player. In fact, I prefer the CD mount the most, because the front windshield mounts are illegal where I live, and I hate the ones that sit in vents or in cup holders.
