Every time I tried to watch a game the app would freeze after about 20 seconds and I'd get a ( completely bogus) message about our wifi signal being too weak.  We are able to stream in HD all the time without issue. Only this app has a problem with our wifi.
Our 7 year old (now 8) daughter loves these, and of course she's super cute when she's wearing them.  Quality is pretty much what you'd expect.  My only real issue is that I feel they're overpriced.

Good tea.  I like it just fine.  I'm trying a bunch of different English and Irish brands.  So far Lyons is my favorite, and this is probably my second.  I like a strong cup, and this does the trick.  Good flavor, and it's not overly tannic.  I will buy this again.

We have a 13 lb. Havanese.  We live on a relatively quiet circle with a view to the main road maybe 150 yards away.  Our dog tends to bark at any car or person he sees.  We don't want him to not bark at all, but we also don't want him disrupting our lives (and those of our neighbors) by constantly barking.  Ah, the conundrums of dog ownership.In looking at bark collars on Amazon, it became clear that there are two kinds - those with a remote and those which activate on their own.  I didn't want to worry about fumbling for a remote, plus batteries for two devices, so I started looking at the automatic collars.  The next thing you'll notice is that many of the products look exactly the same, but are branded differently and sold at different price points.  To me, this means that they are probably all made in the same factory and then purchased and sold by the various brands.  Who knows, many of the brands may be the same company.Anyway, we've been using this for almost three weeks now, and the difference is very noticeable.  The collar is supposed to give three warning beeps before giving a shock - and the shock will only happen if those three warning beeps happen within 30 seconds.  Something like that.From what I've observed, this is more or less accurate.  If he barks a series of quick barks, that will count as ONE, however, which I think makes sense.  Quieter "woofs" or growls will not activate the collar.  I'm fine with all of this.  Most of the time now, our dog barks once or twice and then stops, switching to quieter growls.  We then comfort and encourage him while he settles down.  I've only seen him get shocked once.We only put this on him during the day when we're home.  He has a little table by a window that he sits on so that he can look outside (he's too short to see out, otherwise), and that's become his favorite spot.  Most of the time he's fine, but now when he chooses to bark, it ends fairly quickly, rather than us having to deal with him barking incessantly for a few minutes at a time.We're still on the original battery after three weeks.  One more thing - the collar has activated twice while he was playing and shaking one of his toys with his head.  We just adjusted the sensitivity down a notch, and it's been fine since.For the price this thing can't be beat.  Quality seems to be fine so far.  The collar strap itself came with plenty of extra length.  Once we decided to keep the collar I cut probably 10 inches off.

If you've read Chandler's Marlowe novels and are looking for more, then this will fill that need.  I love Chandler.  He was an excellent writer who only gets less regard from the literary types because of the genre he worked in.  He had a gift for setting moods and setting scenes and adding details that feel natural and flesh out the picture in your mind.I also find that he keeps his stories fresh.  While they all do fit into the private detective genre, they feel different enough from each other that they don't start to feel samey at all - to me anyway.This is a quality book, and a real wrist-breaker at 1100+ pages.  Be advised that it has the stories from "Trouble is My Business", as well as "The Lady in the Lake" (all excellent), but otherwise I don't have any of the others in my other Chandler volumes.Great stuff.  If you love Chandler you'll love this.  I find that he scratches that itch for me much better than other famous authors of the same genre.  Probably because he was my first detective writer.

Overall I think the quality of this popcorn is very good.  The kernels are large and the bag isn't dominated by broken pieces, as some packaged popcorn seems (we got a gift basket recently with some kettlecorn from another gourmet company, and the bag was mostly just tiny, crumbled pieces).  A friend gave me this bag  (too spicy for them) and while I like it, I would never pay this price for popcorn, no matter how good it is.  That's my only issue, really.If you love popcorn more than I do, I think this brand seems to deliver top quality, so that's something to consider.

The tables that I've seen are a bit basic, and the ball physics are  a tad heavy and sluggish, but it's a pretty fun game.  I was hoping for something similar to the PS2's Flipnic (the greatest marriage of pinball and videogame ever), but it's still worthwhile.
